text: At first, I thought primeday was a failure.  I gave it another chance before bed. I was rubbing my bunion. I've had it so long I named it Paul. And here it is...the holy grail of prime day.  I'm thinking this was a failure of a marketing gag,  butnow?  I can regulate a bunion.  I must end this now, as a bunion needs regulating. Mount up!
Excellent tribute band. Not sure how they get away with using this name, as it's certainly not the same. As far as cover bands go, though, this is a good one.

This thing breaks ALOT!!!!. Normally, i wouldn't knock down too many stars for that, since it's 10 year olds playing on it, but, it's one of their big selling points.....you can dunk on this.These are rather small kids, and after just a few dunks with little to no pulling on the rim, the backboard cracks right up the middle.We are now on our 4th. Since they crack so quickly, within the return period we return it for exchange. I normally wouldn't do that, but I've seen how easily it breaks. So much emphasis on the rim, little emphasis on the backboard.par for the course with SKLZ products. After all of their overpriced training equipment, I'd assume they'd put more effort in to their toys.It's also extremely noisy. I guess that's just a given. I didn't knock a star for that. Just providing info.

Great value for headphones. I can't complain about a thing for this price. We use them for tablet video watching and some music while on the tablet. For that use, they are 5 stars. The dialogue is clear and music clarity is just fine. They won't blow you away, but for the price, it's perfect.

Nothing to complain about here. Very strong rope for what we do. Lots of tubing and with multiple people at a time. Dries quickly, stores easily and has not fraying. Still looks brand new. Best value out there.

Quite possibly the best glasses I have put on my face.First, I'll just do a Costa overview.....they're the best active, outdoor, watersports sunglasses out there. When they say phrases like "lens technology", they mean it. I love another brand too. I won't say their name, but it rhymes with Schmaui Schmims. The Costa blow these out of the water (pun partially intended).These glasses though look amazing and fit so well. They're a very large fit. I have 3 other Costas. The Coba is a very big fit but these fit even large. The thing is, they fit sung on the ears so they stay in place. I don't even worry about wearing a retainer on these.....although I do, and you should too.

I bought one for my wife. It didn't pick up a single thing. No problem. We understand there can be a few bad devices here and there. We returned it and got another one. Went through all instructions and users' online advice. Still did not pick up a thing. Not worth it to try again. Went with another brand.

I want to love these, I really do. I agree with most of the 5 star reviews here. What they brag about is accurate. Probably the best sound you're going to get for $25 anywhere. I'd love to take the time to rag on the mass produced sheep-fed marketing of other brands.....I won't say their name but it rhymes with Schmeats and Schmose.....but I digress. I don't know if the wood is a marketing gimmick or if it lends itself to the great sound, but these do sound good. Very full sound for ear buds. Very little noise leak as well. I have no problems with comfort in the ear. They look great as well. The cloth is a nice touch, but that may be where the problem is.  The noise created from the wires is insanely loud. I work at a desk, and do not move a lot. If I move my face just slightly, it sounds like howling wind blowing in to the ear buds. It's the same concept of a string between two dixie cups.  Everything that is great about these is completely lost. I nearly dropped it to one-star, but I thought the other qualities shouldn't give it an F. I also considered a higher rating, thinking "it's just one problem". I then realized that one problem makes these almost unbearable to use. It's like having the most amazing sunglasses, with absolute clarity and perfect vision.......buuuuut they keep falling off your face. The product's great qualities are defeated by the one down side.

it takes a lot to get 5 stars for an album. Honestly, just a basic 5-star rating for music is difficult. There is no possible way to be objective.Overall, this album does two things. It reaches for a new sound, and then a few of them focus on the classic style of Zac Brown. These country songs will grow as live songs. There is also a fun song called Mango Tree on here. It is a good mix of island style with Big band. I'm a big fan of this one. I think it shows a good stretch of genre while still "keeping it real" (as much as I hate that phrase).  "heavy is the head" is a lot of fun. Even without Cornell on lyrics, it absolutely sounds like a remake of old 90's rock songs. It sound like a fun experiment in the studio. Nothing wrong with an artist wanting to try something different after so many years.I have no problems with the reach they are doing for the rock/grunge/alternative style. It is great. I've seen a few people complain that "some of these songs sound like Kenny Chesney and Jimmy Buffet"......I'm surprised that they're surpised! (See "toes, island song, where the boat leaves from, etc.). I don't understand how anyone can be shocked at the "island" sounds on this album, if they've listened to any other Zac Brown album.Typically I like an album that has a congruent feel to it, but I do enjoy the complexity and variation on this album. Some call it "confused". I see what they mean, but I call it potpourri.Now, as you can see, I'm happy with this album. i find it fun....but let's get to this first track, "Beautiful Drug". This song is so bad, that when I put this album on my digital devices, I left it off. As far as I'm concerned, it's not part of this album. It is absolute garbage. If you're a teeny bopper, or someone that just like club junk sounds, then this song is for you. The lyrics are sloppy and uninspired, there is massive auto tune, and simple electronic bass drops. This had to be written in studio, with no inspiration other than to have the producer have some fun with some new equipment. It is so bad, that I am nearly convinced that Zac Brown Band did this song sarcastically just to make fun of that genre of "music" (yes, I use quotes, because I have a hard time calling that stuff "music"). I know I referenced music being "subjective" earlier, but this track isn't music. I really hope the band comes out and goes "gotcha", or at least, "we just wanted to do something different just for the sake of something different". I really hope this isn't a song to appeal to the mindless masses, or to get royalties on some tv show or advertisement."Tomorrow Never Comes" is very similar as well.  I didn't remove the song like I did "beautiful drug", because I do like how it opens, but it mixes in to this club, boy band junk.  You hear it coming too, at the second verse. You hear that basic boring drum beat, then you hear some banjo picking, and you're provided a little hope. After the first chorus though, forget it. It almost gets into this dubstep stuff and becomes a basic stadium chant.  It reminds me of Aviici's "Wake Me Up" . This guy with a computer brings in a soulful singer and a great guitarist, drags his mouse around a little and calls it his song. I enjoy  the acoustic version of Tomorrow Never Comes, I think.Overall, it's a great album. I like the variation, thus the name. Remove "beautiful drug", and I'd go 4.5 stars.

If I could give 5.5 stars I would.......but not for the reason you'd think. Basically, this thing works so good, it didn't fit the nozzle that comes out of the end of my dipstick, but I was still able to make it work with no problems. I'll explain.I have a 1987 or maybe 88 Mercruiser 165, Alpha One, 3.7 liter engine in my boat. Based on the maintenance book from the prior owner, the oil had not been changed since 2005. Based on the oil that came out, that seemed very true :)If you don't understand how this thing works, I'll try to explain. At the end of the hand pump is a screw-on nozzle, much like a female hose end. This screws on to the dip stick. Not all engines are the same, but it appears the Mercruisers and some others are threaded, possibly for this reason??? I don't know for sure....The problem is, there is also a small nozzle that sticks out of the top of those threads, so not only must you thread it around the area where the dip stick is, you must also have this nozzle fit inside the hole inside the pump. That is where my problem came in. The nozzle on the engine was bigger than the hole in the pump.Well, it appears to be brass, so I figured I'd just grind out the hole, make it fit the nozzle and then be able to get it to the threads.After 20 minutes of brass shavings everywhere, I didn't get it exact, and couldn't get it all the way down. I actually only got it on there a few millimeters, but it was on that nozzle so tight, I thought I'd try. It created a perfect vacuum anyway, and extracted the oil. It took very minimal effort, and you could feel the oil come up in to the tube as the pump got a little tighter.I do recommend wearing a glove for one hand, because you should be heating up your engine and oil before doing this....the pump does get hot with that hot oil coming through it.Once you get to the end, the pumping gets much lighter, but I thought I'd keep going. There were only a few drips, but I figured try a few more, and suddenly a much smaller stream comes out again. This tells me this pump really creates a vacuum and digs down deep. I extracted 5 quarts, plus what was in the filter. This only holds 5.5 quarts, so with oil loss, I'm quite sure I got all of it.Pretty impressive for an item that didn't even fit. Once I can fully grind out the hole to the correct size, I'm sure my next oil change will be even easier.Overall, very easy contraption, especially if it fits properly. The pump goes on the engine block where the dip stick is. Attach the included hose to the top of the pump. Put the hose in a bucket and start pumping. The oil flows within just a couple pumps.

I really don't get all the reviews. I've seen people say this before and I discounted it but "these reviews have to be fake".  I have speaker wire from radio shack that are better quality.  Normally, I wouldn't care about quality feel if it didn't impact its designed purpose, but the entire 5 pack had the same sound problem.  Just horrible hums and clicks anytime the wire is slightly bumped.  To check i used old cables of mine and they were perfect.  I also used a neighbor's. No problems. I then took these wires to the neighbor's and the same issues happened.  I guess I'm stuck with them.  They get one more chance at a small venue and then they go in the garbage. They are totally useless for their intended purpose. The fact that it is all 5 means a bad batch or just low quality.  It cannot just be me.

Let me first state, rating this ladder very difficult. As a multi-position ladder, you really have to rate each position.Most of your 5-star ratings seemed to have come from people who were buying this to be used as every BUT an extension ladder. I bought it so I could have an extension ladder, but have everything else I need as well. The extension ladder is really just a "by-product" and I do not believe it was its original intent.I cannot compare the ladder to the other big brands. I hear they are much sturdier as an extension. This one is not sturdy at all. We did not extend it all the way, just so we could test it (thanks to all the great reviews who advised me to test it first). We figured we would try it on grass first, as that provides the best grip. about halfway up the ladder you meet the first hinge. A couple more rungs up is the second "hinge", or where the extension portion extends from. These 2 sections tend to give quite a bit of bend or "play". If facing the wall, it is VERY sturdy left to right. Back and forth (to and away from wall) it is not. Once you reach the first hinge area, you're maybe 10 feet up in the air. No big worry there, but as you step up one more step, you feel a little more "free", and with a bending ladder like that, you do not feel safe, even with someone holding the bottom.For my needs, it really isn't a 5-star item, but I'm not reviewing it from that point of view. I hated docking that much because it is a great ladder. If you're complaining it is too heavy, then stay on the ground, it is not that heavy at all. Stick to kitchen stands made to reach on top of the fridge then. If you have difficulty lifting less than 50 lbs, you should hire someone to do things for you. Docking an item because it weighs precisely a advertised makes no sense.As far as the other positions, it is extremely sturdy and very versatile. The way it folds up is very portable as well. I would say if you weigh less than 200 lbs and feel comfortable at heights even with a little wobble ( I hear people who work building high rises have to deal with swaying and wind, so maybe they're ok), then this is a steal. Not being able to use this as an extension is what killed it for me. If I planned on using the other positions more often, I would definitely keep this thing.I do recommend laying it flat and extending it. The design isn't the same as most extension ladders.As an extension ladder, it is a 2 star item. Mostly for my needs and comfort level. I don't think an extension ladder should move as much as this thing does.For every other position it is a 4.5 star ladder. With that, I had to go with 3 stars, although I was inbetween that and a 4 star overall. The limitations in the extension portion were pretty detrimental.

This thing had so many good reviews....not just by consumers, but on most of your major,respected electronics sites.I wanted to like it, and although it would take a lot for me to drop a big bluetooth speaker to 2 stars, this one was actually close. I continue to try out, compare and use these speakers to determine which one I like the most, and this one almost immediately went back in the box.It is loud. Sound carries, but it just not smooth. I have no idea how to explain it. There is no real depth and clarity to the music. Thus far I have used the Bose soundlinks, big jambox, the UE Boom, this boombox, CreativeROAR, and a few other off brands. This one reminded me more of the Big Jambox, just blaring and loud with no finesse. Like I said, it gets loud, and I like its portability. it is like an 80's dual tape deck. The bottom is rubberty and I did like that. No issues with connectvity. But, I'm not spending $200+ for a nice looking bluetooth speaker, I'd really like some effort put in to the sound. I really think I need to try out some of these Sony Models some of you are talking about.  ......After going through all of the trendy brands anyway. So far, out of the trendy models, the Creative ROAR is by far my favorite. This one might be right near the bottom with the Big Jambox.  (keep in mind, sound is as subjective as colors and smells)

UPDATE 3/4/15(original review still down below) - Funny, I don't even recall reviewing this thing when I first got it. I returned it pretty quickly back then. Well, here I am, I bought it again. Why? Because I bought a boat and I don't feel like paying for a new marine radio with bluetooth and this speaker seems good for boating and I can pair it with another UE product, which will be nice while out anchored, floating and relaxing. As I mentioned before, I did like the sound of this speaker, fairly well, just some strange issues going on....but you can read those below in my original post. It seems this new one doesn't really have all of the same issues as I had mentioned in my original review. The sound doesn't seem to "fade in and out" as it did before. Still no impressive bass, but that's OK, shouldn't be expected really. Jack Johnson songs don't need a big "drop". haha!  It is still very obvious where the sound is coming from, but I think only a couple of higher end speakers really dominate in this aspect.  I am using the app more this time, and I really like those features.Here is why i really wanted to post a review (even though I forgot I already reviewed). I really just wanted to post some of my battery tests for others to check out, and for me to update for you. I also wanted to make sure everyone knows how easily one can take this speaker apart and replace the battery. I know Logitech says you cannot, but they provide "battery disposal instructions". It gets put back together just as easily. A replacement battery is easy to find. I really wish I could find a battery with much more capacity for it though.So here is my current battery test:I received the item at a 50% charge. I charged it to 100%. I did not measure how long this took, but it was less than an hour, or at about an hour. I used the stock cable and wall adapter into a standard wall outlet.The speaker is turned up to full volume. My Samsung Galaxy Note Tablet is the music source, also up full volume. I put the music on shuffle, so it has a variety of Live Joe Bonamassa albums, a live AC DC album, Cole Swindell album, live Black Crowes album, Zac Brown, Dave Matthews Band, live Led Zeppelin, live Queen, and some more recent pop music (just so you have an idea of what kind of music was played) I have the equalizer at the "bass" setting:- At exactly one hour at full volume, the charge went from 100% to 70%- At exactly 2 hours at full volume, the charge went from 70% to 50%  (even at full volume, this is a little frightening)-At exactly 3 hours at full volume, the charge went from 50% to 30% (clearly, the product only quotes multiple of 10)- within approximately another 40 minutes the battery was completely deadTotal battery life, if wanting full volume = 3.5 to 3.75 hours.We'll have to see what it takes to get this seemingly intentionally misleading "15 hours of battery life". Although some people do mention outstanding battery life at more "bedroom, close range volumes".  I put it at full blast on purpose obviously. I assumed a 15 hour advertised rating would get at least 6 hours on a charge at full blast. After it charges, I'll test again. For most of you, full volume will not be used often.Now, it's starting to feel like buying a top of the line computer that won't connect to the internet..... Greatly diminishes its value. At least for me. I realize, this is a "YMMV" situation, and some people don't require full volume. With it being on a boat, I certainly would. We'll see what happens with 50% and 25% tests coming soon.50% volume tests.  The lowest to highest volume is 15 clicks. So I lowered it 7 clicks. The rest of the set up was the same.Charged to 100%From 8:10 pm to 10:10 pm stayed at 100% charge11:10 pm was at 90%So maybe we do get to this 15 hour mark. 50% is great for a hotel room but not outdoors. I'm curious about how long it will go at 50%.  I'll bump it up a little tomorrow and see how it goes. Then eventually redo full-blast again.A few days later, i tried it at 75%. I knocked the volume down 4 clicks. We got right back up in to battery draining mode. My 50% test ended, because I think it may have lasted over 10 hours at the rate it was running. Once we got to 75% though, the battery started dropping much like it does at 100%.I think the moral of the story is this....if you want to use it indoors, buy it. If you want to use it outdoors or in very large rooms, look in to a Braven.ORIGINAL REVIEW:I won't spend too much time with a really lengthy review. I will just give you what I like what I didn't like and go from there.I like the shape, the build, all that good stuff. It is all very rubbery feeling, and I like that. It is packaged in what is akin to a bank teller tube. It is about as big around as a standard coffee mug and about a foot long. It stands up well on either end, and even lays on the side without rolling around too much. I actually found laying it on its buttons creates a different sound; a bit more depth. It is extremely loud, and has decent bass. Nothing that will hit hard. I have not yet tested about battery life or battery issues.(but see the update above now)Here is what I don't like. I like a smooth depth, that still has a lot of clarity in each instrument playing. This doesn't have that. I noticed several times, it was as if a certain instrument was missing for a second. When turned to full volume, it has a somewhat distorted sound. Almost like a child giving you a raspberry (I really have no way to explain that any better, haha).  I also noticed it was dropping bluetooth signal or something. Suddenly, it started playing from my phone's speaker. That may have been an issue with the phone as well, so no immediate blame there.I did notice my tablet seems to offer much better bluetooth quality sound....which I don't really understand how that is possible except for the built-in equalizer on the tablet vs. the phone.I like to test out the speakers with primarily rocking country music, as that seems to capture a lot of the sound spectrum from highs on the bluegrass style instruments, to the electric solos, and the typically baritone voices. I also like to test how far classical music will travel, and I like to toss on some "old school" 90's rap (sheesh, is 90's old school already) as it has a lot of dropping bass. It failed mostly in the dropping bass sounds of the 90's rap. It carries rather well, and is rather loud. As mentioned earlier, it seemed to miss a few instruments with a full country band playing, but it wasn't continuous. One thing I did not like, and I compare this to the Creative ROAR, is I knew precisely where the sound was coming from.  Yes, it was loud, yes it filled the room, but it was obvious it came from one location. The Creative Roar and the Bose soundlink series do seem to win in that fashion. I will say that overall, this is a great portable speaker. Thus far, I would only purchase the Creative ROAR over it. The higher end models, such as the UE boombox, Bose soundlink, Big Jambox aren't my favorites mostly because of personal tastes (the jambox is too "blaring", and that deep sound of the BOSE is too "manufactured" for my tastes). If this model was a bit cheaper, I think it may have done better, but at $200, I think $50 of it went towards packaging.

07/29/2014 - We have used the tent once. We had room for a queen and a full air bed. 3 kids, 2 adults and still plenty of room for a cooler and walking around room. It did well, but it only drizzled that trip. We have had the tent set up in the yard the past 2 days for "testing" purposes. It has done well so far, except for one thing....the pole snapped on the rainfly awning. It was not that rough of a storm; not much wind but that "great big ol' fat rain". Coleman informed me that first, I had to purchase a new pole. I explained I just got this on 06/25/14. He then said that these are not made for inclement weather. I told him, "I'll pretend you made that up and it is not true at all....you're trying to tell me, a tent, which is designed to protect campers from elements is not designed for inclement weather. Does coleman expect this used on sunny days only?" he said he was sorry he worded that wrong "coleman warrant doesn't cover inclement weather" is what he meant. I told him I was pretty sure that was worse. He agreed to send a new pole kit, but the durability is in question about that pole at least. I do not think the other poles would hold the tent up well on a windy day. So far I'm only docking one star for having to drag customer service through what they SHOULD do, their warranty deficiency, and for lack of sturdiness thus far.I will update as time goes on. I really have a feeling more stars will come off.08/04/2014 update - After we removed the largest red extension pole, which holds up the main dome area, the elastic inside had detached itself. They sell kits for these, but after only a couple of uses and being handled appropriately, this shouldn't be happening. On another note, the tent held up well for 2 days. I make sure to stake things down properly, so that really does help. It rained a little bit, but wasn't too much of a storm and we had a lot of tree coverage, so not a downpour. Either way, everything stayed dry.

I place these on the back of the headstock right where the neck meets. Place the triangle part of the pick holder up in between your 1st and 6th string tuning peg and it is a great hiding spot for picks. This one had a little difficulty staying in place compared to others and it is a bit wider, but it does the job.

It is really hard to review strings, as these are all personal preference for feel and even tone. Various combinations of guitars to amps, can also be impacted by adding a different string in to the mix. I like these on my les paul. I use the cobalts on the other electrics I have.  I use my les paul for more chord play than scale play, so these do well with that. But, that is just an opinion and is extremely subjective. 5 stars for me, may not be for you. They last, sound stays good well after standard string changing time. Haven't had one pop yet even.

Excellent price for such a minor upgrade. I have a couple high end guitars, but I am not a person that prides myself or takes assurance in products just because they're expensive. $$$ doesn't always translate to the best quality, although we're told to think that. So with my lower end guitars I've purchased lately, I put a little handy work in to them, and change a few parts, such as this for $17. These make a massive difference in my Epiphone Jumbo. The clarity, sustain and strength are easily noticeable, even to an amateur ear. These fit very well in the EJ200ce for anyone who may have that guitar and is looking. It has a very tight fit, which is needed, as the bridge plate will start to wear more and more in the holes. Someone complained about them being "ugly", but I just can't imagine what type of artistic impression one would try to make with a tiny bridge pin. I've seen the fancy natural bone pins, and I'm not sure you can tell a difference unless you know to look for it.

Works fine, heats up. One star removed for the simplest thing, and maybe it is too picky; but, there is no light to know if it is on. We bought it and plugged it in, not ready to use it yet, just placing it somewhere. My fiance then goes to move it the next day and it was already hot, meaning it had already been on. Simple fix, if you really want to know if it is on, just cut off the switch and wire in one with a light. No big deal. That alone wouldn't reduce a star, but the color wasn't represented well. Ours is very green. The initial picture had a nice gray look to it. I just looked again and there is a 2nd picture which reveals its "green-ness". Again, not a big deal, but add those together, and it is worth a star. A very very picky star.

I really hate when people rate clothes purchased online based on the sizing, but I will say, this shirt was so incredibly slim that I nearly docked a star. If you knew how much I hated when people did that, you'd understand how small this was. But, I digress, and I will rate the shirt. The material is amazing. It feels much like an oxford-style dress shirt, but has a stretchy feel to it. It is really cool. If you order the tall, it is a very long shirt for those of us 6'4" and above, I'm sure it will suffice. The colors on this shirt are much more "minty" and bright than in the picture, which I really liked. So, like I said, if you have prime and have free returns, get a couple sizes when you order, but be prepared for it to be rather slim. I honestly thought when I were to go back and check the tag that it was going to be 2 sizes smaller than I ordered, and I honestly wouldn't be surprised if this particular shirt I received was just cut wrong.

First, this thing seems fairly sturdy to me. Seems like decent quality, and as long as you take care of it, it should last. I bought mine for more of a decorative piece though, and I don't intend to let it sit outside a lot. The grill stays on the patio. With that said, I did buy it because the picture is green. I wanted a green one. I have had Amazon send me 2 now, and they are both black. Amazon has apologized and given me a credit of $10 to my account for the mistake. Maybe if a few people do this, they'll get it fixed. I'm sure its not Amazon's fault at all, but the supplier.

First like my title says, I was shocked at how good this cheap fake leather feels. It stands very sturdy. The added stylus holder is nice. The cut outs are sufficient. The pen is slightly tucked away but not bad. The swivel feature works well and props up nicely.The speaker cut outs do not harm sound.  I am listening on low volume now and going back and forth with no problems.  The button for the swivel is a little loose but I like that. I like that I can simply remove the note from the folder without removing the covered part entirely.Overall the best inexpensive option out there.

What is good about it first....Currently I am typing on it, so it touch response is good. It doesnt mess up the Note touch feature. In contrast though the pen does stick a little more. But like someone else mentioned, you may not like feeling like you are writing on glass to begin with. Personally, I dont like writing on this screen protector. It feels too rubbery to me. I didnt mind writing on the glass. This removes the smoothness for sure.Another good then bad......It offers excellent glare reduction. In contrast though, it does fuzzy up the picture substantially.It is very thick which offers great scratch protection, but again reduces the smoothness when writing.Overall my initial gut feeling was disappointment but I realize its not so much a fault but a preference. The pprotection level and glare reduction is good, I just wish it wasnt so rubbery. I was going to do 4 stars even though I was slightly disappointed, but the fuzziness took away another star. I have 2 notes here, side by side, and it is very noticeable.
This developer did not work to accommodate updates to operating systems. Does not work on any android that has Ics or above.

Not much to say about this product, other than it didn't break and it looks great. The design is beautiful and well worth the $ you pay for it. It makes a great gift, so find your favorite team and give one away.

I actually love this little football and play with my son quite a bit with it. I like it because it is small, and use it to help him throw a baseball better. Since it is small, I can help him learn to use his wrist and fingers and finish his throws like throwing a dart. I know it wasn't designed for that, but it makes for good practice. Other than that, its a great looking football and very well constructed.

This is actually my 2nd review of this item....I'm guessing from another seller, because its not showing on this page. That first review was not a good one because the first bag completely fell apart at the seams. I had explained in that review that my son was in 2nd grade at the time, and that means, his bookbag was not filled with much. I contacted Amazon about it, and they sent him another one. I updated that review a bit and now, I am adding another one since I am given that opportunity. My son has been using the replacement bag the latter half of second grade and now, 4 months in to 3rd grade. And it is going well. No problems. Great storage, and knowing I will get great replacement service from Amazon is wonderful.

First off, I would like to explain that this may be an ongoing review. I just bought this item last night, and being a person who understands electronics, I usually wait for my reviews. This time, I figured I would start the review, and then I can come back and edit. Therefore, you may see some updates or changes below.Second, don't let my initial 4-star rating fool you. I was torn on how to rate this product for the value of what you pay, or vs. other speakers. I decided to put this up against much larger bluetooth speakers, and I think it speaks volumes that a $40 item is 4-stars compared to $150 bluetooth portable speakers.I'm going to start with what most peopls call "cons", but I'm just going to note them as minor nuisances-The cord is only about 6 inches long....BUT...its your standard android type charger. Since I'm a Samsung Galaxy boy, myself, I have a ton of these cables. It is currently charging with an old LG cable I found-Some have mentioned a slight hum in the speaker. This is pretty common with most Bluetooth devices. This goes away when you start playing music. There have been some that said, "once you hear the hum, you always hear the hum". I purposely turned the music all the way down just to hear the hum. I listened to it at my desk for 5 minutes, and then played music again. I don't notice any hum, and I am TRYING to hear it.  So, although there is, in fact, a hum, I'm not noticing it when in use.-Its not a great bass machine, but again, is this really a con? Do people buy a prius to drag-race? Cannot really hold that against this machine, so again...that is why I said a "minor nuisance" (and that is a stretch)-The power switch is on the bottom-There is an extreeeeeemly loud series of beeps every time you turn it on. You know its coming, so you can try to shield it. Its still somewhat annoying, and not good for starting up in quiet places.  There may be a way around this, I just haven not figured it out.-The controls on the speaker itself are a little slow to respond, but honestly, who is going to use this? It is only a minor delay anyway. I just tested them to see what they were. I control everything from my phone.I tried this thing out approximately 10 times in Bed Bath and Beyond. I kept messing with their display and was rather disappointed that I couldn not try my own music on their display. So, that kept me from trying it at first. Plus, I am always concerned that the display model is set up differently and it just won't sound as good at home in larger rooms...which takes me to my pros, and what I love about this (so far)-The sound fills a room. Its not that massive BOSE sound, but its pretty close in how it fills a room. I listen to a lot of 90's acoustic rock and that stuff sounds incredible. Now, if you get to some of the newer club-rap type of music, there is not a lot of power, but it doesn't sound distorted either. Still sounds good, it just is not going to blow your hair back and rattle windows-I had the phone about 15 feet away from the device and it played beautifully. What is funny is Pandora played clearer than my recorded music...here is why that is a pro. Because, I realized a lot of my recorded music is garbage from the internet and typically poor recordings, which leads me to believe that this device really picks out the clarity of songs. Much like a good set of headphones might actually make some of my bad recording actually sound bad because the headphones are so clear.-The construction is very sturdy- (pending a battery test)- any standard charger that comes with most android phones can charge this.-line in that will work with non-USB devices-packaging is actually very nice. I will keep this for storage.If you are skeptical about buying this, just buy it from a place that has easy returns. Thus far, I have no desire to return it. As far as performance goes, it is a solid 5-star product for the price. Again, I gave it four stars only because its slightly not as powerful as some bigger, more expensive speakers. I realize that may not be a fair assessment, but, again, I think it speaks more to the product that I give it 4 stars in comparing it to the larger portable Bluetooth speakers. I think the only way I would have a problem with this speaker in the future, is if for some reason performance decreases, or I find that the battery lasts a very short amount of time.  I will update this, if needed, in the future. If you don't hear from me, that means its still doing well :)

There is no sense in paying this money for a piece of pipe. Three stars for the idea though. A trip to any hardware store and the same concept can be made with a $7 pipe and batting grip. If you find scraps you can do it cheaper. Funny what people will pay for because of pretty colors and marketing.

For what these products are designed to do, it doesn't matter if you have the larger hit stick that is much more expensive or this one. They are both for hand-eye coordination, and the added length provides no additional assistance. In contrast, the red/shorter stick actually seems to have an advantage in that it is a bit stiffer and has a more dense feel when you hit it. This is great for younger hitters who are still developing wrist strength, as they have to swing through this with a slight bit of effor more than the larger stick.

Original review: I had no issues with this little case at all. It is perfect for the price. Fits perfectly and doesn't add much bulk at all.Edited review: I have to come back and add to my review now. If you get the white/clear case, it won't stay white/clear for long. I'm not sure if its oxidation or what, but it is turning very very brown. The case still works as indicated above, but its starting to turn color, much like an old newspaper would. I had to remove a couple of stars because of that.

I wasn't going to worry about reviewing this movie on Amazon, as it will have plent I'm sure. But, after reading the 1-star morons who posted about how Amazon treated them, yet think the product is great, I thought I should counteract their idiocy. How do people not grasp this is a product review, not a place to voice your gripes about Amazon? Saying a movie is great, then giving it a 1 star because your feelings are hurt by Amazon isn't an accurate review. Just like in everything else, we have to figure in skewed statistics because of the dummies.Its a 5 star movie, great quality blu ray, blah blah blah. If you like action and superheroes this movie has set a high precedence for action.

Considering I think paying $20-35 for a case is absolute idiocy, this case gets five stars for its price in porportion to its quality.The inner piece is plastic and it comes in two pieces that snap together around the phone. The black part is rubber that covers the two pieces once snapped together. There is a small plastic kick-stand that comes out of the back, but is honestly a little flimsy, so you do have to be careful. Also, its not very wide, so the phone can teeter a little on it.Headphone jacks and the chargers that come with this phone fit perfectly. (Please note: I also have an LG charger that is much fatter on the end and does not fit through the cut-out holes).All of the opening in the case were accurately placed.Overall, the case is very sturdy, and is perfect for what a case needs to do. The plastic may feel a little flimsy but it has rubber around it...who cares.If you want an otterbox but feel like its a complete waste of money and don't feel like following the sheep....you'll be very happy with this.

My son is in 2nd grade....he carries no books, only a small lunch sack and a 1 inch binder daily. No weight at all. The entire seams just pulled apart from the top of the bag. So much so, you don't even need to unzip it to put anything in it. We bought this in December and by May it was falling apart. I have contacted Amazon, because I really liked the bag and want to keep using it, and they politely shipped me another one and provided a return label for the product. Hopefully this other one will last longer, but it does not seem like a good product. Thankfully, Amazon provided good customer service beyond the return period.

This case has a very interesting look to it and does not add a lot of bulk.Essentially it is a 2 piece item. What you can't see in the picture is the black part is just a rubber case. The white part is a piece of plastic that fits into an area that is molded out within the rubber casing.I actually like the rubber case, and may use it on its own.The Plastic piece has some difficulty fitting properly as it is not as pliable as the rubber part obviously. Some of the molded areas around the charging port and around the earspeaker area can be a litte difficult to fit perfectly when putting them on the phone.The biggest issue I have noticed is the charger.....if the charging wire has a big bulky end, it will NOT fit. I have an old LG wire that has a bulky end and I can't use it on this phone with this case on.Other than that, its a great case for a great price. I think if it were just once piece it would make it even better.

The company has been informed of this already. The NOOK tablet requires a more powerful charger. The connector may look the same, but the power needed is not. Standard USB cable into you computer won't even charge the NOOK tablet because the computer will not put out the necessary power. A standard car charger adapter will not charge up the NOOK tablet, because they are not powerful enough. Do not be fooled. What is sad is that they have been made aware of this and they keep in on here anyway. I'm sure the case is great though. Most of their other stuff is great "dollar store" type items.
The Nook Tablet requires a specific charger type (amps and plug size). This is not it. This company has been contacted several times and they are aware of this, but they refuse to remove this item.

The good -  the construction of this little board is great. Very compact.The bad -  the logo you see has several issues. First its just a very cheap sticker. Second that cheap sticker isn't even placed properly. It not on evenly. Third its much bigger than shown. That may sound good but if you look it just overlaps on the yard markers. It doesn't center up nicely. Really makes it pathetic and trashy looking. Very little pride went into to "decorating" this. The picture online is a horrible misrepresentation of the logo.More bad - the bags aren't that nice red and blue that they picture. Nope. It's khaki and brown. Really goes well with the team colors......all those brown and light brown teams out there. Again, pathetically misrepresented in the picture.Unfortunately I didn't buy this just for a desk top cornhole board....think about it, you're buying it as a decoration. Therefore the construction isn't really important, what it looks like is. And poop colored bags, an uneven sticker, and a sticker overlapping the design of the boards really ruined this for me.Taking more pride in a product would make sense. I'm going to ask for it to be done as represented and if it cannot ill just return it.
Looks good on my Braves-mobile. Went on easily and does what it says it should. I wouldn't hesitate on buying it.
This is going to look incredible once I get it framed. My son is very excited. Very eye-popping when you actually get it. Looks much better in person.

The Corsair 1000 Watt Fully Modular PSU seems to be well built and works beautifully providing clean, safe, consistent voltages without making any noise!  Great Power at a great price provides incredible value and from a company that has been making components for many years.  I highly recommend Corsair Power Supplies.
Ended up not needing this converter/mount but it is built well and I kept it just in case I need it down the road.
Can be a little weird at times, but this show was great entertainment.  I couldn't stop watching it once I started.  SyFy, Drama, Mystery...this show has it all.

Got this for a great price.  Really enjoyed the series... though it could be rather predictable at times.  The stories are pretty good and the performances by the actors is top notch.  There's a reason Burn Notice lasted 7 seasons... check it out if you like action/drama/suspense

Super easy to install!  This film makes your window look like it's steamed up.  Impossible to see through, but you can see whether a person is standing outside of your window.  Cuts down on the glare from the sun and provides privacy.  I am very happy with it.

I agree with many reviews... The 3 speeds of this fan are all pretty much identical.  The fan is really really really noisy and moves the air rather well... but I have actually had some plastic fans that seemed to move more air. This fan is very heavy and will not tip over and it looks just great.  Should never need to replace this fan as it is built to last a lifetime.
Killed my mice.  The filthy little things.
I used this for padding to keep from damaging the finish on some speakers that I placed in a clamp style mount.  It works great.  VERY sticky!  This stuff won't come off once you put it somewhere.

There is a reason this is pretty much the number one rated CPU cooler in it's price range in the world... it works!  Easy to install, and quiet this will give you lots of life out of your CPU without breaking the bank.  Be sure to make sure your case is deep enough as this cooler does take up quite a bit of room, but will not cover up your Memory slots like some other options.
I have 4 of these drives and every one of them runs quietly and stays nice and cool.  I got them for a great price and cannot find any reason to not recommend them for your storage solution.

Nothing special about these cables!  I was expecting some nice thick cables that make me believe they are going to handle massive amounts of data... these are not.  They are very thin cables (the picture is *very* deceiving)  As far as I can tell, they are working fine, but I prefer the thicker cables that tell me the wires inside are thick enough to handle 4K etc.  The connectors do not fit tightly into the HDMI ports.  Kind of disappointed.  For the price and for folks that don't really need "the best" I think these are an okay option though.

This is a low end board without a doubt.  I am using it for a Home Entertainment Build I did.  It works fine.  The ASUS BIOS is wonderful.  I learned a valuable lesson though... when installing Windows 7 - 10 with this board, be sure to boot into UEFI!!!  (That's 8 hours of my life I will never get back).  I am not using any overclocking on this board so I can't speak to it's performance when it comes to OC, but for what I am using it for it seems to run smooth and steady.  No complaints thus far.  For the price I got this board for I can't complain too much.  I wouldn't recommend this board for a high end gaming rig... but for a mid-range gaming rig or for an entertainment system it is okay.

The price is good... and they work... but, the cables are sheathed in very cheap stiff plastic.  The blue is extremely ugly (it really looks exactly like the picture).  If you are using these in a case that no one an see inside these are a great option for the price.

Nothing special about these cables!  I was expecting some nice thick cables that make me believe they are going to handle massive amounts of data... these are not.  They are very thin cables (the picture is deceiving).  As far as I can tell, they are working fine, but I prefer the thicker cables that tell me the wires inside are thick enough to handle 4K etc.  The connectors do not fit tightly into the HDMI ports.  Kind of disappointed.  For the price and for folks that don't really need "the best" I think these are an okay option though.

Be sure to read your Motherboard specs completely!  This M.2 is *not* compatible with all Mobo's that take an M.2 drive.  Very disappointed.  Samsung should have a thorough compatibility chart for this drive.

Not as fast as I would have liked, but this processor works great in my Home Entertainment Build. It runs relatively cool and smooth without any hiccups.  For the price, I believe it is a great choice for budget PCs paired with the proper compatible MoBo.

I can't ever find any potting soil in my area that isn't loaded with a bunch of chemical fertilizers so I order mine from Amazon.  This soil smells rich and loamy and grows wonderful indoor lettuce, kale and herbs.  Drainage is superb, but it holds just enough moisture that you won't have to worry every day about your plants.
Great Memory at a great price.  This memory runs smooth, quiet and fast.

More Hard Drive space than you could ask for, Sleek clean lines, nicely appointed with a couple of USB ports and Audio outputs on the top, 3 wonderful Silencio Fans included, easy to access with thumb screws, options for extra fans, etc.  And *quiet*.  This case was a great choice for my Home Entertainment Build.  I really like it.My only complaint is the extremely bright vivid blue LEDs for the Power Button and the HDD access light.  I shade mine with a piece of black electrical tape.

Can never find these in XL anywhere... thank God for Amazon!  I bought enough to last me a couple years.  Playtex is still the best glove for cleaning and doing dishes in my opinion.  I tried a whole bunch of other ones hoping to find one that would fit and work... with no luck.  Only playtex seems to give me that non-slip that I'm looking for when doing dishes.  Other brands will have glass items slipping out of your hands all of the time, but the playtex brand's composition just seems tor provide that little extra gripping power you need.For doing dishes, scrubbing floors, using peelers and graters when prepping produce... the uses seem endless.  Love the Playtex Brand.

This unit is well made, looks really good and is relatively easy to put together.  The instructions are pretty easy to follow.  The unit came in one box with all of the glass at one end that made it awkward to lift and carry, thus the box was a mangled mess when I received it, but there was enough packaging to protect everything inside and nothing was damaged.  My only complaint is that the threads were stripped on one part that required me to use a longer screw to put it together (there were a few extra screws included)...thus the 4 stars.  I feel the value for this is fair at best (I think it costs about 20$ more than it's really worth) but I am happy with my purchase.

This is a great reusable canvas decorating bag.  Although it might be a little large for the average home cook, there are so many useful things you can do with one.  Filling donuts, putting batter in muffin tins, decorating, etc etc.  It's use is only limited by your imagination. Don't forget to buy the tips as this does not come with any.  Clean up isn't too bad (just rinse thoroughly and hang to dry)  I prefer things I can use over an over again rather than disposable items and this fit the bill perfectly for me.

Spices that are fresh can mean the difference between blah and gourmet when it comes to preparing meals.  Not all bottled spices are the same... the way a spice is dried, packaged, etc really makes a difference.  This Frontier brand of Tarragon is wonderful!  As soon as I removed the seal from the wonderful glass jar I could smell the wonderful aroma of "fresh" tarragon (in it's dried state of course).  I think this is some of the best tarragon I have ever tried and well worth the price.

I use crushed red pepper flakes about as much as salt and pepper.  I used to think they were all about the same until I tasted this brand.  Hot (but not unbearably so) with an aroma and flavor unlike any I've ever tasted.  I was a little concerned about the value of this until I received it... you are getting a nice amount for the price in a great glass jar.  Considering the quality, the amount of product and the packaging I believe this is a great deal!  (And because it is so fresh and tasty you won't need as much as the "bargain" brands).If you used crushed red pepper flakes often, you simply must try these.
Exactly what I needed.  Great Product at a great price.

Used to have noise when listening to podcasts, music, etc with my Android Phone tethered to my car stereo with the 3.5 mm cable while charging through the 12V power point. This filter got rid of every bit of it.  What a great product!  What more needs to be said?

I shopped for two years before buying this TV.  I have read all of the technical reviews and many of the "way too technical" reviews here on Amazon.  When spending this much money on a TV, I found that the things I really wanted to know were pretty basic: Does the unit perform well?  Does the unit look good?  Does the unit have the options that I need?That being said, I can honestly say that the answer to those three questions is: YESThe picture and colors are outstanding.  Breathtaking at times depending on the source being fed to it (Standard Definition, DVD vs BluRay, etc).  You will, in fact, watch older movies and TV that you have seen before and it will be like the first time you've ever seen them.  It's that good.  If you like old black and white in HD you will be blown away (like remastered Twilight Zone episodes)I don't stream things to my TV, but it has all of the streaming options that you could hope for.I don't use over the air or cable with my TV so I cannot attest to the performance with that type of signal... but I have found that anything sent to this TV looks amazing.3D on this TV is better (yes *better*) than the movie theater, and way better than the other LG 3D TV I have.  You can enjoy 3D effects from pretty much any viewing angle (unlike the older passive 3D models where you pretty much had to be right in front of it).  The 2D to 3D conversion works really good too (depending on the source... BluRay quality seems to be the best for conversion)The quality of the picture on this TV can be seen from pretty much any viewing angle.Black is BLACK on this set.  And I mean black as in absolutely no light or bleed-through of other colors.  It is mind blowing.Now for a few bad things: 1.  Hate the way the TV tilts back.  It's horrible.  I like to have my TV's at about 4 feet above the ground which makes viewing in a recliner easier... the tilt is extremely noticeable at this height (but not very noticeable at a lower height) 2.  No really good wall mounting options (especially for tilt and swivel).  3.  The settings for picture, etc for each mode are clunky to get to.  Why doesn't LG just have a "settings" button right on the remote?  In other words... adjusting the picture on the fly is kind of a pain.  4.  Text on the screen when hooked up to a PC is horrible (ghosting, pixelated, etc).  I have tried all different settings and can't clear it up.  I use a PC for 90% of my home entertainment system...so this is a problem for me that others might not ever have.  5.  The curve can be distracting.  It is hard to keep myself from looking at the curve when viewing... but the curve definitely helps reduce reflections on the screen.All in all... if those 5 "bad" things are all I can find wrong with this set, I believe I have made a good purchase.  I can live with all 5 of them (the worse, to me, being the backward "tilt").  I paid 2500$ for mine after waiting for a long time for the price to come down... I just couldn't wait any longer... and you shouldn't either.  If you are all about the home entertainment system, putting this baby at the center of it is something you really should do.  I don't think you will regret it.  I sure don't.  It has really enhanced the home entertainment experience for me, and I believe it will do the same for you.

This "grind" of the EcoTeas Yerba Mate includes more stems than their other grind.  It is a little "harsher" but still tastes relatively good.  It is not as smooth (in my opinion) as their other grind but the value is outstanding.  Love the paper bag it comes in with no nasty plastic touching the product.

I got a great deal on this from Amazon in one of their sales.  I was skeptical... but now I'm a believer.  Light weight and oh so portable.  No cords to tie you down, no mixing oil and gas.  No mess, no fuss.  (Except for having to charge the battery now and then).This unit comes with two batteries.  I charged both of them fully with the included charger in anticipation of having to switch out batteries right away.  Much to my surprise after one hour of almost constant use I was still on the same battery.  And, it is still going strong.  I found that this unit will bog down a little in taller weeds and grass so I wouldn't recommend it for that.As for the base with the wheels... I did not use it.  It is certainly maneuverable, but it is really light weight plastic and you can see it bend every time you insert and remove the weeder from it (which is *extremely* easy to do).  I am assuming that eventually it would break.  I put the base in the "nice to have" but not needed category. On the other hand, if you are elderly or find it hard to hold something like this for any length of time, I can see a real benefit to using the base with the unit.  It adds stability and safety.Assembly is relatively easy and straightforward.  The hardest part to put on is the shield.  It has to snap into place and requires a little strength to do so.  Once you snap that in there is a screw that needs to be inserted to keep it there.  The other part that has to be "assembled" is the handle.  That requires a little strength too but most people won't have that much trouble.For the price I got this for I can't complain.  It's so nice to have a quieter (compared to gas!) and more convenient (no cords to drag around and ready to use at a moment's notice) method of trimming around my house and fence.

How did I ever live without one of these?  I have spent my life buying those little one gallon sprayers that you are constantly pumping and lugging around with you and refilling and refilling and refilling.This sprayer works great.  And I mean great.  It came with 3 different nozzle designs (one for kind of a mist, one for a wide spray pattern, and one for more of a stream).  The shoulder straps leave something to be desired, but are adequate for the home user (if I was a pro I would want more padding etc).  Being able to just pump the handle a few times and keep on spraying instead of stopping and pumping like a mad man (like with the above mentioned sprayer) is a godsend and allows you to make short work of large spraying projects.  The container has gallon and liter measurements on it so it is super easy to follow the instructions on whatever ingredient you are going to use.My only minor complaint... it is clunky (awkward). The handle on mine does not go to that upper most position as seen in the picture so it gets caught on doorways, etc. when carrying it.  The weight is not distributed evenly throughout the unit when empty so can really feel kind of like it's "going everywhere" while carrying it.  (if that makes sense).Other than that complaint the sprayer works like a charm.  A few pumps of the handle and you are spraying like a pro.
I use potato flakes for baking bread and these are the tastiest I've found.  And, as a bonus, they are also Certified Organic!  Safe, natural, real food.  Try them, you will love them.

A nice box of fuses for most vehicles.  It includes the mini size for most newer vehicles and the larger sizes needed in older vehicles and equipment.  The quality of the fuses seems to be acceptable... but not the highest quality to me.
I've never been so bored.  Even in 3D I could barely keep my eyes open.  It is visually stunning... but (in my opinion) this movie lacked engaging dialogue.
This stuff is real... and is really happening.  A must read.  Rosa has a great writing style that makes the subject of U.N. agenda 21 easy to read.
A great more mature alternative to that other "Word" game... without all of the spyware permissions

I have been using Messina Wildlife products for years.  All I can say is:  They work!  You need to reapply for consistent results, but it really does have the deer turning their noses up to things you don't want them to eat.  Messina's other products work just as well.

Conspiracy "theory" or Conspiracy fact?  You be the judge.  This is a must see award winning documentary that every American should see.  I remember when all of this happened... but I sure didn't see what *really* happened!  Wow.  This documentary will leave you questioning everything.  And that is what we should do... question *everything.*

This is an expensive product... but well worth it.  It worked perfectly for me.  I used it on the stumps of an old hedge I chopped out and I haven't had one bit of new growth.  I am not a fan of poisons, but there are sometimes when it is nearly impossible to get rid of certain varieties without them.  If you use this as directed, I believe it will provide good results.  I highly recommend.

You will never look at the Biotech industry the same after reading this book.  I will leave personal opinion out of this... read it for yourself and come to your own conclusion.  As for me and my house... we are going to continue to say *no* to GMO foods whenever possible!

Why buy a wheelbarrow online?  Ha!  I have small vehicles, and it is pretty much impossible to buy an item like this unless I ask someone with a pickup to help me.  This wheelbarrow will arrive in 3 pieces.  The tub ships as is, the handles come wrapped together and the wheel and hardware come in a box.  It was relatively easy to put together with the included instructions and this seems to be a high quality wheel barrow.  It is a nice medium/large size.  The color is *not* bright red as the picture indicates.  It is more of a tan color.  The wheel is inflatable, and it handles beautifully.  This is a metal wheelbarrow, and in my experience they will last for many many years as long as they are not kept outside.  This was also a bargain compared to the plastic wheelbarrows I see at the mass merchandisers.  I highly recommend!
Sleek car of the future.
Really neat!
So cool!

I seriously don't know how we made it before the invention of space saver vacuum storage bags.For years, all my off season clothes, extra blankets, comforters, pillows... all of it was put in bulky totes and stacked in every empty corner.Not anymore. The vacuum storage bags allow you to take all that excess 'stuff' and place in the bags. Once you get to the fill line, simply attach a vacuum hose and be amazed!  Who knew there was so much air in our clothing. You literally end up with a bag about a 1/4 of the size it was originally, making it easy to store away just about anywhere. Many of mine I put in an under the bed tote. No muss, no fuss. Out of sight, out of mind until you need them again. That's my idea of decluttering.One other thing that really shocked me was just how large the jumbo bags are. I was able to fit almost all of my winter clothing in one bag, with fleece jackets and coats. Absolutely amazing!I'm 5'1" and could probably just about fit right into one. I definitely could use some 'air' sucked out. Ha!I received these vacuum storage bags at a discounted rate in exchange for my fair, honest and unbiased review.

I suffer from a rare neurological disorder that affects my central nervous system. It causes so much pain, head to toe but especially in my legs, feet, back, sciatic area...I've been through a lot of muscle creams, salves, lotions... anything to try to get some relief. When I first saw this up for review, I figured, why not? I was skeptical but always hopeful. I figured at least when I review, I don't have to pay full price and the worst that can happen is I'll waste a little time.I was really surprised. The arnica cream helped. It really penetrated and relieved the pressure in my back and sciatic joint. I obviously can't be 'fixed' but any relief I can get is well worth it.Then, the arnica cream became a real saving grace for me a few weeks back. I fell on concrete. My butt took the blunt of my fall and I really fell hard and fast. I had no time to even try to catch myself. I hurt all over and the dogs, who did not intend to cause it, ended up getting me with the linked chain of his tie-out. He didn't like the neighbors puppy running over to me so he chased him... both went around me. Which also meant that the chain not only knocked my legs out from under me, but it also took skin off my ankle and scuffed and heavily bruised my right calf.I used the arnica cream, even though it says for the back.I was in so much pain. I was bruised and swollen.  I rubbed in the creme, except on the open wounds and it helped. I was feeling better and it was helping the bruising. I was surprised. Since my disease,  I bruise real easily and they normally stay forever. But, the creme helped that, too.I spoke with the seller and she explained that the creme is really good for bruising because it draws the bad blood away, allowing the new, oxygenated blood to return to the area.I also learned many other options for the creme that people have reported great results with, like carpal tunnel syndrome. I'm going to have my Mom and Sister try it and see if they can get some relief.I am happy I didn't give up on trying to find help for pain. The arnica creme has been a blessing. I'm very thankful for getting to review it and in exchange for a honest, unbiased review. I'm a fan and, if it works as they say for carpal tunnel syndrome, my Mom, Sister and other sufferers will be just as relieved, I'm sure.

So thrilled to get this trunk organizer. I actually drive an SUV but it's such a pain having to chase down groceries, tools or whatever else I put in the back because it's been tossed around with every turn or bump in the road.With this organizer, I don't have to worry about it. I set it up in the back of my Explorer and everything stays right where I put it. No more scattered tools, yogurt, fishing hear... whatever I'm hauling. It's all right in the slot I put it in.Saves me a lot of time and frustration.I'm even considering ordering at least one more for my SUV and a couple for my boyfriend's truck so his tools, groceries and other items aren't always strolled across the backseat or the bed of his truck.I was able to get this trunk organizer at a discounted rate in exchange for my fair, honest and unbiased review.

So glad to get this. Living in the country is fantastic but it's a constant battle with the deer, rabbiys, groundhogs, squirrels... you name it, they want into out garden, apple orchard, bird seed, trash... all the places you don't need them to be. The key is in the copper. I heard it for years but you think there's no way that copper can make that kind of difference but it surely does.I have a very rare neurological disorder affecting my central nervous system. Causes me a lot of pain, frustration, aggravation, depression...MANY ISSUES.. to say the least.I first decided to try the calf compression sleeves because I have so many issues with my legs. They hurt constantly, the muscles have hypertonia... which basically means that they no longer relax and I've gotten to the point where I will try just about anything to get a moments relief.I will say upfront that I expected issues, not only because of the hypertonia, but because I've also lost flexibility in my ankles. Add to that the fact that my nerves are hypersensitive, I'm constantly in pain, etc...I did, in fact, have issues getting them on. But I had to see the end results. Would it help once I got them on, make it worse... and how long would I need to give it.Once I got them on, got my body settled down, the tremors stopped and could relax... I did notice help in some areas. It wasn't enough that I could keep them on or continue trying to use them. But, with my disease, it was to be expected.But, the great news is, my niece-in-law had started running a few months ago and constantly has shin splints. If you've ever had shin spints, you know they are very painful, uncomfortable and hard to get rid of. Knowing this, I asked if she would like to try the compression sleeves and see if they would relieve her shin splints.She was game for anything, too. She didn't want to give up running but needed some relief. I sent them home with her and she called me 2 days later, thrilled with how they were working. Her shin splints were nearly completely gone and she was feeling so much better. Since then, she's back to normal. Still running 3 and 4 days a week, always using the compression sleeves. Her friends are wanting to know where she got them and how they can get their own.So fantastic that something that looks and works so simply can do such a tremendous job.I truly appreciate the opportunity I had to review these in exchange for a fair, honest and unbiased review and, although they didn't work for me, they get a 5 star because they do work and work really well. But, not everyone is a good match for them, particularly someone with a disease like mine.

Had to upgrade my modem and router to handle the increased speeds that Time Warner has made available to customers. This is connected to the upstairs desktop computer and was very easy to install. So, I switched out my router as well and now the speed upstairs is over 200 MBps!!!! I am so happy with this upgrade! Nice sleek design and works beautifully. Couldn't ask for more! My cable company upgraded internet speeds but my modem and router were three years old and couldn't handle the new speeds (up to 300 MBps). So, I decided to get this router to replace my 2012 Securifi Almond. This new router has dual band capability and tons of other upgrades. It was very easy to set up and the speed of the desktop computer that it is connected to is amazing (speed went from less than 30 MBps to over 200 MBps). Downstairs for my laptop it is a little different story. I was only less than 2.0 MBps which was RIDICULOUS! So I set up my old Securifi Almond as an extender. Well, with the new router I have the option of choosing three different internet accesses (2.4, 5.0 or the Almond). I tried the speeds on all three and the 5.0G is nearly 80 MBps while the extender is pretty useless (slow slow slow)! It's still not what it is upstairs but I am so much happier with this router and my new modem! Eventually I will figure out how to increase the speed downstairs but it's really a non-issue for now.

It's really small. Really small. Not quite as useful as I'd like. Still trying to find a recipe that will fit this and not have leftover batter.

This is the 2nd time ordering these and it's a great deal! Nice to have a stock of these. These are real Philips Sonicare so they work perfectly in our  toothbrush bases. Great price. Great product.

I bought this because it has a rubber gasket at the base of the end that plugs into the tablet. Another charger cord that I bought from another company did not have this and it cracked resulting in exposed copper wires. This is a vulnerable area of the cord itself. Therefore, it was important to find another one that had an extra protection. This EasyAcc cord seems to be the one. I've only been using it for a couple of days and it charges fast, has a tight connection and the length is satisfactory.

Fits my 9" springform pan perfectly. A little pricey but worth it when you figure out how much is wasted when cutting a circle out of rolled parchment paper. I use parchment paper all the time so this will just make it a bit easier.

My old 9" springform pan rusted and it also leaked when I used it in a water bath even when I used aluminum foil. This is leak proof and won't rust. Very nice quality and well made. I'm very happy with it and it was reasonably priced. Couldn't ask for more!
I bought the 12" version of this rack and loved it so much that I immediately ordered the 18" version for a bathroom door that can handle the wider width. I love this thing!
These are great replacement rollers for my little machine. Great price, fits perfectly and does the job. I still get my pedicures monthly but this works great in between.
I love coconut oil for cooking. This is one that is very highly rated for purity and no additives. It's also priced really well when bought on the subscription plan.

Although the ones I received a a lighter color, they still have the cinnamon scent. That's the only scent I like as the other ones all smell too flowery and heavy, artificial. I love the cinnamon scent of these particular ones. I use one in the master bath and one in the laundry room. Nice.
I buy these all the time for my cats (2). They enjoy them and when I call out "snack" they can't get to me fast enough! I always have a stock of these on hand for my fur balls!

I got two of these bracelets (Lotus and Life) from my kids for Mothers Day and I loved them so much that I ordered Gemini for myself. I'm not a bracelet person but these are very light, different and simple. They stack beautifully and are my style. My new favorite jewelry. Plus the fact that they are made in the U.S. makes them even more desirable! Love the spiritual meaning behind the charm and the little ones are a pretty accent. Also, they are very easy to slip on and off BUT I think they would be a problem for a big wrist.
These work as promised. They are small and fit my hand well. My kitten allows me to do one or two paws at a time which is fine.

Don't really care for this. It's not powdery but seems to be between wet and dry and I don't like the way it goes on. I like a loose powder so I have complete control over the application. I'll use it but will not buy it again.

These are too pricey but they work beautifully. I don't like the taste of my nonfiltered water and I drink a lot of water from the refrigerator! They shouldn't be so expensive but I won't risk compromising an expensive appliance with generic filters. Works for me.
These are the only batteries we buy for our home. I love that they come pre-charged and we always keep a set plugged in the wall so we don't go without. Great life and cost effective.
This is the right size mat that I was looking for, doesn't slide around on my hardwood floors and keeps the food and bowls in one place. I am very happy with this product.

My new kitten moves and drags her bowls all over the kitchen floor, including the one with water and this makes such a mess on my hardwood floors! These bowls work great and are the right size. I'm really happy with them and didn't see anything as nice or inexpensive as these at the pet stores.
It's a battery for my older cordless phone. It's smaller than the older ones so I just put some stuffing in the handset to keep it from knocking around. Works as expected.

My husband loves these razors and they aren't easy to find at a reasonable price. I have no idea why razors are so darned expensive! These razors meet the requirements so I ordered two packages. He should be good for a while.

Got this to use on my new iPhone 6 and what surprised me is that there are multiple screen protectors in the package! Easy to apply (video is available but I didn't need it since I used similar covers for my iPhone 5c). It works quite well with the LUVVITT ULTRA ARMOR case. Great product!

I love my new iPhone 6 and wanted a cover that would make the slim style of the phone easier to hold and comfortable. This case works beautifully and meets all my expectations. I paired it with a screen cover that works extremely well. Smart looking and functional. What else do you need?
These are sinful and delicious! I like these better than most granola bars because they aren't messy and I love nuts. Hubby loves them as well.

I absolutely love this oil! No odor, no flavor! I use it now instead of veggie oil for health benefits and because it tolerates such high heat without burning. I use coconut oil and olive oil exclusively in my kitchen! LOVE!

I absolutely love these capris! I bought them in the indigo and the white and wish they had many other colors. I just found out about Jag jeans and am thrilled beyond belief! To have all the details and style of regular jeans with the comfort of a pull-on pants is incredible. And believe me, they are not "old lady" jeans! They actually have more style than some of the other more expensive jeans I've been wearing. They are very very flattering and eliminate most of the muffin top that so many women suffer from. These are PERFECT!

THANK YOU CAROLINA GIRL! After reading your thorough and wonderful review, I ordered these jeans on your recommendation. They are PERFECT! I followed your advice on color and sizing and, again, THANK YOU! I absolutely love these jeans! They are gorgeous! So stylish, so well made, and spot on! They are so flattering and I love the details of the back pockets (and I usually like my jeans on the plainer side)! The fact that they are pull-ons is amazing because of the detail in the faux fly, the real front pockets, the back pockets (especially placement), the color and the cut. When I put these on, I was absolutely surprised at how perfect they are!I never heard of Jag jeans before but decided that waisted/zippered jeans were becoming too uncomfortable with my almost 62-year old midriff, so I ended up ordering Diane Gilman jeans that are similar to this (HSN)... NO NO NO! They had no details (pockets, fly, etc.) and they stretched at least an entire size after wearing them, plus they were boot leg and I prefer straight leg like the Jag ones. I returned all of them to HSN and went on Amazon to see if there were any alternative styles that are more like real jeans but pull on. And I found JAG and Caroline Girl's review. Five pairs of Jag jeans (3 long leg and 2 capri), I could not be happier! I will be ordering more and will probably never go back to the regular style of jeans with zippers/waistlines! LOVE LOVE LOVE!

Carolina Girl did an incredibly informative review on Jag jeans and, as a result, I ended up buying FIVE PAIRS OF THIS BRAND OF JEANS! OMG! I had tried the HSN - DG2 stretch jeans that she just came out with and they are nothing compared to Jag! DG2 stretched while wearing them and lost their shape. Awful and I ended returning them. Based on Carolina Girl's great review of various pairs and the sizing, I ended up buying Peri in a light/worn and another in a darker color, plus the Phoenix style she suggested that I will review on that post as well. I'm between a 10 and 12 (have to lose a few pounds) and 5.6" so these fit PERFECTLY! No hemming or anything! While they were a little snug to pull up over my hips, once they were up all the way... WOW! You would never ever know these are pull-ons with the pockets and fly details, plus the jean material is spot on! I cannot imagine wearing regular zipper waisted jeans again! I bought two pairs of the capri style (indigo and white) and they are fantastic! I honestly have found the perfect jeans!Now, I am sitting here with a pair on and the waistline is pretty high, and rolls a bit when I sit but that's fine. When I stand up they go back in place. I notice also that they loosen up just a bit from wearing them which is perfect. I like my fit rather snug so having them stretch out just a tiny bit is just fine since it creates the look I am looking for. I am almost 62 years old and do not like "old lady" clothes, especially jeans! However, my midriff is a problem and I hate the way regular jeans feel (constricting). If I buy them to fit the waistline, they are too big everywhere else. Additionally, the Jag jeans make your butt look really good and hide any panty lines. These are extremely well made and the fabric on all five pair of jeans is excellent, as well as the detail. I AM BEYOND THRILLED WITH THESE JEANS!

I wanted to get glass storage containers with lids. My daughter has these since she has replaced all of her plastic. These are nice and a good size.
