I won't be using them in the oven due to some of the reviews. However, I hope they work in the microwave better than some of these posts indicate. I have older Pyrex and love them. I used to actually go to the Corning facility in NY to buy them. Love that place.

I like this strainer a lot. It's the perfect size and I can't imagine wanting a longer handle or bigger ladle/basket area as some reviews have stated. It's good quality and worth the price. Easy to clean. It's exactly what I wanted.

Love these ice cream containers. They are light, cute, and hold 1.5 qt. which is the perfect size for a homemade batch of the 2-ingredient recipe on Pinterest. My company loved the look of these as well.

I love this container! I started making ice cream and this fits 1.5 qt. perfectly. It's lightweight, the top is easy on and easy off, and the ice cream stays nice. Doesn't take up too much room in my freezer. So cute and functional!

I got into making my own pasta recently (fettucine, spaghetti, ravioli) and needed a good quality semolina flour to add to the 00 Italian flour that I use. This is perfect. It's not expensive, has great texture and flavor. I've ordered it twice and am very happy with it.

I've ordered this twice and am very happy with it and the price. It's comparable to name brands and you get a lot for your money. I suffer very dry congested sinuses that are difficult to treat. I have to be careful what I take so that the product doesn't cause any further dryness. This product works very well. The fact that it's non-drowsy also help!

Not a fan of overwhelming flowery scents so I was a little hesitant about this one. However, I am very happy to say that it is a nice, mild and pleasant fragrance that doesn't hit you in the face. Once in a while, your nose catches a slight whiff which is pleasing to the senses. When I come in the house from the garage, I notice a lovely smell that is very welcoming. Very happy with this.

Originally Reviewed For: Tea and BookWhat Donna Grant has done with this series of series is nothing short of spectacular. She had a concept and allowed it to grow without damaging the original idea. Book 7 in her Dark Kings Series dances the line between touching base with the history of the series and introducing some new concepts (more on that in a later review). And of course she does it brilliantly.Thorn is considered the "Bad Boy" of the Dragon Kings. He's spent his entire waking life walking just a wee bit on the wild side. What few know and even fewer remember is that Thorn takes all that intensity into everything he does even his promise to care for humans, especially his promise to care for humans. When that promise was shattered, Thorn felt he betrayed the trust put in him and walled up his emotions. It's taken centuries but one human woman who refuses to fall for the Dark Fae has sent Thorn tumbling and that wall.. yep it came a tumbling down.Lexi watched her best friend leave the bar one night, she was worried and followed her. Only to discover too late that she was dead. That the "men" she went with were truly evil and probably not men. It seems Lexi is one of the few who not only sees through the glamour but can fight off the lust that the Dark Fae exude. It makes her an even more tempting morsel but that doesn't faze her, nope, she is determined to avenge her friend and takes it upon herself to fight the Dark... not that she has a clue what they are. One dark night, the Dark turned on her and if not for an incredibly sexy man.. she'd be dead. Forced to accept his help, Lexi has to learn the hard way that he is way more than just the sexy hunk next door.Passion Ignites, moves the battle between the Dark Fae and the Dragons into full scale. Lines have been crossed and the Kings are in for the battle to end all battles. Choices have to made and bonds are tested.Con.. Now here's a character that still stumps me. What's his secret? What's he up to? Can he be so lost in being THE Dragon King that he has forgotten to bend? Will winning the war mean loosing Con? Just a thoughtRhi.. Now Rhi has some serious issues to deal with. Her darkness is growing but so is her light. Can she continue walking the tightrope or must she finally make a choice. Will her Dragon King ever step up and be the lover she needs and deserves? I am starting to really dislike this particular Dragon King, not that I have any idea who it is. I know it's not Con, good lord it better not be Con that would be horrid at this point. I do hope it's a King we've at least heard of before.. I mean we have to be able to love to hate him or something. Also, the fact that as much as Rhi is fighting her inner demons, she knows that the light Fae MUST step into the battle. Their world is also at risk.Ulric... Come on who doesn't love this guy? Seriously? I think he's one of the best written characters out there. He is alone has been for so very long, wants his revenge but I think he wants his "family" back more. Sure he's angry, justifiably so but I think when push comes to shove he's going to be the one thing that turns the battle for the Dark Kings.. again, just my opinion..There is more.. oh so much more, this book was stuffed with nuances and foreshadowing.. hints of new characters as well as things to come. I wait for each of these books with an almost child like intensity.. I really want to discover what comes next.Just a great series.. and Passion Ignites totally set my world aflame!ShauniThis review is based on the ARC of Passion Ignites, provided by netgalley

Originally Reviewed For: Tea and BookOver the Years we have watched Jacquelyn Frank craft a wonderful world of Demons and Vampires, Lycanthropes and Mistrals, Wraiths and Bodywalkers. Twelve Species of supernatural beings that had been at times at war, at times at peace. For the past few generations due to a curse before their memory, the twelve beings had been divided. Unaware that the others even existed. Six and Six.. They were the Nightwalkers. Finally they have all found a way to be together, to bring an end to the curse, all because of one man, once an enemy..Kaman is a political refuge. Once second only to the ruler of the Templars (the evil bodywalkers) a division of the bodywalkers that believed it was their right to take over another's body and rule it. He has released an evil god that wants to destroy them all. Finally he has come to his senses. He knows the Templars' way is wrong and he has promised to serve the politics as best he can. Trusted? No way, but he has to try.Genevive is a pariah amongst the wraiths, she is an abomination, half human and half wraith. Because of her humanity she has failed in being a wraith, she is abhorred, an embarrassment to her family. All she wants, really wants is to find a place where she can belong. When the powerful bodywalker, Kaman, finds her she is thrilled to have a purpose. To bring the wraiths into the battle on the side of the Nightwalkers. A purpose and worth.. finally. Only the further along she gets with Kaman, the more she realizes that it's not just a purpose and worth she is looking for, she dreams of the man.Kaman and Genvieve together are working on uniting the Nightwalkers, bringing them all together is the only way to beat Atep. Only the wraiths at best are sneaky at worst, they are minions of Atep. Can they convince the wraiths to commit? Can they convince the Nightwalkers to believe? They both are fighting their own personal demons and have discovered that together they might actually succeed.Ms. Frank, kind of threw in the kitchen sink on this book. I enjoyed it but I felt like she just wanted to get it all done. Like ok, I ran out of ideas but I really, really need to end this series.. That being said, it detracted from a really good storyline. Kaman's redemption has been an ongoing thing in the past few books and to find him in a place where he can actually be in love? To accept that he is loved? It's truly wonderful only those moments were stolen with the jumble of other information that was thrown in.There are species of Nightwalkers that we hadn't really even met yet and they came, then left for whatever reason. They fought in the great battle but I got the feeling that they were superfluous.. They had to be there to go with the over all arc but pffft... Now I could be wrong and Ms. Frank may be back with more Nightwalker stories, I hope so, but if not.. the arc itself has been finished. The Nightwalkers, reunited, more or less.. and the most recent great evil has been defeated. We shall see what comes next.ShauniThis review is based on the ARC of Nightwalker, provided by netgalley

Originally Reviewed For: Tea and BookDianne Duvall literally leaped unto my reading radar a few years ago. Since then I have loved her Immortal Guardians Series. I have coveted each and every book and have anxiously awaited the next. I received this book for review last summer, because of all the upheaval in my life.. I wasn't able to do it justice with a review until now.Now, I am going to RAVE.. This might just be my favorite book of this series to date. It has all the action of the first books with some of the mystery and a new truce of sorts with humans.. sorta.. then there is the interference of those who should know better.Teased enough??? Yeah, that's all the teasers you are gonna get from me. *grins*Ethan has spent the last 100 years fighting Vampires and being in "love" with another Immortal. Only she's fallen in love with someone else and now Ethan is feeling just a bit out of the loop. He isn't sure what to do with himself, well except fight those darn vamps.. Until one night he ends up in a clearing with a bunch of vamps and a crazy woman. Ok, so she's not crazy but she is just a little unusual.. and gorgeous. At least to Ethan.Heather Lane has psychic abilities. She knows things, she dreams them, she reads people. She is sensitive enough that she prefers living alone, in the woods. Fortunately for her, her father has enough pull to get her a job as a federal agent with great "instincts". No one really knows what she does or how she does it. For the last few months, she has been dreaming about a battle not far from her house, when she found the clearing she just knew she had to investigate. So one night she goes and it happens only she doesn't wake up this time, this time it's real. And the hunky hero who comes to the rescue... yeah he's real too.Just fabulous!!! Dianne brings these two together with passion and fury. And it never stops. I really did love it. Of course she never stops with just a simple romance and Shadows Strike is no different. She offers twists and turns that delight. Creating two characters that belong together, even almost accept that fact but the battle wages and they must find love within the war. Trying to figure out who they can trust and who they can't.Just a great book.. Thanks Dianne for once again taking me along on this spectacular adventure.ShauniThis review is based on the ARC of Shadows Strike, provided by netgalley

Originally Reviewed For: Bodice Rippers, Femme Fatales and FantasyLet me start by saying I just adore this series. Shana Galen writes of love and redemption and not necessarily in that order. The Rogue You Know is Book Two in her Covenant Garden Series and she's talking about more than the pleasure gardens. She is writing about one of the seediest parts of London.The Rogue in this instance is a man half in love with his childhood best friend. His best friend who turned out to be a missing lady.. when she gets her true life back and finds real, deep abiding love of her own (Marlowe from Earls Just Want to Have Fun). With Marlowe gone, Gideon finds himself at loose ends. Having made an enemy of the crime boss he needs an out. So he figures one last heist, if it's a big one, can buy his way out. He can become a different man. A man with a future. He doesn't expect his life to become complicated by a woman so far above him he couldn't even dream of touching her hem.. let alone her heart.Lady Susanna Derring is perfect.. to her mind perfectly boring. She's spent her life glittering in the ton, restricted by it's rules. Now she wants out. It's too much. Her family too demanding, her life too constricting. What she doesn't dream of, what she can't even begin to imagine is a life on the run with a criminal.This book was fun, intense and just excellent. Ms. Galen keeps us on our toes as these two are on the run. Never quite knowing who to trust or where to turn. There are surprises aplenty and a romance worth reading about.Two people who want more, who want to live but more importantly want to love.. it takes true courage to face the world together and yet they do.Just a fabulous book.ShauniThis review is based on the ARC of The Rogue You Know, provided by netgalley

Originally Reviewed For: Bodice Rippers, Femme Fatales and FantasyWelcome back to Mary Jo Putney's world of Lost Lords. Men who have loved and lost, who had to learn to be the men who deserved the women who loved them, men who dared to defy the odds and truly love.Not Always a Saint is Book 7 in the series and takes everything we have read before, everything I just wrote about the Lost Lords and tosses it out the window. This time it's oh so different and ever so loverly...Daniel Herbert is a man of science, a man who has dedicated his life to become a physician who has helped those in need. Since the death of his childhood sweetheart, the woman he had planned on marrying, he had closed himself off to life. Living only to help his sister, Laurel from Not Quite a Wife, and his patience. But life has a way of throwing twists at us and Daniel is no different. He has inherited a title, he doesn't want it, he isn't quite sure what to do with it.. but he's got it. And since he is known for doing his duty, he knows he needs a wife. A perfectly proper, boring wife.. what he doesn't need is a woman known as the black widow. Young and beautiful and oh so mysterious.Jessie Kelham is too beautiful for her own good. She has been battered and betrayed, she has been tossed aside and run away.. Her life has been one crazy case of abuse after another. She thought she had finally found peace at the hands of an older husband who doted on her and their daughter, but his death brings back those who want to destroy her. She knows she needs a new husband, one she can control and one above reproach. What she doesn't need is the doctor who treated her when she ran from her first husband, her battered broken body leaving her almost unrecognizable.. But the heart wants what the heart wants.. and Jessie's heart wants Daniel.This was a subtle romance. It didn't rise and crash in a glorious crescendo, it lilted softly, slowly building until I realized I just couldn't put it down. It was sweet and powerful and just about perfect. A true joy to read.ShauniThis review is based on the ARC of Not Always a Saint, provided by netgalley

Originally Reviewed For: Bodice Rippers, Femme Fatales and FantasyChance is book two in her Dominick's series.. It tells the story of a family caught up in the intrigues and jealousies of a vicious relative.Rhea Claire Dominick is the beloved oldest child of Lucien and Sabrina Dominick (Hero and Heroine of Moonstruck Madness). A cousin of Lucien's was ever jealous of him and has finally managed to find a way for revenge. She has Rhea Clair kidnapped and sold into indentured servitude. Rhea Claire has been a pampered and much loved child her entire life and almost doesn't survive this harsh betrayal. But survive she does..Dante Leighton is also a child of the aristocracy and he too has been betrayed But his betrayal was deeper and closer to home. Forced to leave his past behind him at a young age he has traveled the seas and made a name for himself as a pirate. But now, he has a chance to redeem his life. He has the the map to a treasure that could change his life.Originally Reviewed For: Bodice Rippers, Femme Fatales and FantasyWhen Dante and Rhea Claire's lives intersect it is a clash of dreams. Both only dream of going home and falling in love is nowhere on either of their agendas..*SIGH** just a beautiful story.. I have loved it from the first time I opened the book. It is powerful, emotional and intense. Telling the story of a love of the ages..Seriously worth the read.ShauniThis review is based on the ARC of Chance the Winds of Fortune, provided by netgalley

Originally Reviewed For: Bodice Rippers, Femme Fatales and FantasyOnce upon a time... Seriously discovering Jess Michaels for me was like discovering a fantasy, a fairytale, ok a slightly erotic and oh so sexy one but the woman is gold. I first discovered her when she began writing about Those Notorious Flynns, a family that was true to who they are even when it became the main strain of a ducal family. Living always on the edge of "polite" society. They were happy. But fortune changes and suddenly they ARE polite society. Each of them found their loves and were very aware that true love doesn't always come in an expected manner.Now Ms. Michaels has moved on the Those oh so Wicked Woodleys.. The first book, A Marquis for Mary, married the Flynns to the Woodleys in a very definite manner. Forbidden is the story of a love that shouldn't be but can't be ignored.Jude Samson might be the grandson of a titled lord but he's just a lowly clerk. He has spent years as the secretary/estate manager for the Woodley Family. He has watched the younger siblings grow up and has become friends with the Marquis. They think of him as part of the family but he considers himself the hired help. It would be ok if he wasn't madly in love with the youngest sister, Audrey. He thinks he's beneath her and refuses to accept that there might just be a way for them. Until life offers up an opportunity that even he can't ignore.Lady Audrey is the youngest of a powerful clan. She has watched her family be destroyed first by the conniving first wife of her beloved eldest brother and then when her sister marries an unsavory sort and refuses to come home. Even when her life is obviously harsh. Audrey knows what bad choices in a marriage can do to a person and she knows, Jude will never marry her. But she's willing to "learn" what she can from him. To learn what it's like to be loved by a man she loves before having to face her family duty.In today's modern world such choices are unfathomable but Ms. Michaels makes Jude and Audrey's story into the love story it is, not just star crossed lovers but two people, individuals with dreams and goals of their own. And baggage, yep there are secrets that must be shared before there can ever be a Happily Ever After.Audrey and Jude are a push and pull couple without the angst and woe is me attitude that can happen in such a book. That's because Ms. Michaels has a deft hand with character development and it becomes a joy to watch them unravel the gordian knot that is their life.A true pleasure to read..ShauniThis review is based on the ARC of Forbidden, provided by netgalley

Originally Reviewed For: Bodice Rippers, Femme Fatales and FantasyOnce again Cora Seton takes us to Chance Creek. A place where heroes go to find peace. A SEAL's Chance is the introductory story for her SEALs of Chance Creek Series. And in typical Chance Creek fashion, it's fun, sweet, endearing and oh so smexy!A Short Novella that was part of The SEAL's of Summer books. A Great set of stories by some of my favorite authors. But for now, we get this little bit of fun.Ben Warren was seriously injured and was discharged from the SEAL's he is feeling down, feeling like his life is over and isn't ready to really accept what is now his life. Not wanting to return home, to his family, instead he heads to Chance Creek and the Hall brothers. Of course their lives are a bit crazed and anyone who is around finds their life changing. Ben is no different. With the healing help of the Halls, Ben begins to live again.Caitlin is a single mother fighting for her child. A Gentle soul who crosses Ben's path and changes his world. A woman who shows Ben that there are still things in life worth fighting for. If he's willing to.Just a great little story. More of a Chance Creek Tease... If you haven't ventured into Chance Creek, A SEAL's Chance is the perfect place to start. But I am warning you, once you get started you are never going back.ShauniThis review is based on the ARC of A SEAL's Chance, provided by the author for an honest review.

Originally Reviewed For: Tea and BookOne thing Joni Hahn does well is write a wonderful story. Agent N6: Dylan is book 6 in her D.I.R.E Series and it fulfills the promise of it's predecessors.The D.I.R.E Series began as a three book trilogy but it has taken on a life of it's own. And what a wonderful life.. It's part fantasy, part sci-fi and ALL action. The characters have dreams that contradict what they know is right. They have moral dilemmas and they have to accept that sometimes one has to take a leap of faith. In their case, those leaps can extend to the paste..Obviously by the name, this is Dylan's story. Dylan is a bit insecure and seriously doesn't believe he deserves a chance but the powers that be at D.I.R.E disagree.. Dylan is a bit different from the rest if D.I.R.E since he once was forced to work for Cyrus and now that he's free. He has one goal, to take him down or die trying. Seeing his chance with Cyrus' sexy New scientist, Dylan kidnaps her, sure she's as evil as the man she works for. But the more he gets to know her, the more he wants to be wrong.Geneticist, Teagan Hamilton wants nothing more than a healthy baby, trapped with a genetic disease she know if she can't figure out how to alter the DNA sequence, any child she has will be doomed to her half life. Accepting a job with Cyrus means she has access to state of the art labs and a chance. What she doesn't realize us that she just may have sold her soul to the devil.Getting kidnapped and landing in the muddle of the D.I.R.E. compound turns out to be the best thing that could possibly happen to her. Discovering that monsters really do exist and her boss is one of them was a hard pill to swallow. But falling in love with her kidnapper screams Stockholm Syndrome. It takes a trip to the past to help Reagan really adjust her priorities... but can she live with her choices?I just loved this story. It's fun, sexy and Dunbar. 's. Hahn never looses to focus on the fact that while there are many sci-fi aspects to her books, in the end it's all about the people.Totally another hit!ShauniThis review is based on the ARC of Agent N6: Dylan, provided by the author for an honest review.

Originally Reviewed For: Bodice Rippers, Femme Fatales and FantasySon of No One is Book 25 in this near legendary series. But it's more than that it's book 3 in Ms. Kenyon's Lords of Avalon Series. One that intrigued me from the very beginning. A book that has been promised for quite some time but Sherrie found a way to combine her Lords of Avalon AND her Dark Hunters, YAY!! So didn't see that one coming.Josette Landry can't exactly be called the girl next door. She's something of a bad luck charlie and she's one of "those" deveraux.. except they are all gorgeous and classy and sure of themselves. Josette is so desperate for work (and self esteem) that she takes a job as a photographer for some cook ghost hunters. Only when one of the portraits swoops her into it, she realizes that maybe her friends and family aren't that crazy after all. And what she finds behind the picture is a man worth saving.Cadegan is trapped in a world where he must do good. He's angry, bitter and just wants to be free. When sexy Josette appears in his world he does all he can to return her to hers only he wants to go as well. Anything to get out of dodge. And to stay near a woman who dares him to risk his heart again.There are those who are confused about this book. Who are wondering what the heck? What they haven't realized (I'm sure they have by now) what they hadn't realized is that this book brings us some of the great heroes and villains from Ms. Kenyon's Lords of Avalon Series. It's something of a transitionary book and those are always questioned. People want to understand. What they fail to understand is that sometimes, it takes time. Time to fully integrate the book into the over all arc.I enjoyed this book BECAUSE of it's Avalon connection, the same thing that has so many confused. It might not have been her best in the series, not every book can be, but it was fun.If you're a DH lover and haven't yet read this book, do so. It will matter eventually.Shauni

Originally Reviewed For: Bodice Rippers, Femme Fatales and FantasyEver wonder why a dragon is hanging out at Sanctuary? Yeah me too and in book 25 of her famed Dark Hunter Series, Sherilyn Kenyon tells us why.Back in New Orleans life is looking good. Fang and Aimee are about to become parents, Sanctuary has been rebuilt and the world seems slightly normal. You know normal for a group of Weres, Dark Hunters, gods and demons.. but then an enemy appears that none of them have ever seen before. A tribe of Arcadian AMAZONS, can it get any more interesting? Seems they are looking for Max. Max? The Dragon who hangs out in the attic? That Max?Max isn't just a dragon, he's THE dragon. The first dragon were, he should be royalty, instead he's considered the one Dragon everyone seems to want to kill. Well, he's Max to most people and The Dragonbane in legend only. He's perfectly happy hanging out in the Petier's attic. Helping out when needed but for the most part minding his own business. But when his mate appears, the mate who all but killed him several centuries (ok millennium) agp, Max finds himself drawn into her battles. It's either that or die.Seraphina was mated to an amazing man. A man who put her first, who cared for her, who gave up his ways for her. Only problem is, he's a Dragon. An animal first and foremost. And her first loyalty is to her tribe, the tribe that kills dragons. So Max comes second, every single time. With and act of betrayal so deep even Seraphina knows it's wrong, she looses him. Unknowingly she has lost her HEART and the father of her unborn children. But now? Those very children's lives are in danger and Seraphina finds that she has to betray him one more time. Only she won't. Not this time.Yes there were untold betrayals but they were not those deep, horrid ones we found in Archeron and Styxx. Max was betrayed by love and has to find a way to forgive and it's a story told beautifully as only Sherrie can do.What we have is a merging of story lines. Son of No One brought us the long awaited next book in Ms. Kenyon's Lords of Avalon Series, combining the two series but Dragonbane tells us what's going on. Ancient enemies start working together and the Hunters, all of them, have to band together. Only the Weres are still in fighting working harder on trying to destroy each other than the true enemy. Once again, it's the "human" aspect of the Weres that show the true evil. They spout self righteous vitriol but do their damnedest to destroy what should be honored.What can I say? Another most excellent book by the amazing Sherrilyn Kenyon.Shauni

Originally Reviewed For: Tea and BookI can't remember when I fell in love with Erin Kellison's books. I just know that I have. But even I was surprised to fall in love with Tempted by Fire. I have been so immersed in her Reveler Series of late that I forgot that she writes other books.Tempted by Fire is book one in Ms. Kellison's Dragons of Bloodfire series and wow, what a book it is. It was intense, emotional, exciting, romantic and absolutely fabulous. I loved everything about it!Emerson Clark is bloodkin, whatever that means. She was raised in the foster system, the human foster system, and considers herself fully human. She really doesn't even believe in dragons. She just heard a distant relative say she was a dragon when she was very young and figured what the heck and put that on her SCHOLARSHIP APPLICATIONS. Oh man, she had no idea how her life would change. But it's been years and she is so fed up with the bloodkin and she is so quitting this job. Right after this last assignment.Dragon shifter Thane Ealdian is at the end of his cycle, he is ever closer to changing to dragon for the last time. Only the unsolved mystery of what happened to his wife and son has kept him alive. Now, finally, the bodies have been found and he refuses to allow his enemies of old claim them as his. He has demanded a mediator and is not so patiently waiting for him. Only the him turns out to be the oh so sexy Emerson Clark and well sparks are flying. Suddenly, Thane has a whole new lease on life. Now he just needs to convince her that yes dragons do EXIST and yes you are one. See, easy peasy..This was so much more than a boy meets girl story. Emerson has to discover her entire life. Who she is, what's her heritage and how she fits in. And Thane? Well he has his own surprises to deal with. Seems an old enemy might be innocent, maybe.. and old friend might be.. *grins* might be.. Nothing is as it seems and everywhere they turn is betrayal of belief at the very least. The only person they can rely on is Emerson's foster brother a wolf who's extremely unhappy with his pack and Thane's BEST FRIEND/servant...Just a wonderful story... Get it, enjoy it.. and let me know what you think.ShauniThis review is based on the ARC of Tempted by Fire, provided by the author for an honest review.

Originally Reviewed For: Tea and BookI am the first to say that Mary Morgan's, Order of the Dragon Knights Series is steeped in legend, has grand sweeping landscapes and epic lovestories.. It is a fantastic series that combines some of Scotland's known legends with sheer fantasy. It has time travel and Druids, Dashing Heroes in need of redemption and strong Heroines willing to believe in the impossible.The first two books Dragon Kinght's Sword and Dragon Knight's Medallion are beyond spectacular but book three, Dragon Knight's Axe was a bit of a miss. Don't get me wrong it was a very good book but it lacked the power of mythos.The legend continues and this time it's Alastair MacKay who is destined to find redemption in the arms of his destined mate, a woman from the future. Only this time there's a twist.. no I'm not telling you *grins*Fiona OQuinlan is a modern woman with her head in the past. Translating ancient texts is her greatest pleasure and she often gets lost in the wonder of it all. When a "friend and co-worker" steals her work and claims she hasn't done a thing, Fiona is tossed from her latest assignment and at a bit of a loss of what to do. Fortunately a temporary position on another dig came up and from there Fiona is literally transported to the past. Right into a slave auction. Only to be saved by a big "beast" of a man and feeling like she's gone from the fire to pan..Alastair MacKay has turned his life on his family and heritage. He's convinced that he has nothing to offer mankind and his legacy is nothing but a lost dream. He's a man of the earth but to further punish himself he forces himself to make his life at sea. When on land he's there for the shortest period possible. But one such stop changes the course of his life.Alastair is never quite sure of why he saved Fiona from the slave mart, he just knew he had to. He tried to turn away from her but there was something constantly pulling at him. And when he tried to return her to her family both of them were in for the surprise of a lifetime, or two!Watching Alastair and Fiona run as fast as they can away from each other only to keep finding the other in the same place was rather fun. While this was an emotional push and pull I wanted more Druids and Dragons.. And I am thinking I am being a bit rough because as I write this review I realize that there was so much going on behind the scenes. That the Druid dynamics are much subtler I have to rethink my initial claim on this book. It isn't as action packed as the first two, it's subtler, it's sneakier. And yet the relationship between Alastair and Fiona was strong and true.I loved that while Fiona fit perfectly in the past, she was always a modern woman with a mind of her own and Alastair had to prove himself to her not the other way around.ShauniThis review is based on the ARC of Dragon Knight's Axe, provided by the author for an honest review.

Originally Reviewed For: Tea and BookDark Night is book two in Caris Roane's Amulet Series. In this series, Caris tips her hat to erotica and I promise, sex plays a huge part. It's important to understand that it is used as part of the story not GRATUITOUSLY but it's still used, a lot.Dark Night is a bit longer than Wicked Night and tells us a bit more about the Amulets and how they were created and how they can be used. It's also longer so there is room for more story telling.Master Vampire Eligio is pretty much on the prowl and rather horny. You would think any female would do but nope, he wants the witch Sol-Brenna but she's been keeping him at arm's length. But she just purchased and amulet on the black market and that's a big no-no. Eligio is willing to TRADE justice for sex all he has to do is get her to agree.Sol-Brenna is a powerful witch with a long family history. Her family is actually the one who crafted the amulet originally centuries ago. When she finds it for sale she knows it needs to be taken off the market. It's too dangerous. It is a healing amulet but the right witch can bathe it in her potions and turn it into a killing one. Her intentions are good but that darn vamp is on her trail and wants to barter. Sol-Brenna doesn't want a relationship with another Vampire but when these two get together things combust.. and no one is saying no.While this book has more to it than Wicked Night it still lacks Caris' usual deft hand. There is just not enough story well the story is there it's just missing something.As you know, I adore Caris Roane and while I am harsh on this particular series, it might just be that it's not my cup of tea. I seriously suggest you take the time to check it out because no matter my thoughts, there is no getting around the fact that Caris knows how to tell a story.ShauniThis review is based on the ARC of Dark Night, provided by the author for an honest review.

Originally Reviewed For: Tea and BookPrimal Heat is Book 6 in A.C. Arthur's, The Shadow Shifters Series. I enjoyed it but felt like I was missing way too much. I am going to say right off the top, this book is really not a stand alone. Yes, you can read it as such, I did. Yes, it was good but it could have been great and I think, had I read books 1-5 first, I would have called this great.The Shadow Shifters have been in hiding for centuries but have recently come out of the shadows. They have lived by their rules but now have to live by a world that still isn't quite sure what to make of them. They have been targeted, there are those who would refuse to accept them as human but the Shifters want to SURVIVE in today's world.It's not bad enough that they have issues with the world at large, they have inner species politics as well. Rome is the leader of the Shadow Shifters in the US, a powerful shifter who is committed to saving his people.. Under him is a large contingency of officers and soldiers..Eli Preston is one of those soldiers. High ranking and loyal to the bone his past has lead him to believe that he will die young and without a mate. So when sexy Nivea becomes his trainee and partner he does everything he can to put her off.Nivea comes from a family that refuses to accept that they are shifters. Powerful people who have pushed her out on questionable circumstances. All she wants to do is serve her people at any cost. At any cost that is until she discovers her feeling for the aloof but gorgeous Eli.Eli was a bit of a jerk, so involved in what was best for him (and of course he was wrong) he pushed Nivea away on a regular basis. I would have smacked him upside the head and looked elsewhere. Oh wait she couldn't because he was her destined mate. Yeah why do characters have to put up with that crap?The overall arc of saving the Shadow Shifters was compelling, brutal and was what really sold this story. Which would have been great had I read the other books because as I said earlier, without that information I often felt lost and confused.All in all it was a good book, not a great romance, and really too much work. I might keep reading this series, maybe catch up on previous books, to see if that makes a difference. It's worth not shutting it down over one book.ShauniThis review is based on the ARC of Take Me, provided by netgalley

Originally Reviewed For: Bodice Rippers, Femme Fatales and FantasySometimes if you are very very lucky you find this amazing gem of a book. Livia Blackburne's Daughter of Dusk is just that type of book. It is book two in her Midnight Thief Novels really really well worth the read. Yep, this is me gushing!Daughter of Dusk is most definitely a second book in the series, I don't suggest reading it as a stand alone. I did and totally enjoyed it but I knew all along that there was so much I was missing. Because of this it took me a while to actually get into the book and I often considered just not finishing it. Which would have been a shame because once I was able to completely immerse myself, I fell in love.This is one of those YA books that transcends age. It's fantasy at it's best. I would certainly rate this right along Cinda Williams Chima's, Seven Realms Series.. It has that wonderful ability to make the reader forget just what age the characters are. These are individuals written with depth of character, personality and incredible nuances.Daughter of Dusk begins with it's heroine Kyra, an orphan, having been raised in the streets until she is discovered by the head of the Assassins Guild. She has been scouted and they want her.. for a while that was wonderful but she discovers that she wants more. She also discovers that she is half of another species, for lack of better description a large cat species, but she doesn't want to be part of them and has been allowed to join the palace guards. That's your back story...The book begins with Kyra being allowed to be part of the guard but not really. More like a scout, they use her for her talents but will never allow her to belong. Again she's okay with that for a while, until she discovers that the leading council is so filled with rot that they need to be overthrown. Her boss, a decent enough man and member of the council, is trying to begin change from the inside but in the mean while people are dying and the elite are just that.. above the rules.Kyra also realizes that with the way things stand she can never be more than friends with the man she is falling in love with. He has been demoted from being a knight and now works with the guard. His demotion came because he dared to act on his convictions (again in book 1). But he is still a lord's son and there is no way they can ever be together...And if that's not enough..Kyra is slowly, very slowly beginning to accept what she is and realizes that she wants answers. Her questions lead to some pretty interesting discoveries. But because she is all areas she is uniquely positioned to bring them all together. A battle is coming and the City/State of Forge is on the line. Hard to believe that it's all in the hands of one outcast and her group of friends.JUST FABULOUS!!! I would seriously consider this a MUST READ book! And if you love YA or better yet are YA, then this book is for you!ShauniThis review is based on the ARC of Daughter of Dusk, provided by netgalley

Originally Reviewed For: Bodice Rippers, Femme Fatales and FantasyIn the 30th book of her Amazing Breeds Series, Lora Leigh shows us how it's done.How does a series keep going? Well you have to create interesting characters, strong heroes and then match them with the perfect heroine (or the other way around as the case may be). Then you have to have an ultimate evil and wrap that around an intriguing plot.There is even more than that, you have to keep the readers interested so you can't keep it the same. In Ms. Leigh's case she has several sub plots and mini arcs going on. Bengal's Quest ends this latest mini arc.. Maybe.. I mean Ms. Leigh could totally change things up and well there is still Judd's story so maybe not. But I am getting ahead of myself here..Four children raised in labs, two human girls too sick to survive without medical help and two Bengal Breeds. They formed a unit and survived inspite of the world around them. Then one girl was "healed" and sent home and things started changing. One Breed escaped and one remained behind to protect the last girl.. Only they were scheduled to be terminated and those two escaped, meeting up with the third girl and disappearing off the face of the earth. The last Bengal Boy tried to help them escape but was wounded and forced by those that love him to accept a transfusion only it changed him, way too young.It's been years and that lost Bengal Boy is a man bent on vengeance he wants his life back and his only goal is to kill those who forced this feral heat on him. Only it's not a feral heat, it's a mating heat, something no young child should have to endure..Cat was born a human, but was genetically altered into a Breed in an effort to save her from a childhood illness. For years she posed as Claire Martinez, hiding from the Genetic Council and the Breed who swore to kill her. Claires Native American spirit and family kept Cat safe until Claires father attacked her, revealing he is part of the Council. Now she has exposed herself as Cat, a Bengal Breed.Gideon has protected Cat since the moment she was placed in his arms as an infant, he was only a child himself but she mattered. Only tragedy hit and he lost his focus for a while, but Cat is back no longer hiding who she was and Gideon is now known as Graeme.. Maybe, just maybe they can finally have that life they deserve.Ok, this entire concept was a bit hokey for me. I enjoyed the characters and their finding their way back to each other but I did get lost at times with the Cat/Claire aspect. I understood it, it just detracted from the story a bit. Ok for me, a lot.I think this time Jonas came across as too much of a jerk and he left me cold. I have always liked Jonas but this time.. not so much.Even saying that, I enjoyed this book and it was well worth the read.Shauni

Originally Reviewed For: Tea and BookExposing the Heiress just proves the case that if it walks like an author and talks like an author.then it's an author. Written by Jenifer Apodaca AKA Jennifer Lyon, author of my very beloved Wing Slayer Hunters, it explodes from the pages from the very beginning.Book three of her once a marine series it soars in it's very own way.Alyssa Brooks was the beloved daughter of a Hollywood icon, as a teenager she was driving the car that skid from the road and killed her mother. Living with the guilt she has done everything possible to be the brand of the family business. Helping her stepfather every way she could. Only when she finds out that her fiance is actually in cahoots with said stepfather, that it was all a scam she was infuriated and broke of the engagement. Only her fiance was more evil than she ever dreamed and he threatened the child she had given up for adoption. The child she loved so dearly that she wanted only for him to have a normal life. Either marry him or the child is in danger.. yeah right. Alyssa might feel guilty but she's not stupid. Turning to the Once a Marine Agency and asking for the one man she knows she can trust, Hunter Reece.Hunter Reece was raised in an artistic, peace loving family but no matter their personal beliefs each person was encouraged to follow his/her own path. Hunter's path led to the marines, where he became a decorated sniper. Only he got too good at it and realized that each kill was taking parts of his soul and it was time to get out or loose what little was left. Hampered by nightmares he sculpts for therapy but he makes his living at Once a Marine, an elite bodyguard service. When he is called in to guard former family friend Alyssa Brooks he is conflicted, furious that she turned her back on his family, worried about the threats against her and the worst part? He wants her..The thing about military suspense is it's a very "in" sub genre. It is easy to get lost among the others, fortunately for us Jennifer knows how to tell a story. It doesn't matter if it's PNR (Wing Slayer Hunters), Erotica (Plus One) or Military Suspense, it's not the genre it's the story. And what a story this was.Intense emotions flow between the pages of Exposing the Heiress. Watching Alyssa shed her guilt and become the woman her mother would have wanted her to be was a joy. Watching her fall in love with a strong man instead of allowing a weak one (her step father) to manipulate her or an evil one (her fiance) to try and control her was amazing. Watching Hunter walk through his nightmares into the light was equally stunning. Touching, intense, poignant and totally beautiful.What this book really shares is that you don't need gimics to tell a beautiful story you just need talent.. .Great Book.ShauniThis review is based on the ARC of Exposing the Heiress, provided by netgalley.

Originally Reviewed For: Bodice Rippers, Femme Fatales and FantasyThe Earl Claims a Bride is book two in Amelia Grey's Heirs Club of Scoundrels Trilogy. It's simple, sweet and a traditional regency. A Story about duty that turns into desire and the world that revolves around that duty.Miss Angelina Rule has plans for her life and it isn't marrying a come late to the party Earl. She fell in love with a soldier years ago and has promised herself to him. But when the Prince himself declares that she should marry Harrison Thornwick, the most recent Earl of Thornwick, it's kind of hard to resist. But she does... until she discovers that Harrison is a man worth getting to know and the man she loved might not be anything more than a childish dream.Harrison Thornwick was perfectly happy being the 4th son and totally unlikely to ever be the Earl but when his father, then brothers die he discovers he's up. Grieving for his family he is willing to muddle through but the Prince has plans for him. The Prince himself has declared that Harrison marry Miss Angelina Rule, a woman who defies all the rules.. Smitten but cautious, Harrison has to decide just what is important to him and how he is going to define his life.This was not a radical regency romance, it's a story about choices, about duty and honor, family and finally Love. Ms. Grey weaves a tale that brings these two together, creates a world where they belong and yet both still find themselves on the outside looking in. Never quite knowing their place until they are thrust into it.I enjoyed this book it tells a nice story but it lacked a depth and passion that a powerful romance can have. It's ok, this is a strong, sturdy romance that keeps readers coming back for more.I certainly recommend it.ShauniThis review is based on the ARC of The Earl Claims a Bride, provided by netgalley

Originally Reviewed For: Bodice Rippers, Femme Fatales and FantasyA Lady's Guide to Skirting Scandal is a nice little place saver in Kelly Bowen's, Lords of Worth Series.. a sweet little novella that is designed to keep you reading, good news. It works.It's a story about getting a second chance, about finding redemption and maybe love.We first met Lady Viola Hextall in A Good Rogue is Hard to Find and she wasn't all that nice. Sure she was the sweet younger sister but this was a girl on a mission. Her mission? To land a Duke, no matter the consequences. She even tried to compromise her brother's best friend. A man who has been a friend to her as well for years. She didn't care, she wants that title. Well big brother has had enough and sends her off to America for a visit. Well chaperoned but still on her own. A bit of isolation might do her some good.Nathaniel Shaw wants to explore the interior of America. Since he is a doctor he is paying his way over by acting as ship's doctor. While on board he strikes up a rather interesting friendship with the ship's spoiled miss. Only he discovers that she is more than just a spoiled miss. She has a brain and amazingly enough wants to use it. Nathaniel is the type of man who finds a strong woman with a brain incredibly attractive, so of course this new and improved Viola is something special.Sure Viola is a self centered brat but she is kept that way by her family and the chaperons that were forced on her?? I would have pushed them overboard right off the bat. Her brother approved shipboard reading material but the women who were in charge of her tossed them all overboard. This aggravated me so much I almost couldn't finish.. BUT Viola came into her own.. and that was revenge enough.A short novella designed to keep our attention.ShauniThis review is based on the ARC of A Lady's Guide to Skirting Scandal, provided by netgalley

Originally Reviewed For: Bodice Rippers, Femme Fatales and FantasyOne of the things I really enjoy about Harlequin is that they insist on sweet, charming stories. Oh sure they have different sub genres but in the end they are Harlequin and their brand always promises something heartwarming.Catherine Mann has written her Diamonds in the Rough Series and it fits Harlequin's demands. It is charming, sweet and heartwarming It's also sexy, sensual and at times sizzling.. Guess it's not your mama's Harlequin anymore.Jewelry designer Amie McNair was raised by her grandparents. Sure her parents were around but they were of the trust fund baby type and pretty much had their kids, expected them to be their little showcases or ignored them. Amie wanted more and has become a top notch jewelry designer for the family company. But her cousin stepped down as CEO and her grandmother appointed an outsider and Amie is so not thrilled about it. She's so stressed about the whole thing she has a sexy wallbanger in the coat closet.. bad enough but then she discovers he's the new CEO..OOOOPS..Preston Armstrong was looking forward to the chance at starting over and when he meets the eyes of a gorgeous woman his world literally stops turning. An amazing sexual experience makes him hope maybe there is something more. Only to discover that she's the granddaughter of the owners and she wants nothing more from him. How can he make her understand that while they can never have forever (he doesn't do forever) they can have something special right now.When granny sends Amie on a week's trip with Preston, representing the new brand to the business world. Amie knows it's a test, learn to work with Preston or consider getting a new job. Only it's about more than just working with Preston.. That one night had consequences and Amie has to figure out how to tell him.See traditional yet sizzling.. Ms. Mann has a knack. This is not a new trope, it's certainly not a new story. But Ms. Mann makes it fresh and exciting. She brings chemistry to her characters and as a reader I was invested in their relationship. Which means this book worked..ShauniThis review is based on the ARC of Pregnant by the Cowboy CEO, provided by netgalley

Originally Reviewed For: Bodice Rippers, Femme Fatales and FantasyI know, I have become a bit obsessed with Bull Rider Stories.. Especially Harlequin's. I just can't help myself they have become a bit of a guilty pleasure. And Cathy McDavid gives us a little gem in The Bull Rider's Son.Cassidy Beckett has dealt with a lot in this lifetime. Her parents fought constantly about his drinking and an accident caused the final split. Of course Cassidy was in the accident and insisted that her mom choose.. Him or her.. Ridden by guilt she has spent a lifetime pushing people away. So when she becomes a single parent and she and the father split she never told him. But things are changing. Her father has returned sober and the man she really loves is back. Nope not the father of her son, the uncle...Shane Westcott has recently discovered he was a father. After years on the Bull Rider Circuit he has had to give it up due to injury. Seems his ex has finally decided that he is grown up enough to know he has a daughter. Now his entire life has been about being the best Dad he can. Only his new job brings him close to Cassidy Beckett.. the girl he adored.. Only she has a son and he reminds her of someone. When he discovers who, let's just say he's a bit peeved for his brother. Seeing a parallel between their livesCathy McDavid writes a complicated story one that depends a lot on love and forgiveness. It's sometimes not that sweet Harlequin romance we are used to and that's ok because it's very emotionally packed.It also addresses an issue that is often ignored in this world. Father's Rights. You see Cassidy's point and understand her fears but you know she's wrong. She's struggling to keep her world straight and everything keeps tilting. Just like real life. Only the harder Cassidy holds on the faster things seem to slip away..This was very well written and while sometimes uncomfortable (I am a single mother after all) it is also a strong modern romance.ShauniThis review is based on the ARC of The Bull Rider's Son, provided by netgalley

Originally Reviewed For: Bodice Rippers, Femme Fatales and FantasyThank you Mary Wine for returning us to an excellent medieval world. As a fan of medieval romance I thrive on books from that era. Unfortunately it's not an in genre right now and the publishers aren't pushing it. So it takes guts to listen to your characters and write the story that needs to be written.. And Mary Wine does it so very well.A Sword for His Lady is book 1 in Ms. Wine's Courtly Love Series so I am thrilled to say that there will be at least one more book after this that takes place in this genre.. YAY!!!Isabel of Camoys is a woman of her time. She was married young for land and station and it was a horrible marriage. Again, typical of their time. But she's widowed now and holding the keep she earned. But again, she is a woman and that means her keep will never really be her own. It seems her husband's family wants it back but even more importantly the king wants her married with a strong husband so he basically gave her and her home away in marriage. So, Isabel has a choice.. marry the king's choice or marry back into the family that she loathes.. seems a no brainer to me. But Isabel really wants to be free that is until she actually meets the man the king has chosen for her.Ramon de Segrave is the kings man, through and through. So when the king tells him he isn't going on the next crusade, instead he is to be landed and married, Ramon accepts, begrudgingly, but he accepts. Upon finding a home filled with loyalty, laughter and love, Ramon is intrigued. When he discovers that the woman of the keep has run the estate for years and it's healthy financially he is amazed. Upon meeting Isabel he is smitten. Now all he needs to do is convince her that he's the perfect man for her.This book was just swoonworthy.. Ramon is truly a knight in shining armor just what a fair maiden dreams of. But he's also earthy and intelligent and well worth falling for.One of the truly excellent things about this book was the fact that Isabel truly was a woman of her time. What most of us never realize is that the woman of the keep was so much more than the arm candy that she has been portrayed as. A well trained young woman of nobility from that time had to run entire businesses.. the farming, the tanning, the payroll, the servants, the infirmary, the... get the picture. She wasn't expected to be the "little woman" she was expected to run the estate and make her husband's life run as smoothly as possible. And when he was away on crusade or during some other battle, she was his voice. The middle ages in some ways were way more progressive than any of us realize.. Mary Wine brings so much of that to life in A Sword for His Lady because she also realized that while the woman did all of the work, the man really was needed for his strength and sword arm. Without a strong defense a keep could fall to political enemies or barbarians or... anyone who wanted it.Ms. Wine also did not make King Richard the Lion Hearted a sympathetic character. She made him the "rock star" that he was. A man with huge charisma and little love for his country. This was the man who is still revered in England yet managed to bankrupt his country and spent little of the eleven years that he was king actually in England..While doing all of this, Ms. Wine tells a beautiful romance. A Sword for His Lady is the kind of book that I used to adore. A fabulous historical novel laced with fact and fiction while telling a beautiful, sexy love story. So again, Thank You Ms. Wine.ShauniThis review is based on the ARC of A Sword For His Lady, provided by netgalley

Originally Reviewed For: Bodice Rippers, Femme Fatales and FantasyDo Not Forsake Me is a welcome sequel to a much loved romance. In the early 90's Roseanne Bittner wrote an epic fantasy, Desperate Hearts. It was a sweeping saga and affected readers deeply. I did not read it in the 90's so my wait for a sequel was much shorter but no less exciting..Do Not Forsake Me follows the Jake and Miranda Harkner as they serve out Jake's sentence. Jake has been released from prison and exonerated for his most famous crime, the one he never did. But he did commit crimes and he needed to make amends to society. So he has been sentenced to become a federal marshal in Oklahoma Territory. A place so wild and savage that no law man wants the job. The idea was to send in a man who lived the life to help clean it up.Jake has taken this job to heart but he wants a life of peace, he's always wanted a life of peace. So he has petitioned to have his sentence suspended, he just needs to get through the next few months while waiting for an answer.. Life should be easy, right?Yeah.. the Harkners do not lead a simple life, try as they might. Miranda is faced with an illness that could take her life and Jake would never survive that. And his enemies have plans of revenge all their own.This book was much less sweeping as it was pretty much contained to one year's time but that did not distract from the depth of emotion Ms. Bittner plays with. Reading Do Not Forsake Me was like sitting in a warm embrace. Yes, there were troubles but the love that radiates from Jake and Miranda is a beautiful thing. But they are not perfect and their family does suffer from Jake's mistakes.Ms. Bittner deals with love and forgiveness beautifully. She shows again and again that true strength is not about the physical but comes from within and her heroines are the strongest women I have ever read. They are survivors, not just of life but with love.This book can easily be read as a stand alone but if you chose to do so, you are missing out on a beautiful story that brings you and the Harkners to this point in their lives..I heartily suggest you read Outlaw Hearts, then Do Not Forsake Me and when it comes out LOVE'S SWEET REVENGE which will be the third book in this amazing saga..This series is what romance books are all about and Do Not Forsake Me lives up to it's predecessor, showing both new readers and those who read this years ago, Roseanne Bittner just gets romance.ShauniThis review is based on the ARC of Do Not Forsake Me, provided by netgalley

Originally Reviewed For: Tea and BookTerry Spear is back with yet another delightful and delicious read. In her 16th Heart of the Wolf Series Book, Ms. Spear returns to the her Seal Team, to the last of the unmarrieds..Lori Greypaw is one of the last wolves standing.. The pack had been decimated years before and what was left has moved on. But a small amount remain (a very small amount). Lori is pretty much the acting Alpha because the man who should be Alpha, the man she has loved forever, refuses to stay home and accept the job. But her Grandma has something up her sleeve and the charity auction plays a huge part.Paul Cunningham has managed to avoid his responsibilities for years. He doesn't want to be the pack Alpha, he doesn't feel he deserves it. But when he comes home between missions, he is conned into a bachelor auction and won by Lori Greypaw's granny. Only she isn't trying to match them up. Nope she wants Paul to do some fixing up at her cabin. Hmmmmmm sure Lori is going to help but it seems she really does just want him to work on the cabin.. Man is she slick...Paul and Lori discover that sure they had childish feelings for each other but these days their hearts are more mature and what they are finding together is worth fighting for. Of course there are some issues that must first be resolved.. And some thugs from a neighboring pack seem to have less than honorable intentions but Paul and Lori have begun to discover something worth fighting for.Ms. Spear writes her Heart of a Wolf Series in a meandering style. Sometimes the books are connected and sometimes they skip to another pack only vaguely attached. But it doesn't matter what or who she writes about she tells stories that have a rich and full history. Her packs are connected if for no other reason than because they really all are intertwined.I enjoy this series and always look forward to reading what Ms. Spears decides to share with us. Now if I can just figure out how to get one of her stuffed creations I would be a happy camper.Thanks Terry.. As Usual a book to savor.ShauniThis review is based on the ARC of SEAL Wolf Hunting, provided by netgalley

Originally Reviewed For: Bodice Rippers, Femme Fatales and FantasyIt's hard to believe that How to Marry a Royal Highlander is book four (and two novellas) in Vanessa Kelly's Renegade Royals Series but amazingly enough it is.We have wandered through three of their lives and watched them find love and now it's time for Alasdair Gilbride's story. A man who was fortunate to have a real father love and raise him and to be the heir to the Scottish Earldom. He's done his duty, he's served the crown and now it's time to return home. To the grandfather he adored, the father he loved and respected and to the betrothed he never wanted. He was so against the betrothal that he ran away at 16 and went to war, among other things Now it's time to face the piper.. only now it's a 100 times worse because he not only doesn't want his betrothed he does want his best friend (and cousin's) sister in law..Eden Whitney, the favored twin, the adored twin, the twin who could do no wrong totally blew it.. One little escapade too many and suddenly she is persona non gratis. Not wanted, scandalous with no friends. She is being forced to head for Scotland and lay low for a while. Only her mother has plans to match make her with the sexy heir who is giving them a place to hide. Except of course Eden doesn't want to go to Scotland, it's barbarous, and away from society and of course the one man she wants but can't control is going to be her host. She doesn't want to fall for him but what's a girl to do?Now they only have to figure out how he can ever get out of his betrothal, appease his family and be together.Oh yes, another hit by Ms. Kelly! I enjoy this series immensely, partially because she dared to deal with a subject that is usually ignored. Yes every man over the age of 10 it seems slept around but no one ever really addresses the consequences. At least not from the consequences point of view. These are living breathing men and I am sure women who have to suffer for their parents actions and Ms Kelly makes them real. She makes them heroes, individuals to be admired.In Highlander, she also deals with family dynamics from the other side of the family. Where power and greed and maybe just a wee bit of insanity are gaining control and two people who might find happiness are being kept apart.She's just awesome and each book is a treat, Highlander offers us yet another chance to enjoy her wit and style, her dynamics and destines of those who some might not consider important.My opinion? Check it out.. another excellent storyShauniThis review is based on the ARC of How to Marry a Royal Highlander, provided by netgalley

Originally Reviewed For: Bodice Rippers, Femme Fatales and FantasyA Duke but No Gentleman by Alexandra Hawkins is not your mother's regency romance. It is dark, it is edgy and it borders on extreme behavior. For most of the book I waffled on whether or not I even liked it.There's edgy and then there's Ms. Hawkin's Duke.."The Duke of Blackbern and the Marquess Norgrave have always had the wildest of friendships. Best friends growing up, they bask in the pleasures the rich, opulent world that London has to offer, consuming drink and women at their leisure."Lady Imogen Sunter, the innocent daughter of a Duke who pretty much has the world at her feet. Her father wants her married and is willing to allow so much before making the decision for her. No more flitting, it's time to get serious. But when she lands in the middle of a bet between two of the Ton's nastiest rakes Imogen finds herself in an entirely different world.The Duke of Blackbern is not a nice man. It's not that he's a boys will be boys kind of guy.. or sowing his wild oats.. nope he's almost well for lack of better word, bad.. Yet when he meets pretty Lady Imogen, something inside of him starts to crumble and he realizes that maybe just maybe there is something more. Only his best friend seems to want her too and the bet is on.The edge in this book was gritty but even more it was borderline mean. I wasn't sure if either the Duke or the Marquess could be redeemed and I certainly didn't feel there was a better man. At least initially.As I read this book, I would get angry, become determined to put it down, to turn down the review, then I would read just a bit more and the story would get to me. Then it would begin all over again. The characters written in this book were certainly three steps forward, two steps back kind of characters. You think Imogen is a bit too naive, too trusty. That the Duke is a Cad at the very best ant the Marquess? Well you wonder just how deep his darkness goes.And redemption? Yeah, you have to wonder if there is any for any of them and them POW.. Ms. Hawkins makes it darker but somehow wonderful.This is not a feel good book, it's not an easy read but it is a very good book. Consider checking it out..ShauniThis review is based on the ARC of A Duke but No Gentleman, provided by netgalley

Originally Reviewed For: Tea and BookWOW!!!I don't even know how to write this review! There is so much going on in Part Four of the Soul Scorched Serial that I am at a loss. What can I say and what would be spoilers???So, I will say this was THE BEST part 4 in ANY of Donna Grant's books. Once it becomes the entire Soul Scorched Book, it might just be the BEST of the Dark Kings Series.. I won't say it is the best because there is more to come. I will say it could be the best so far! And we all know that is saying a lot!!There are betrayals galore. I will say that.. and those making the betrayals are a total surprise.Darcy has been making choices based on erroneous facts and the Kings? Well they don't get the facts either.Things look like they might be starting to make sense and then Donna tilts the playing board. I am back to not having a clue as to who is good and who is bad. Well the Dark are bad, aren't they?This was one of those man how can this book be over books... Totally delightful!!I don't want to wait until November for the next Dragon King Book... Good think Donna has a 1001 Dark Nights book out in August. But that's too long to wait as well..Just a great ending to this fabulous book.ShauniThis review is based on the ARC of Soul Scorched: Part 4, provided by netgalley

Originally Reviewed For: Tea and BookI know I have reviewed the serial books for this book but I wanted to just do a review of the entire book..Let me say this, without a doubt this is THE BEST book that Donna Grant has written. Her Dark Kings are heating up and I am not sure just who is truly trustworthy.Darcy Allen is just your everyday druid, from Skye, a faction that actually spells itself so that they not preform any magic that is evil. If you preform evil magic, you loose yours. Pretty harsh. But Darcy has worked with Ulrik and helped him.. and she still has her magic. Hmmmm, what does that say about Ulrik? But there is more going on than releasing Ulrik's magic. It's been three years and suddenly the Dark is after her. She's no longer safe at her home and she needs all the help she can get. Fortunately for Darcy.. she has this super gorgeous dragon on hand.Warrick has always been fascinated with humans. He couldn't even hate them when they were destroying the dragons. He is amazed by their brilliance and stupidity. But he's rather awkward when it comes to actually communicating, with anyone, so he has remained a dragon apart. Now Con has sent him to watch the Druid who is helping Ulrik. Warrick figures piece of cake, he can watch her and she'll never know he's there. Perfect plan until he sees the Dark that are beginning to surround her. Now he needs to be up close and personal and once he gets to know her, that personal part is beyond his control.Darcy and Warrick dance a slow waltz as they come together. There are trusts that need to be formed. Beliefs that need to be addressed and lines that need to be crossed. But somehow they know, that together they can conquer anything!Con is off on secret liaisons... when he's not trying to punish Darcy for her choices. And in his fear for the dragons, history might just repeat itself. Not good.Rhi is fighting a constant battle against the Dark within. Will she remain in the light? Or will her love for her Dragon finally destroy her? She has made some pretty serious self discoveries but more importantly some pretty accurate statements against the status quo..Ulrik... I still wonder about him. Even after his actions in Soul Scorched. Is he truly evil? There are those that say he is but I still wonder.Just a wonderful book! Way beyond 5 Stars.ShauniThis review is based on the ARC of Soul Scorched, provided by netgalley.

Originally Reviewed For: Tea and BookAnother Short Story another Short Review..Trapped by Caris Roane is book 1 in her Blood Rose Tales. A story about two people so lost in their differences they almost loose a love so powerful that it might change the world.Trapped is more of a vignette into the Blood Rose Series.. A short story just giving us a tease.Mastyr Vampire Zephyr is committed to two things, fighting wraith pairs (a particularly nasty group of enemies) and taking care of Alesia. If he had his way Alesia would be on permanent lock down and his forever. Only Alesia is way more independent than that.Alesia watched her mother become captured by the Wraith and forced to become part of a wraith pair. Since then, Alesia has become a staunch advocate for rehab not death on all wraith pairings. I don't know if the wraiths can be rehabbed but their bond pair? Those are mostly innocents that didn't choose this life. If Alesia had her way she would see all of them saved. Only her opinions have cost her Zephyr, the man she loves..But one night when they are attacked both of them realize that there is where more to the two of them than opposing points of view. It finally comes down to just what is more important? And what are they willing to do for love?Now this is Caris taking strides in her unique brand of Vampires. These men and women show a depth of character that showcases Caris' talent. I am looking forward to many more Blood Rose Tales and can't wait to get into the Blood Rose Series...A Short story but you know when you are reading this that there is an entire world out there you just have to explore..ShauniThis review is based on the ARC of Trapped, provided by the author for an honest review

Originally Reviewed For: Tea and BookA short review for a very short story..Caris Roane is one of my favorite authors and she has a way of writing Vampires that could make even the most ardent vampire hater fall in love.."Wicked Night is part of the Amulet Trilogy, three shorter novellas set in the world of the amulet in which Master Vampires protect and use powerful amulets to keep their tribes safe."What this trilogy offers is sex.. pure and simple. While it has a secondary storyline this book explores the steamier side of Vampirism. We all know that even from the beginning of the Vampire genre, they were sexy, beyond sexy (I still melt when I watch Dracula with Frank Langella). Usually Caris uses sex as part of the story.. but this time, the sex really is the story.I was not prepared for this and at times it was a bit off putting. To me, this was not one of Caris' best works. It wasn't the sex it was the lack of story and the stilted dialog. But once I got past that.. I was able to enjoy this book for what it was. Well written erotica...ShauniThis review is based on the ARC of Wicked Night, provided by the author for an honest review.

Originally Reviewed For: Tea and BookWhen I finished book 1 of Rebecca Zanetti's BRAND NEW Realm Enforcers Series, I sighed and said.. What a Wild Ride! Now I know that's not exactly the title of this book.. but it conjured up some pretty exciting thoughts. And once I began to ponder it, I realized, yep it truly was rather Wicked!I will say, I seriously LOVE Rebecca Zanetti.. I was a bit peeved with her because all of her series are ending.. but honestly, this my friends was a treat! It's a spin off from her Dark Protectors Series and she does a fabulous job of keeping them separate and yet combing them.. *grins* confused? Don't be, Wicked Ride is it's own entity with it's own villain but we do get to see the Kayrs, at least Dage and a few others..Alexandra Monzelle is a no nonsense cop with something of a chip on her shoulder. Raised by an arrogant ass of a drug dealing father until he was finally arrested when she was 12. All she's wanted to do since then was make the world a little better place by getting rid of the creeps like him. Life is going according to plan when a new drug hits the streets and a new face shows up at the same time. Sure he's a suspect but really, what a face!!Kellach Dunne is an enforcer for the Coven of Nine and he's been sent to Seattle to try and figure out who exactly is distributing this new drug. A Drug that can kill a witch, and they're supposed to be all but immortal. He and his brothers have managed to infiltrate a local motorcycle "club" (yes there really is a difference between club and gang). The "club" that is at the bottom of the drug distribution pile.. But it's a place to start. Kell and his brothers are slowly making progress but this gorgeous cop is ruining his concentration. A woman he can't get out of his mind and can not be his mate as she's not an enhanced human... or is she???These two sizzle! And watching Lex try and trust Kell is a work of art. Honestly would you truly believe a pretty face if he's a known affiliate of an established crooked organization? Or could you trust your heart? Or maybe you would waffle a bit..While Ms. Zanetti is building a whole new world she doesn't leave out some of our favorites. We see, Dage and Garret and Logan have active roles. She hasn't forgotten those we love.. just lets the simmer a bit while some new characters create an entirely new story.Evil abounds and we are never really sure who the bad guys are.. Oh sure we have inklings.. then Ms. Zanetti smacks that one down and brings them back.. evil wench!I am truly looking forward to more of this series.. When's the next book coming out???ShauniThis review is based on the ARC of Wicked Ride, provided by netgalley

Originally Reviewed For: Bodice Rippers, Femme Fatales and FantasyReady to take a trip back to the Highlands? Diana Cosby writes a story of love and intrigue, passion and power.. Of course she does it's about the Highlands.Lady Sarra Bellacote has managed to survive life on the borders. Even with her family dead she survived. But now she is being married off to a Highland lord, against her wishes.. She has no choice but to go but seriously, a Scottish guard? Does the man have to be so ridiculously gorgeous?Giric Armstrong, Earl of Terrick has made an oath. That's it, end of story. His word is his bond. After watching his clan be almost decimated, he needs the money being offered to deliver the lovely Lady Sarra to her guardian and betrothed. He needs to rebuild his clan and more importantly, his own self worth. Only Lady Sarra is way more than Giric imagined.A desperate race across Scotland to deliver Lady Sarra from home to hearth.. Only there are others who have other plans. It's life or death and passion reigns.An Oath Broken is certainly a book worth reading. It's action and delivery alone make it a fun read. And Diana Cosby got the political feel right. The reasons behind some of the characters actions are perfectly explained. Betrayal? Of course.Then there's the politics. Fighting for the right to a free Scotland and then again for just who will lead said Free Scotland has driven Scottish history. To ignore it would just be silly and Ms. Cosby weaves fact into fiction seamlessly.A thoroughly good book and I certainly would recommend it.ShauniThis review is based on the ARC of An Oath Broken, provided by netgalley

Originally Reviewed For: Bodice Rippers, Femme Fatales and FantasyWhat Jude Deveraux does better than just about anyone is make the average person seem larger than life. No matter the time span, he characters from the outside looking in seem pretty much a person of their times. Yet once she opens them up and shares them with us, they are super heroes.. they have depth and passion, they overcome obstacles, they are sometimes downtrodden but never down for the count. They are resilient, compassionate and in the end strong. Because of this ability Ms. Deveraux has, I have been a huge fan for years (even decades).The only thing better than a Jude Deveraux book is a Jude Deveraux book about the Montgomerys and the Taggerts. Seriously, I am so in love with these characters. Ever after is book three in her Nantucket Brides Trilogy and yes, it has plenty of both the Montgomerys and the Taggerts.. YAY!!Hallie Hartley was the Cinderella daughter, forced to give up first her childhood, then her college education and finally her adult life in caring for a manipulative step mother and her indulgent, self centered Step Sister. With the death of their parents, Hallie is forced to be the sole caregiver and responsible adult and yet still managed to struggle on. Tolerant and forgiving. That is until she walks in on said step sister trying to steal her inheritance. For some reason, Hallie has finally had enough and is determined to maybe this time, have a life of her own.James Taggert (yes one of those Taggerts) has had a rough few years. The sole survivor from an attack in Iraq, he suffers from severe PTSD and to top it all off, his brother convinced him to go skiing where he suffered a serious knee injury. He needs something to help him, both with his physical therapy and also his life. A nice quiet retreat on Nantucket seems nice. But when his Physical Therapist shows up he is hit with instant desire.. and the more he gets to know her, the more in love he falls. Now if he can just convince her that she's not a stand in for the woman he thought was going to show up (said step sister)Once again Ms. Deveraux wows.
