Purchase an Echo of your beloved child and you will not have to worry about her death, because you've got a spare raised in secrecy by Guardians to know the intimate details of her life.The process is not explained in detail, and I do admit some skepticism about how the Weavers are able to create physically identical human with the ingredients Mandanna relates, but this really doesn't detract from the story. The idea of the Echoes is less of a scientific venture than a philosophical one. What does it mean to be an Echo, to be intended to be someone else? Are they human? Do they have souls? Are they individuals? Should they have rights?The heroine, who names herself Eva, is the Echo of Amarra, the eldest daughter of a wealthy family in Bangalore. There's no doubt that Eva is her own person. She enjoys pursuits that Amarra does not, like art, and loves a boy that Amarra does not. Amarra and Eva both resent the intrusion of the other. Eva's presence cheapens Amarra's life because she feels expendable, and like she has to share everything with Eva; Eva exists only to be an imitation of Amarra, and has to squash her individuality, her desires, her ambitions. Their relationship and the way that only one of them can truly, openly exist at once has echoes of What's Left of Me by Kat Zhang.I rooted for Eva to get a chance at life. She has so much spirit and such a strong will to live, but she has no right to life if she doesn't follow a strict set of rules, and, even if she does, she could be killed for any number of reasons. Somehow, though, I never really connected with her or the other characters, except perhaps for Amarra's charming little brother Nikhil. I'm not really sure what was missing for me there, but that disconnect I felt kept me from completely loving the book.My only other concern is the very end. The very last chapter made things a bit more cut-and-dried than I would have liked. I thought Mandanna was going for an unclear ending, and she does in a way, but she tied up one arc with a neat little bow that did not fit with the mood of the rest of the book. For the kind of book that The Lost Girl is, the vaguely happy ending sounded a false note for me, though I imagine most readers will thrill to it, particularly if invested in the characters.Sangu Mandanna is an author to watch. Her debut is powerful, beautifully-written, and full of moving philosophical questions on what it means to be human. The Lost Girl is a great read-a-like for Kat Zhang's What's Left of Me.

As happens from time to time, I've read a book that is wonderful, but that does not work perfectly for the kind of reader that I am. Rootless by Chris Howard is a true dystopian/post-apocalyptic novel set in a nightmare landscape. The writing is beautiful and the characters are unique. I definitely like Rootless and I'm very impressed by Howard's debut, but I'm too easily confused by science for it to be the perfect book for me.First off, I want to praise Chris Howard's writing to the skies. The writing is beautiful, perfectly matched to Banyan and to the world itself. Howard manages to establish that Banyan speaks in dialect with the use of words like "reckon," but keeps it to a minimum. Thus, he clearly gets across the sound of the characters without making Rootless any less readable. Dialect done wrong is a miserable reading experience, and I think Howard takes a marvelous approach.Howard builds from a pretty standard dystopian formula with the evil corporation GenTech, but the world itself is like nothing I've ever read before. The world has gone to seed in just about every way possible. Trees and animal life (except for humans and locusts) have died out. The only remaining food source is a genetically modified corn that the locusts cannot eat, which means the locusts have to settle for the only remaining dietary option: people. Man-eating bugs are pretty much my worst nightmare. There are also pirates, and a whole lot of other unscrupulous, cutthroat folks. In Rootless, characters really do suffer, and it's not all about the romance; people die in nasty ways, just as they should in a good post-apocalyptic.Banyan works as a tree builder. What's a tree builder?, you might ask. Well, since the trees are gone, the landscape's a tad empty. Rich folks will pay to have trees built on their landscape. Banyan, as his father taught him, crafts trees out of metal. This is a very strange concept, but one that puts such a stark mental image of this world into my head. His cast of characters is just as memorably strange as the trees built out of metal.As I mentioned previously, the world in Rootless is one in which countless things have gone wrong. Genetic modification of foodstuffs lead to stronger locusts, which lead to no trees. A lack of trees presents its own problems. The moon also came closer to the earth, which messed with the ocean. All of the non-human animals are gone. Everything that's left is controlled by a corporation, the only institution capable of making food without cannibalism. All of this was just way too much for me to process, and I spent a lot of time confused, trying to figure out why something happened and what repercussions it would have on society.From interviews I've seen, I'm sure Howard has done his research and put tons of thought into everything, but he lost me. Actually, I had a similar problem with The Windup Girl by Paolo Bacigalupi, which is beloved of many people who understand science much better than I do. To tell you the hard truth, I was at best a mid-B range student in high school science. I know just enough to get things really wrong and muddled. Readers with more science background or less inclined to puzzle over things endlessly will likely not have this issue. Also, since Rootless is told from a first person perspective, the world building will likely become more clear as Banyan learns more.Oh, one last thing, Howard is a HUGE Star Wars fan. It's all over his inspiration board on Pinterest, for example. His love of Star Wars really shines through. There are some very cleverly done references, which I, having been raised from a young age to be obsessed with the original trilogy (the only one that exists in my brain), loved. Watch out for those, Star Wars fans!I highly recommend Rootless to readers who enjoy harder science fiction with a focus on world building and storytelling. Fans of Paolo Bacigalupi and Star Wars should especially take note.

I just devoured this novel from the first page, which is set in a bookstore by the way (what's not to love?). The Talents are similar to some other stories I have read, most recently those in the Alcatraz Smedry series by Brandon Sanderson, although he did something quite different with them. It reminded me too, for reasons I cannot divulge, of Shanna Swendson's Enchanted, Inc. books, which are also completely fabulous. The writing is good, the characters are interesting and the plot draws you in and keeps you there.Tamsin was easy to relate to from the get-go. Most everyone has felt like an outsider at some point or had sibling issues (although not me, as I'm an only child) or wished desperately for some special talent. She has a bit of an edge to her, which I appreciate for the most part. She sneaks out to bars to drink beer and watch bands with her roommate Agatha. She's sarcastic with her family. In addition, she adapts well to all crisis situations, trying desperately to make things work out; even though she doesn't always succeed, it's awesome that she tries, rather than sitting idly by waiting for a savior.My one big complaint about Tamsin is the scene where she smokes a cigarette in her room. Blah blah rebellion blah blah badass. I really hate smoking, because, well, it's awful. However, what really bugs me about this scene is that it has so little bearing on the rest of the book. It seems so out of place. Tamsin never smokes again, nor does anyone else mention her doing so. I can't help wondering if she was a smoker originally and most of it got edited out. Either way, it struck me as clunky and gross.Gabriel was totally awesome. His talent (finding things) rocks. I seriously want one of him for my own, so he can keep me from having to turn my house upside down trying to locate my missing remote. (This happened this evening and the remote was, of course, in the first place I looked. Why I didn't see it, I don't know, but that's always how it goes.Once a Witch was such a fun read and I am eagerly anticipating starting the sequel. If you're looking for an awesome summer read, definitely pick this up!

Mira Grant's Newsflesh trilogy is absolutely amazing. I love every single page of this series, and the box set is a great deal, one I will surely be gifting to friends, because, seriously, I cannot recommend this series enough.Yes, it's a zombie book and there's plenty of action and such to keep the pace moving. The Newsflesh Trilogy is also SO much more than that, a powerful commentary on politics and society.No author has surprised me like Mira Grant did in Feed. I never thought I could love Deadline as much as Feed, but I think I loved it more. The series even ends on a strong note.

First of all, I need to state clearly for the record that this was a totally stellar read. It reminded me quite a bit of A Long, Long Sleep by Anna Sheehan, which I read and adored a couple months ago. The stories are not the same at all, but the general idea is. Both take a well-known fairy tale, put it into a futuristic setting, and make something completely new and original with it. Cinder is, in case you couldn't guess, a revisionist version of Cinderella.I loved how Meyer weaved in the core elements of the fairy tale, but felt free to make some changes too. For example, Cinder was adopted into a family by Linh Garan, who promptly died, leaving her in the care of her stepmother, rather than him being her father as in the original story. One of her stepsisters is evil, but the other one is actually her best friend. She attends the ball where Kai is to choose his bride, despite having been ordered not to go. All of that clearly draws the correlation to the fairy tale.Cinder is all about dramatic irony, or at least it was for me. The book ends with a big reveal. I'm not sure whether it was supposed to be a twist, or if the audience was supposed to be sitting there shaking the book all the way through because they knew what was going on and no one else did. I suspect it may be the latter, because what happened was so obvious. Really though, I don't think the knowledge of where the overall story was heading detracted from the book at all.The setting here is completely amazing. Earth has apparently been through some serious turmoil. It now contains only six countries. The formation of these large powers occurred during the peace conference following World War IV. Ouch. Not to mention the fact that there are now folks living on the moon. What I am not sure of is whether the Lunars were initially human, although I suspect so.Cinder is a powerful heroine. I love how much she is not run of the mill. She has expert skills as a mechanic, is over a quarter machine, and hardly cares about her appearance. She cares deeply about the few people (or androids) she's close to and will risk herself to protect them. Plus, having a crush on the prince does not turn her into a brainless puddle of goo, something that I see a lot when the heroine hangs out with the hero of her book.Book two promises to be even better. I have no idea where the story will go from here and cannot wait to find out! Recommended to all fans of science fiction and fairy tales.

Because of my immense hatred for the term "new adult," I really did not have any plans to read this, though I did put on my GR to-read shelf for what that's worth. However, Jenni of Alluring Reads read this very recently and praised it to the skies, which prompted a Twitter discussion. Both Jenni and Steph of Cuddlebuggery insisted that I should read this book, but, because of a recently instated book-buying ban, I doubted that would happen anytime soon. At the book club's white elephant party, I "stole" a gift that included the paperback of Easy. Let's just say that I will definitely listen when Jenni and Steph tell me to read things.First off, this writing in Easy was amazing across the board. I have no complaints about this book being so immensely popular. Webber knows what she's doing and I can only hope that having been picked up by Penguin will make all of her books easier to get a hold of for people like me who do not like to buy ebooks. In case the fact that this used to be self-published worries you, do not be worries, because this has been both well-written and well-edited. Oh, also, can I say how incredibly thrilled I am that the email and text conversations in this book did not involve any text speak?Initially, Jacqueline frustrated me. Her newly ex-boyfriend, Kennedy, was so obviously an awful human being. Their relationship reminds me in every way of that of Elle Woods and her high school boyfriend in the movie Legally Blonde. A handsome, preppy guy heading for a sleazy career (lawyer/politician) dumps his beautiful, devoted girlfriend so that he can sleep around in college. On the plus side, that's better than cheating, but I had no patience for Kennedy whatsoever and could not fathom why Jacqueline stayed with him.Thankfully, Jacqueline proves herself again and again. After the dumping, Jacqueline reverts to using her full name in place of the nickname "Jackie" that he gave her, a reference to the president he was named for and his wife (UGH, seriously, why did she not know he was awful before?). When he inevitably comes crawling back, Jacqueline's much more mature about it than I could ever be, remaining civil but consistent in her lack of interest. Heck yes, girl!As is pretty well known by this point, Easy begins with an attempted rape, and that is a main theme throughout the book. Another reason I struggled with Jacqueline as a heroine at first was that she did not report the guy. However, I know that's completely realistic behavior. Thankfully, with the help of her completely supportive BFF, Erin (who I totally loved btw), Jacqueline manages to take charge of herself, finding new mental and physical strength. I loved that. Also, though there's a depiction of the dark side of the Greek system on college campuses, Webber does not malign it entirely. She kept everything fair, and I appreciate that, even though I'm one heck of a GDI and want nothing to do with frat guys myself.Please, please, please do not judge the romance in this book off of the blurb. The whole bit about how "He watched her, but never knew her" sounds creepy as hell, and, seriously, Lucas is not like that. He was in her class, so he would watch her there, the way people do when they're bored during a lecture. Since she was cute and smart, he would take note if he saw her on campus. This is completely normal and non-stalkerish behavior, okay? Lucas is not that guy; he does nothing a normal college student wouldn't do in the course of an attraction.Obviously, I love Lucas or I would not feel the need to defend his honor thus. He's just a great guy. He does do a couple of questionable things, but, honestly, I'm glad about those because they made him real. Otherwise, he would have been in manicpixiedreamboy territory. He's got some darkness and makes stupid decisions sometimes, which is much better than if he were purely perfect. As with all the best heroes, he empowers Jacqueline, and helps her to be better in every way. Plus, he does not pressure for sex at all. Speaking of sex, wow. Webber can write a sizzling scene. Much as I love YA, I do get to missing a well done sex scene, and Easy definitely scratched that itch.In case you didn't figure this out by now, I ended up loving this book, so much so that I devoured it in a matter of hours. I only hope I can figure out how to get my hands on her Between the Lines series soon.

First off, let me say that this is really a fantastic, luxury toilet paper. It's 3-ply and comes in rolls of 176 sheets, which means that it's not great for septic systems. If you don't have to worry about that, this toilet paper is a treat... soft, absorbent, and very, very plush.This particular package of Quilted Northern is "compressed core" toilet paper. In essence, the company slightly squished the rolls when packaging to produce a product that takes up less space. This doesn't alter the useability of the product - toilet paper is toilet paper - but it does result in a substantial reduction in the size of the package, which means that substantially fewer trucks will be needed to get this stuff to the store. I recently read an article about how seemingly tiny changes in energy consumption by large corporations can result in huge overall energy savings, and I applaud Quilted Northern management for making the effort to be more environmentally friendly. Overall, this is a great toilet paper from a forward-thinking company, and I definitely recommend it.

I got this for my 8 year-old who loves dolls and stuffed animals, and I find it to be a decent but fairly basic, no-frills baby carrier. It's pretty, and comes with a really nice padded fabric seat for the baby, which I like, but the straps that allow it to be worn are just okay. They're thin nylon, and slide over the child's shoulders like a backpack with no padding or reinforcement. It's easy to get off and on, but it's not exactly comfortable to wear for long periods of time.My daughter has tried this carrier with several different dolls, including her 12" Corolle baby and a larger sized Baby Alive doll, as well as with her Build-a-Bear animals, and it works fine with all of them for short periods of play, which is all she requires. Overall, this is a good pretend baby carrier for the price, and I think most little girls would like it just fine. For dedicated baby wearers willing to spend a bit more, however, I'd recommend a Boba Mini Carrier, a higher-quality toy baby carrier made by a company that makes real baby carriers too.

I got these jeans for my husband and he's been wearing them quite a bit. The waist has an inner elastic waistband all the way around, which he finds to make them a little more stretchy and comfortable around the waist than your average pair of jeans. Style-wise, the hips and thighs of these jeans are fairly slim-fitting, while the calves and ankles are cut a bit more generously. It's not what I'd typically call a "relaxed fit", but my husband still finds them very comfortable.As far as quality goes, these jeans are just what I'd expect from Wrangler... sturdy and well-made, and they've held up great in the wash. Overall, this is a great pair of jeans for the price.

This waterproof pad is double-sided with a moisture barrier in the center, and flat rather than fitted. It's exactly the size of my daughter's mattress, so it covers the bed from edge to edge. I've always had a wrap-around, fitted mattress pad on her bed, which works really well but is a bit of a pain to get off and on the mattress, especially in the middle of the night. I was hoping this pad would be a bit more convenient and work just as well, but it doesn't.First of all, because this pad isn't attached to the mattress in any way, it tends to bunch up a bit. There's always a lump or a crease somewhere in the bed. My daughter doesn't have any Princess and the Pea-like tendencies, so it doesn't really bother her. A child with sensory issues, however, like my son - who notices every little rough seam or itchy tag - would never be able to sleep on top of this mattress pad.The other major problem with this pad is that it hasn't proven to be really, truly waterproof. The moisture barrier itself doesn't leak, but because the pad is two-sided, any wetness near the edge of the pad wicks right around to the bottom. It might be fine in cases where it's going to be changed just as soon as it gets wet, but for us, overall, this product just really didn't do the job.

I have a Hoover SteamVac carpet cleaner, which I love, but I never use Hoover's own cleaning solution in it because I absolutely detest its scent. This Oxy Pro cleaning solution from Rug Doctor worked great in my SteamVac. The bottle recommended using 1.5 to 3 ounces of solution per gallon of water. I went with the lower amount - at which rate this bottle can make more than 40 gallons of finished cleaner - and my carpets came out nice and clean. For the price, this is definitely a very effective cleaning solution.As far as the scent goes, this solution doesn't actually have much of one. The concentrated form is noticeably scented, but when I was actually using it in the cleaner, I could just barely smell it, and by the time the floors were dry, I couldn't smell it at all. So, while I would definitely recommend this for anyone who hates heavy perfume, I'd guess it's probably less than ideal for those trying to cover up noticeable pet odors.

This performance polo from Wrangler is made of a 100% polyester that reminds me of DriFit. It's breathable, soft, and hangs beautifully. It looks great right out of the dryer, effortlessly wrinkle-free. My husband loves it on those days when his office gets a little warm because the fabric seems to help wick away the sweat... no wet rings under the armpits with this shirt!The color we chose, caviar, is a nice, luminous black that hasn't faded a bit with numerous washings. The size XL we ordered fits as expected. Overall, a very nice, quality polo shirt.

This pack of 1,000 heavy-duty, reinforced shipping tags from Avery is perfect for any large-scale shipping, tagging or labeling project. The thick manilla tags are large and easy to write on, and the long, double-stranded wire - flexible, no-rust aluminum - is simple to wrap around almost anything. I have used these to price larger items at a garage sale, label glass food jars in my pantry, and attach names to kids' craft projects at church. Very well designed and recommended to anyone with lots of tagging to do!

I got this cable to use with my daughter's iPad mini and it works perfectly! We got a 6-foot cable, which is really nice for those all-too-frequent times when my daughter is trying to charge and play at the same time, since she doesn't have to make an effort to sit too close to an outlet. My favorite thing about this cable is that it is significantly thicker than the official Apple one that came with the iPad. Kids aren't always gentle with cords and chargers, so I really appreciate the extra sturdy design. This is clearly built to last! Very nice overall and definitely recommended.

I'm old enough to remember many, many years ago when Charmin first replaced their regular 2-ply Charmin toilet paper with Charmin Basic. I hated it! That was a long time ago, however, and these days Charmin Basic is much better than it used to be. It's fluffy, not at all scratchy, and absorbent enough to get the job done. Personally, I still prefer 2-ply toilet paper, but now that I have a houseful of kids I find that 1-ply does have its value... we have a lot fewer clogged toilets and I don't hear calls of "Mom, I'm out of toilet paper" nearly as often.In the past, I've found prices for Amazon Grocery items to vary quite a bit... sometimes they're a bargain, while at other times they are way over-priced. Right now this toilet paper is a pretty good price, less than the regular price at my local grocery, but as a cost-conscious shopper I do always recommend double-checking the current price before ordering.

I have been using Avery labels for many years. They aren't inexpensive, but I'd rather pay more for a quality product than waste my time dealing with the printer jams, smeared ink, wrinkles, and peeling edges that come with using cheap generic labels. These full-sheet labels are thick enough that they don't wrinkle and work great in my laser printer. They have an indented edge all the way around so that they're easy to peel, even if you cut them in half or quarters, and they go on with no wrinkles.If you use new shipping boxes or envelopes, these labels are perfect and I highly recommend them. If you reuse old shipping boxes, however, these particular labels aren't quite thick enough to fully cover up old labels, logos, or black markers. In that case, I'd suggest looking for Avery's "True Block" labels, which cover up anything and everything, instead.

I cut a lot of packing tape, and with most scissors the adhesive tends to make a sticky mess of the blades pretty quickly. These non-stick scissors cut through tape easily and cleanly, and actually do a very good job of resisting the sticky stuff... yes, it does eventually build up, but not nearly as fast, and it's much easier to clean off than with other pairs of scissors I've had. A great pair of scissors!

I only drink a cup or two of coffee per day, so I have a 4-cup coffeemaker for the days when it's just me, and a 10-cup for when company comes. It's a pain switching between the two, so I was excited to try this thermal pot, which can hold up to 12 cups but also has a 2-4 cup brewing strength setting designed to make the perfect small pot of coffee.Anyway, I've had this coffeemaker for more than a month, and l'd definitely recommend it if you need the 12-cup capacity. It's got a nice, large reservoir that's easy to fill, and the removable filter basket makes it easy to load and easy to clean. The set-ahead timer feature is simple to set, and the adjustable strength settings do a fair job of helping you make the coffee as strong or as weak as you want it. And, as long as you're making a full pot, the thermal pot works great... the coffee comes out piping hot and stays hot for a good couple of hours.Though this pot does a good job for large pots of coffee, it doesn't do nearly as well for tiny ones. Compared to my old 4-cup Mr. Coffee pot, the 2-4 cup setting on this pot simply makes a much weaker brew. I have to use an extra tablespoon or two of grounds with this pot to get the coffee to the right strength. Worse yet,  the thermal pot just can't keep a little pot of coffee hot at all... just five minutes after it's made, it's already reached the point where it comes out cold enough that I end up wanting to stick it in the microwave. Overall, I love this pot for large batches, but I wouldn't recommend it if you expect to need the 2-4 cup function often.

These pads are soft, absorbent, and very, very thick... not the kind of pad I prefer during the day, but fantastic for overnight! I move around a lot while I sleep, and even though these pads don't have wings, I've had absolutely no problems with them leaking. They work great!Amazon's grocery prices vary greatly... sometimes I find awesome deals and other times I don't. I checked the price of these pads at a couple of local stores, and found them at a little over 10 cents a pad, significantly cheaper than what Amazon is currently charging. I definitely recommend these pads but I also suggest shopping around for the best price.

My 8 year-old daughter is a huge Lego Friends fan and got this as a late Christmas present. It's fantastic! I was extremely nervous that the hot-air balloon was going to be one of those delicate, "for display only" kind of Lego creations,  but it's not at all. It's very sturdy, with everything clipping on in multiple places and reinforced with hidden Technic pieces inside. Nothing falls off! I'm very impressed.In addition to the balloon, this set also includes two figures, Andrea and Noah, and pieces to build a little nature area with a waterfall, a red and white-checked picnic blanket with food, and a cute little campfire complete with toasted marshmallows. My daughter loves having her Friends figures fly in the balloon from her little Lego city to the jungle and back! Definitely one of the best Friends sets we own.

I have bushes and trees right outside my kitchen window, so it's hard to put a bird feeder in a critter-safe spot. Raccoons are my main problem... they love to shake, knock over, and dump anything they find. This feeder seems to have stumped them! I have it hanging from a 6-foot shepherd's hook, and though I'm sure they can reach and shake it from the bushes, they can't seem to get enough out of it to make it worth their while.The holes at the bottom of the feeder are designed very well... easy enough for the birds to reach in and pick out, but not at all open to the elements or prone to spill out. And the feeder as a whole is sturdy, well-made, and very easy to fill. A very nice, shakeproof bird feeder!

I have extra fat on my tummy and sometimes need a little help hiding it. I've tried Spanx, and though they are definitely slimming, I simply find them too unpleasant to tolerate on a regular, everyday basis. These shapers are much more practical, and offer a good compromise between comfort and style... they take about an inch and a half off my waist, and they don't feel awful. My waist is about 31 inches and I ordered a medium, and though it fits okay, I will probably try a small next time. Overall, a good, comfortable, everyday shaping option.

My kids prefer gummy vitamins to chewables, and with two of them each taking two a day, we go through the little 60-count bottles from the grocery store pretty fast. This 120-count bottle lasts twice as long. The flavor choices of mixed berry, raspberry, and pineapple sound a little odd to me, but the kids seem to like them just fine, and the bonus, from my perspective, is that these are colored with vegetable juices rather than unnecessary food dyes.Prices for Amazon grocery items vary greatly... sometimes they are a wonderful deal and other times they are way overpriced. Currently, the price for this bottle is about the same as the regular price at the grocery, but definitely not as good as when they go on sale buy one, get one free. Good vitamins but I recommend comparing prices before you buy here.

I have a 19 year-old Kenmore vacuum that's still going strong as ever, and though I love it to death, there's no way I'm driving all the way to Sears to buy replacement bags. I've ordered several different kinds of generic bags online over the years, and though they've all worked, none have worked quite as well as the original Kenmore bags. I was hopeful that these would be better, but so far my feelings about them are a bit mixed. On the plus side, they fit my vacuum well and do a fantastic job of trapping dirt and odors inside... absolutely no smell or escaped bits of dust flying through the air. On the minus side, my vacuum makes a very loud, strange, hissing sound with these bags, one that I've never heard before, and that makes me paranoid that they might be restricting air flow to the point of putting extra strain on the motor. I really want to like these bags, since they work well and are reasonably priced. But that hissing sound? The jury is still out...

I have a tummy that's bigger than I like, and regularly wear a cami under my shirt to help cover it up. I almost always wear an XS, but I decided to order up to a medium in this cami based on all the other reviews... and it's still too small! Though I'm actually pleased with the way this cami fits around my waist - it's tight enough to be slimming but not unbearable - it is just way, way too tight around the chest, even though I'm only a 32B. Looking an inch thinner around my waist isn't really worth it when it means losing a cup size too! If you want to minimize your chest, this might be okay, but if you don't, I'd suggest looking for something else.

This is a very nice cookbook with all the recipes you'd expect to find in an Italian cookbook, including appetizers, salad, meat and seafood, side dishes and desserts, and of course, lots and lots of pasta. Recipes are sized big - 6 to 8 restaurant portions, which at my table easily feeds 10 to 12 - and generally simple to make but expectedly time-consuming. Though I got this cookbook primarily for the pasta recipes, I actually ended up liking the salad portion of the cookbook best... it has many wonderful green salads and dressings, as well as an amazing bean salad and an olive salad that I'm dying to make as soon as I can find all the ingredients.Overall, this is a very well-done, comprehensive Italian cookbook. It may be a bit too basic for the seasoned Italian chef, but I'd definitely recommend it to those without another Italian cookbook in the cupboard.

I have four cats, all 10+ years old, so we've tried lots of different cat foods over the years. Three of our four cats will eat just about anything, but the fourth is pretty picky... enough so that we end up feeding him canned food more often than not. It's not that easy to feed canned food to just one out of four cats, so I was really hoping that a high-quality food like Nutrience Original might be good enough to tempt Mr. Picky's taste buds and become the perfect feeding solution for the whole cat family. Unfortunately, not only would he not eat it, but one of the cats who usually eats almost anything wouldn't eat it either. So, though I'm really impressed with the Nutrience concept and I'm sure this is a great pet food in general, this particular formula just isn't for us.

I have four cats, and one of the four has problems with throwing up almost every kind of cat food we've tried. For the past year or so, we've been feeding her Purina One Sensitive Systems, which she tolerates better than other foods but still throws up once every 2nd or 3rd day. Needless to say, we were willing to try something new.Overall, I was really impressed with the quality of Nutrience's Grain Free cat food, and the fact that the ingredients are US-sourced is definitely a plus, too. As for the cats, all four absolutely love it - even the pickiest one, who often gets canned food instead - and the one with a touchy stomach seems to be tolerating it at least as well as the Sensitive Systems. Definitely recommended for picky eaters as well as cats with other dietary concerns!

I got this expanding file to sort my old Lego catalogs in, and overall am very pleased with the quality and construction. It's very sturdy and really opens up nicely so that it's easy to skim through and pull out what I'm looking for. The lid is a bit problematic... though it latches shut very nicely, there's no good way to hold it open, so it tends to get in the way when I want to access the files inside. That's not a huge flaw, but would definitely be an irritation if I were using this on a daily basis.The capacity of this file is not tremendous - the bottom expands to just over an inch - so it's great for holding a couple hundred pieces of loose paper, but nothing more than that. Overall, a good sturdy, inexpensive expanding file for small sized filing jobs.

I have two children and a houseful of Lego bricks. Years ago, after a miserable experience with a Mega Bloks building set, I swore I would never buy anything but Lego again. The great reviews from others about KRE-O, however, gave me hope, and I decided to give this set a try. I'm so glad I did... it's wonderful!This set builds a little vampire castle, and includes vampire and human minifigures. The design is very cute, the instructions are detailed and clear, and the bricks themselves are made of a high-quality plastic - reasonably comparable to modern Lego. Even better, the set includes sound effects, and a cool vibration-based motion technology that makes it extra fun to play with once it's built.  All this for way less than a similarly-sized Lego set would cost... overall, a very nice, frustration-free building set recommended for any little ones who like to build and play!

I love Post-it Notes and use them all the time to take messages, give notes to others, or leave reminders for myself. This particular package of Post-it Notes is designed for use with Evernote, an electronic organizational system that lets you merge and manage documents from all of your electronic devices, and a coupon code for a 1-month subscription to Evernote is included inside, along with four differently colored Post-it pads designed to work with the Evernote system. Write a note on one of the Post-it Notes, take a picture with your camera, and turn it into a digital note in your Evernote account, where it becomes searchable, sortable, and more.If you've never tried Evernote before, this is a great way to test it out. If you already use it and love it, it's not a bad deal either, because for existing users, the coupon code adds enough points to your account to pay for one month of Evernote Premium. A great item for the devoted Evernote user.

I have three cats and three litterboxes, so I go through a lot of cat litter. I usually buy Tidy Cat, but decided to give Arm & Hammer a try since I really liked the idea of a "low-track" litter. It works great. The litter is very finely grained and clumps extremely well, so it's easy to scoop and, just as advertised, doesn't get all over the floor nearly as much as the Tidy Cat. 14 lb of litter filled my box to a great level, and at three weeks, it's still going strong.I tried two different varieties of Arm & Hammer Clump & Seal... this "Fresh Home" scent, as well as the "Multi-Cat" formula. "Fresh Home" has almost no scent, whereas the other is super heavily perfumed. I definitely recommend this over the "Multi-Cat". A great litter that I'll be buying again!

I have three cats and three litterboxes, so I go through a lot of cat litter. I usually buy Tidy Cat, but decided to give this a try since I really liked the idea of a "low-track" litter. I put this in one of my litter boxes, and left the other two filled with the usual Tidy Cat in case the cats didn't feel like changing brands of litter. The good news? One of my cats - the one who is normally the least likely to use the litter box - absolutely loves this cat litter, and it works great. The litter is very finely grained and clumps extremely well, so it's easy to scoop and, just as advertised, doesn't get all over the floor nearly as much as the Tidy Cat. It's been three weeks since I filled the box, and this litter is still going strong. I love it.Unfortunately, though one of my cats loves this litter, two don't. Two weeks have gone by, and they are stubbornly sticking to their Tidy Cat litter box. If I had to guess why, I'd suspect that it's because this litter is so very heavily perfumed. It's a pleasant scent, but it's really much too strong. I like everything else about this litter so well, but I'll be looking for an unscented or less scented variety before purchasing it again.

I have a lot of Bankers Boxes, and love them because they're always good quality, easy to assemble, and affordable. When I saw these boxes, marketed as legal sized, I assumed they'd be just enough wider than the regular letter sized boxes to accommodate 14-inch long files instead of 11-inch long ones. Instead, they're fully twice as large as the regular sized boxes, simply too large to be filled solid with paper and still be portable.I'm not able to use these boxes as I'd originally intended, but they're still fantastic, so I've got them storing clothes instead of files. While I suggest sticking with the standard sized Bankers Boxes for legal files, I wholeheartedly recommend these for lighter-weight storage needs.

I needed a pencil sharpener for work, and I loved the idea of the USB plug on this one since my cubicle has a computer but no open electrical outlets. Overall, I'm pretty pleased. This sharpener has a good, steady motor, and sharpens pencils pretty well under USB power. The shaving receptacle is generously sized, and is easy and mess-free to empty, and the retractable cord makes it simple and tidy to stow away in my desk when not in use.Though I use this sharpener mostly under USB power, I've also tried it under battery power and plugged in to a wall outlet using a USB wall charger, and in comparison, the motor is definitely stronger when plugged into the wall than when plugged into a computer. Bottom line? If you have continuous access to a wall outlet, a standard wall powered sharpener is probably still your best bet, but if you're looking for an alternatively powered sharpener, this is a good one that gets the job done under any kind of power.
I still like because  you can change your location.But here is one thing when I go to a another location the game just goes back to my kindles main screen.

I bought the cassis color, which is a beautiful, rich red. It is spacious inside yet only a medium sized purse. It has both handles and a removable strap, as well as an outside zippered compartment that fits my iPhone 6 Plus. I love everything about it and would buy it again in a heartbeat.

I bought the Aegean blue fleece outfit with this cape...the only name I can think of that's appropriate. It's huge, even in a small/medium. But it is so soft and washes and dries so beautifully that I will wrap myself up in it on cold nights all winter.

Ms. Kondo has written a charming autobiography of her own obsession with tidying up, and then put what she has learned into a useful guide. I finished reading it last night and plan to follow her instructions as best I can.  I gave the book four stars because 1) I have not yet put it into practice; 2) she repeats herself over and over as though she believes what she says will not sink in unless read 100 times in the same words; 3) she never once suggests that people try on the clothes they have decided to keep or discard. It makes me wonder if the Japanese are so slim and petite throughout their adult lives that their clothing sizes never change. I wish that were true for me, but I think tidying up is going to take me a little longer since I will have to try on my clothes; and, 4) only twice in the book does she mention the word "donate".  She talks about the mistake of trying to hand off clothes to family members, unless they really want them, but she never encourages donating clothes to organizations that help people through disasters.  It makes me wonder if this is not part of the Japanese culture.  All those hundreds of "garbage bags" of clothes that she helps people "discard" could help people that really need them.  If anyone has any insight into this issue, I would appreciate learning about whether this is a cultural issue or not.

This dark chocolate version is as good as coffee/chocolate ice cream!  No kidding.  I bought just one can at my local grocery, drank it today, and was blown away by how delicious it is.  I chilled it first, and it's so creamy that I would be happy with just this for dessert after dinner.  However, I don't see that they make this in decaf, so I guess I will be drinking it as an afternoon pick-me-up.  I'm here at Amazon to buy a case!

Ok, the sprouts did grow as predicted in three days, then took three more days in the sun to turn into four inch grass. I put this bowl on the he floor and they looked at me like I was crazy. But they gave it a try. Neither one of them could chew the grass without pulling out the roots and sprouts and in the end half the bowls contents wind up on the floor, which I had to clean up after they walked away in confusion and disgust. That is the end of that experiment.

The best fitting shoe I've ever tried on. My foot slipped into the interior leather like butter. It fits as though it were custom made just for me. I bought it to wear without socks, but now it think I'll have to go up a half size so I have a pair for the winter with socks.

I like this short sleeved version as well as the long sleeved, and it went with everything from jeans to skirts.  When it was warm outside I wore this one, when cooler I wore the long sleeved version.  I'm glad I bought both.

This top is so comfortable and fits so perfectly, it's almost like having nothing on.  I bought it for a trip, wore it, threw it in my suitcase, and it came home with hardly a wrinkle in it.  I would definitely buy again.

I am so impressed with this Byer EasyCot.  I've searched and searched through everything from air mattresses to futons to cots, and I've finally found what I was looking for!  This cot is amazing.  You take it out of the sleeve, open up the legs, turn it upright and that's it! It is so comfortable, so long and wide, that I even found I could turn on my stomach and sleep with my arms spread out.  All this without any additional foam. I like the feel of the fabric and the tension is perfect for my back.  One note for the first time you open it: I kept waiting for the legs to "click" into place so I could be sure they were in the proper position.  They don't do that.  You have to make sure the hinges are positioned properly since they don't really lock together.  I realized that after a couple minutes and finally got both ends secure at the same time.  It would be easier to do with two people, but you don't need two.  I'm only 5' 4 1/2" and not particularly strong, and I did it myself.  I can also carry it alone.  The sleeve it comes with has a large strap on it.

This mat is terrific.  It does exactly what it says: it traps litter through the holes, and then it can be shaken into the trash or vacuumed up.  This mat has completely changed how my laundry room looks!  And my cats took to it immediately.

If you ask my two cats, they would give it a 10 rating.  They loved it so much that the first night they climbed into the kitchen cabinet, knocked the box on the floor and ate the contents of all 19 packets in the box...aluminum lined packets mind you.  I had sprinkled one packet on their evening food to help one of the cats who had digestive problems.  No more digestive problems now.

This is a beautiful white/off white tai chi outfit that fits perfectly.  But it is not real silk.  It is a shiny soft polyester.  That said, the outfit is well made. I ordered a Medium, my normal size (8-10), and it fits beautifully.  The elastic in the waist and ankles is not tight. There is a small change/key pocket inside the pants.  The top is loose and drapes beautifully.  The arms are a bit long, but that is always true for me.  So I just fold them up a couple times.  I washed it on "Hand Wash" in lukewarm water in the washing machine, and dried the outfit on low in the dryer for 20 minutes.  It came out like new.

These are ok for bumming around, but they don't feel supportive.  I was hoping to wear them with bare feet, but the material is not soft enough for that.  They also come up too high on my feet, so I will send them back.

These are the most comfortable shoes I have ever put on my feet. I feel as though I am walking on a soft, squishy yoga mat.  They fit almost perfectly.  I wanted to wear them inside the house, as I take off my everyday shoes at the front door.  My chiropractor recommended walking inside the house in something more supportive than bare feet or flat slippers. I don't think they have particularly good arch support, but the rest of the shoe feels very supportive and comfortable.  The back heel area seems a bit loose, but the length of the shoe is perfect, as my front toes are within half an inch of the front.  Anything smaller would be too short.  I tried them on with tennis socks and they fit perfectly as well.  So far so good.  I would buy another pair in a heartbeat, but I think I will wait a month to see how they wear. Update: I just bought two more pairs! They are so comfortable, both inside and outside the house, that I don't want to wear anything else. They even look nice with skirts and dresses. I have a fantasy of throwing out all my heels and just wearing these.

Well, I guess I was hoping for a better fit.  I ordered a larger size than I expected to need, but it still doesn't quite fit the way I wanted.  The bust could be a bit bigger and the straps could be a bit tighter and higher in their adjustments.
Just what I hoped for to scoop out the cat litter from the large 28 lb bags.  It's lightweight, easy to clean and just the right size for me.
I love these OXO POP storage containers.  I store cat crunchies, beans, rice, coffee, etc.  They are expensive, but the work beautifully and wash easily.
I have found so many uses for these brushes that I can't imagine how I did without them.  They clean grout.  The clean the inside and outside edges of the kitchen sink, et. al.  I would buy again!
I bought these to clip my cats' claws. I found that regular clippers would slip in my fingers.  These don't.
I use these to mail back returns of items I have bought, as well as to send out items to others.  They cover the old labels well.

This is a wonderful candle.  It gives off a nice golden glow.  The remote works perfectly.  I turn it on as I'm getting ready for bed and then turn it off with the remote.  I have the candle on the other side of the room, and as long as I point it in the right direction, it goes off or on as I wish.  I'm going to buy another one for my partner's apartment.

It works.  I just bought two more containers.  It removes organic stains.  The only thing I have found not removable with Folex is graphite, which we used to make the back deck door move more smoothly.  The cats decided to play in the track and have now made small black stains in the carpet, which don't come out.  Other than graphite, we have found Folex to be reliable if used properly, which means jiggling your fingertips through the carpet after you have sprayed it on.  Let it sit for 10 - 20 minutes and then blot up the excess liquid. You may need to do this twice on really tough stains, but it's easy. Stains gone!
These pens are not retractable.  You have to take off the cap.  They are also very fine nibs, which I thought I wanted, but they are scratchy.  I would not buy again.

I really like this series and all the characters in it, especially James Norton.  It's a well done English murder mystery with a parson and a police detective as friends who help each other solve crimes.  It's intelligent and interesting.  I hope it continues into a second season.
After our blender top melted in the dishwasher, I'm pleased to find this replacement.  It fits perfectly, and I've saved the other components for the future.  Good price too.
My new favorite tank top.  The fabric is soft. The fit is perfect.  And it's long enough to tuck into jeans or a skirt.  I throw it in the washer and dryer and it comes out good as new. No shrinkage.
I always use Finish Quantum and I like the new bag it comes in.  The packets are loose and don't have to be opened.  Just grab one and throw it in the dishwasher.  Everything comes out spotless.

This arrived in a plastic mailing pouch directly from China.  When I opened it I could smell chemicals.  This is true of every clothing item I've bought that has arrived from China, or is made there.  After deciding that I wanted to keep it, I immediately put it in the washing machine on hand-wash in lukewarm water.  The smell is gone.  I laid it flat to dry, and it came out nicely.Something else I've learned is to buy at least one size larger than I normally wear.  I don't know if Chinese sizes are made for Asian women, or if they are kept small to save money, but every clothing item I have bought is always small or tight.  So I order up.This top is really more of a tunic or even a short dress.  I'm 5' 4 1/2" and this tunic comes down to about four inches above my knees.  It is loose and flowing on the bottom, and I think it will look nice with white or black tights.

This arrived in a plastic mailing pouch directly from China.  When I opened it I could smell chemicals.  This is true of every clothing item I've bought that has arrived from China, or is made there.  After deciding that I wanted to keep it, I immediately put it in the washing machine on hand-wash in lukewarm water.  The smell is gone.  I laid it flat to dry, and it came out nicely.Something else I've learned is to buy at least one size larger than I normally wear.  I don't know if Chinese sizes are made for Asian women, or if they are kept small to save money, but every clothing item I have bought is always small or tight.  So I order up.
I like the shape of this decanter.  It's smaller than many, which I wanted, and elegant to look at.  It can be used for cognac, wine, scotch or whatever suits you.

We like this set.  We can now heat sake in the microwave in the tall bottle, and use the small cups for drinking.  I thought the bottle would be a bit bigger...I don't think it would serve eight without refilling.
The small travel packs of tissues do NOT fit in this holder.  I had to take several tissues out before I could use it, and then it was still a struggle to get them to fit.

I love this tunic so much that I just bought three more in other colors.  The cotton is very fine and lightweight, with lovely embroidery.  The fit is perfect.  I washed it in the machine on "hand wash" and dried it in the dryer on medium.  It was dry in 20 minutes.  It only shrank a tiny bit...maybe half a size, not enough to make a difference, for me anyway.  I did buy one size larger than I would normally buy because I am always wary of all cotton products tendency to shrink.  So that would be my recommendation...one size larger.  It is so comfortable.  It's almost like having nothing on.  It's lovely in warm weather.  It is sheer, so except for the black one, I would recommend wearing tights underneath like the girl in the photo.

Just what I was hoping for...clean white, lightweight bone china coffee cups.  Fit in the hand comfortably, wash easily.  The rims of the saucers are a slight bit rough, but the cup rims are smooth.The labels on both the cups and saucers are very difficult to get off.  I tried to peel them off while dry but they were very resistant.  I assumed if I put the cups and saucers in the dishwasher they would just slide off.  Nope...still there.  But at least they came off a bit easier while they were hot and wet.  Yes, I would buy again, and I may buy four more right now.
Well, this does deter my cats from scratching my couch cover....but...it is hell to peel off the couch cover.

I love all the nuts from the peanut shop of Williamsburg.  My boyfriend said his mother always bought the peanuts from them, and so I decided to try several varieties of nuts.  We love them.  Wish my waistline could afford to buy more.
Everything Fiore produces seems to be high quality.  A friend introduced me to the oils and vinegars, and I have been a fan every since.  They are very flavorful, pure and delicious.
Love these.  Bought several of them and use them every day.  Great flavors, especially the grapefruit white balsamic.
I use these every day in my dishwasher.  All my dishes and glasses come clean, even on a short cycle, so I'm pleased.  I order it every month on subscription.
I use this for eggs, which stick terribly.  I don't like using non-stick pans, so I guess this is it. It is just the right size and quality construction.
down lots several free crossword puzzels every day.  great for if you need to be doing something all the time like I do.

glass crystals that make rainbows.  Got one for myself and my friend's 5-year old...who is totes in love with it too!  Sends a disco ball like array of small rainbows.  Cats seem unimpressed, however.
this looks great in my tank.  itis about the size of a soft ball and my African Clawed Frog like dragging it around the tank and sleeping on it.

I lashed this to my waterfall filter as a prefilter for my 30 gallon.it's a bit bulky but  keeps my sand from messing up my motor.  Not the intended use, but you know, it's a sponge...what can you really say about those?
exactly as described, i don't know what else I can say about balls

the parts snap together so tight my hands had a little trouble with it, but i don't have super strong hands.  The comparments broke down to fit a 5-gallon african dwarf frog aquarium really well and they don't seem to mind the low water flow.  This is a really nice filter, esp for the price, and i'm considering another one for a herp tank.
my african dwarf frogs love playing in this soft little squishy.  Looks good in the tank.  it's about the circumference of a jam jar lid.the smaller lids.

I was hoping this letter would be a productive discussion of what a birth mother hoped for from the adoptive parents of her child.  Instead it's family drama meant to shame someone who abused their adoptive child.  While I understand finding out the child you hoped would have a better life is being abused has to be a nightmare -- this isn't the place for it.  Also something in this person's tagging makes it come up when you're searching for ebooks on adoption.  I'd really like my .99 cents back.

Well...I can read about 5 minutes of this book and then have to put it down because my husband doesn't like being randomly molested in the middle of the night.  It's got a good story, you care about the characters and the smut is hot.  When I read this book I feel like it's a thriller with smoking sex in it.  Like an Alfred Hitchcock movie where you get your hitch but also a whole lot of c*ck.
a fun short by a witty writer.  Cyril is hot hot hot and his interlude with a hot young woman is worth the low price. :D

Pests love my pests.  This kills off the pests I don't want and helps to keep them from coming back.  Hardest part is getting my cats in a leg lock long enough to get it on them, but they aren't very helpful animals in general.

Works super fast and easy.  Had read an online review about this product and bought because of them.  Now I'm stripping down cucumbers with a speed that makes any man in the room nervous.  The shaved off vegetable meats are hard to distinguish from noodles.  Everyone should have one.  I feel dumb to say this, but it is very sharp, be careful.

Very well written.  Thoughtful and considerate.  I'm now reading First They Killed My Father and the differences between the two narratives are interesting.  Him's account is very in the moment and raw.  I have the feeling she left some things out to preserve other people's dignity, which I feel conflicted about.  I would very much like to read a follow up of how her family adjusted to America.

I live in North Texas, and our blistering, ungodly sun makes me a fan of any solar product.  I look upon the yards of little old ladies with green eyed envy-their kitschy garden lights twinkling mere inches from my finger tips.  How can you not love something that runs, for free, off sunshine?--the odd battery swap out aside.  Choosing to feed my unhealthy obsession, I decided to add a fountain feature to help keep mosquito's out of my birdbath-West Nile and all.I looked around at several items in 20ish dollar price point, and decided to give this product a go.  I expected, per the reviews, for it to give me only a few hours of full pumping with several hours of dedicated and insincere spitteling.  Keeping your expectations low, rarely leads to disappointment in life, and proved wise concerning this purchase.I have my pump's solar panel on the outside rail of a 2nd story, west facing apartment.  Around 8am the shadows from the tree and building move aside enough, the water begins to gurgle and sputter about like a pidgin having a heart attack.  By about 10:30 that pidgin has developed epilepsy on top of its cardiovascular condition and around 1pm the water spurts forth like a roman candle with nothing to loose.  It continues to gush with its wet-moistness  until about 5pm, when it sputters around like a tweaker who can't find their shoe and is completely off around 6-6:30 pm.I had to cut a hole in the center of one of the nozzles to keep the stream from flying out of my pot.  With full Texas sun it shoots about 6 inches.  It's like mama said, "Why bother adjusting for 6 when 4 will do."  Good advice when considering second husband and adjusting the nozzles on fountains.If I lived in a cloudier climate, and not three inches from the sunny bunghole of Satan, I would be probably be disappointed with this product.  As is, I live in the sweltering home of the deep fried heatstroke, and find this product serving my purposes well enough.  Some day I want to save up for one of them fancy pumps with the a/c or battery backup but for now I will just appreciate the daytime quirkiness of my buy and pat myself on the back for saving money.Update:I ordered this in summer of 2013, as of Feb 2015 it is still running great!

If you look at my book purchases on Amazon you'll soon realize I don't read much outside of Comics and Hard Sci-fi, but Renea's book was a delightful exception. I wanted something smutty with a bit of a mythology/paranormal bend and was richly rewarded.Now like most Texans I like my salsa to burn coming and going...so when it comes to Paranormal Romance I'm much the same way. I want it to sizzle when I read it and think about it later, and this book delivered. What I didn't expect was to like the main character so much. Linden is sarcastic, funny and likable in a way a lot of romance stories try for and fail. You believe she is capable at her job and relate to what she goes through the same way you relate to the movie Office Space.Her romance with the studly and godly Cyril doesn't feel contrived and while Cyril is metaphysical he isn't annoyingly perfect. In fact, he's quite the A-hole at the start of the book. Epicly hot, lovable, A-hole...who ends up growing on you as you find out who he is and why he is keeping Linden at arms length. So at the end he's not an A-hole, or the baby boy she "changed," he was just protecting himself..make sense? It's Refreshing, like finding a bottle of Smart Water in the middle of the Mojave.Good length too... just right to leave you wanting more more more! 5 stars. :D

I just picked this up from my neighborhood Kroger and I have to say it was a pleasant surprise.  I'm not a big fan of dark chocolate, but have been eating low carb for medical reasons.  I've been doing great on my diet and craved a little chocolate so I looked at the organic isle hoping to get something with less junk in it.1/3 of this bar has 11g carbohydrates and 2g fiber and 8g sugar.  Most dark chocolate candy bar's chime in at least 18-19g carbs for 1/3 a bar and plenty are 21 to 30 (depending on the kind of chocolate.  So for a reasonably proportioned splurge this is a great treat.  Even better for people who have type 2 diabetes, or a thyroid problem, who need to really watch out for how much sugar they are having.The flavor is a mellow dark chocolate.  It has a bit of that bitter kick which most dark chocolate has (and why I don't normally have it) but with this bar it's pretty rich, and the coconut gives the illusion of sweetness I want from milk chocolate.  I also really like coconut, so bonus.  If you don't like coconut, you probably won't enjoy this bar, but if you do, give it a try.
I used it for plants.  Don't eat it.  Don't inhale.  You'll be fine.  No seriously, it's not candy, it's just for plant drainage.

A good story.  Sometimes it was a little hard to follow, because it is in Indian English and not American English.  Some of the phrasing and descriptions might seem odd to someone not used to how a different culture speaks.

The humming birds eat out of it.  it's cheap plastic, but it didn't fade badly and stood up to the heat of summer okay.  Worth the price.  Not the most brilliant and stunning hummingbird feeder ever, but if you want some hummers, this baby will give them to you for less than a two person fast food meal.

This guy's secret is basically Fiverr.  Need a cover?  Hire someone from Fiverr. Need editing?  Try Fiverr.  Want your book formatted correctly?  Try Fiverr.  It was fair for a free preview, but I'd never pay for this book.  It's written with kindergarten simplicity and doesn't really tell you anything new.
These are great jumper cables. Big enough to start a mini-van or pickup, small enough not to take up too much space in your trunk, and contained in a convenient storage pouch / case.

Of the 4 units, one makes an audible sound, even to my old lady hearing. However, these have made a huge difference in repelling flies and mosquitos. You can tell when the red light comes on, because any flies or spiders in the area start trying to get out. I literally open the door and the flies leave!I trapped the mouse that was here, so it's hard to say how well it repels rodents, but no others have arrived. If your mouse has babies, they won't leave until the pups are weaned, so keep that in mind as well.

You know, I didn't like these for making green coffee, but rather than waste them, I tried roasting some at home. And oh my goodness, I've never had such delicious coffee before in my life. This got changed from 2/5 to 5/5 after trying it roasted light. Those little coatings on the outside that were so gross for green coffee became absolutely divine when roasted. The the small sample of a pre-roasted variety that was included was very tasty as well, but still not nearly as good as this one.Try this roasted yourself. It's really freaking good.

This is a very petite water pipe / hookah that doesn't require anything more special than a lighter to use. Buyers should note: this did NOT come with any screens, so you may want to order some little brass pipe screens if you don't have one already. Otherwise, I love this for its size and economy, and I'm looking forward to adding some diffuser beads to the water inside, as this removes soot and mellows the smoke. Add ice cubes to the water before each use for even more comfort.Good for non-smokers who can't afford a vaporizer.

I wanted to try these to see if they help me sleep, since CLA is listed as an additional ingredient in another product I use, so I wanted to see if CLA alone would help. There have been too many other confounding factors so far to be able to tell, but I'll update later.I think this comes from safflower seeds or maybe canola. Humans can't make DHA effectively, though we hypothetically can from CLA, just at abysmally slow rates. I'm unsure the other reasons people take this supplement, but for sleep, it's too early to say.The biggest reason I chose THIS brand was the packaging. I love that it's environmentally conscious, and the simple flat package takes up less space in my home.

I would give this 5 stars for the ingredients and nutrition, 3 stars for the texture. It's very good for you, but comes out somewhat dry and grainy.For reference, these are BETTER than typical whole wheat pasta. It's just that people who eat conventional (bad) pasta will notice that this does have a different texture, though still a better mouthfeel than typical whole grain. I may try cooking longer than recommended to see if that helps.A good choice for vegetarians, as this does contain complete protein.

I purchased this to replace my starter that went off after storing for 6 months without feedings and needed to be replaced. This version has a much sweeter taste than the dried version by Breadtopia. Also, it was ready to bake with after only 48 hours of feeding. If you want to start sourdough right away, this is an excellent choice. I am very, very happy with my first bakes with this.My only concern is that it seems susceptible to that orange bacterial infection, do definitely keep a backup of some fed discards in the freezer. (Instead of throwing out your discard, separate it and feed it as if making another culture. Then, straight to the freezer as a backup. I like to keep several backups.)Lastly, if you want a very sour flavor, keep your starter wetter / more hydrated (like thin pancake batter), or replace 10-20% of the flour in your recipe with whole rye flour, as this will give it a very sour SF-style flavor.Recommended!

The flavor was truly terrible, and it caused a great deal of nausea from drinking this cup. I wanted to try white-roast coffee because it doesn't need sugar, but it did not agree with me at all. Now I can't even give this stuff away to friend, they are put off by the smell and won't even try it. The aroma is really difficult to describe, but the flavor is like a weak tea made from ground cashews, and the color is like that of white tea. However, there is one flavor note I can't identify that seems to be nausea-inducing for me. I would definitely try this someplace local before deciding to commit to a whole bag of it. It did seem and smell fresh, had high caffeine, and it was indeed completely free of bitterness or coffee flavor. It's not not very good at all.

This book would be ok if it was free maybe, but it's really not good. 90% of the book is general information, and the TINY section about a small handful of medical conditions just gives a few lines about why mmj might be helpful. There is NO useful information about matching strains or cannabinoids to specific conditions, nor is there any real data on efficacy.I bought this only because it was a required course book at Oakesterdam University, but I feel it was a complete waste of money, especially if you have the other required books.

I had ordered another product, and received this one as well. I like to use this for baking homemade sourdough bread, and also to add to tea as an immune supplement, and this is just perfect for both. Also, not having to purchase a resealable container is important to me, and this provides it while still being Eco-friendly.Also, did you know that it super charges your vitamin C if you consume it with green or black tea? Tea alone helps immunity a little bit. Vitamin C alone helps immunity a little as well. Vitamin C + Tea together creates something greater than the sum of its parts.That's why a spoonful of this in freshly steeped tea will knock a cold out, or protect you from even catching it.

I tried these when they were on sale at my local grocery store, in this flavor and in the vanilla latte flavor. They were both SO good, and while they are still out of the range I'm willing to pay for a K-cup, if you love Gevalia, you will love these for the amazing flavor and smoothness that all the Gevalia coffees have. (I used to subscribe to Gevalia.)If you want a K-cup coffee that is very smooth with zero bitterness, Gevalia is truly just the thing.

This helps so much with fighting viruses. I can't tell if it helps with colds or not, but anything in the herpes family, it helps a lot. I can't have nuts or the CMV (cytomegalovirus, similar to mono) comes back, but if I counter-balance with this lysine, I'm fine.It also has helped in treating shingles, which is unbelievably painful, and in preventing outbreaks. Someone gave me biscotti with only a few walnuts in it, and boom, shingles starting. Since using these with ANY arginine-rich foods, I've been able to avoid getting any more.If anyone else is looking for shingles help, or anything in the herpes family, here is what has helped me the very most:1. Lysine to compensate for arginine in foods. I use this brand and it's perfect.2. Durham's bee propolis supplement 3 times a day during an outbreak (but only if you're not allergic to bee stings). Or the queens delight, which contains propolis.3. Vitamin C (I use this same brand in 1,000mg time release tablets) combined with green or black tea. Vitamin C on its own does not help. Tea on its own may or may not help. But when you combine the two, they help a LOT. If you feel the tingling of an outbreak looming, if you do enough tea & C quickly enough, the lesion will never even form!4. Durham's "wonder salve" stops lesions from spreading and reduces pain and itching on existing lesions.5. Vitamin C serum - yes the same kind people use for wrinkles and anti aging - apply this directly to the lesion. I may stop using the wonder salve, as the vitamin C serum seems to work faster. I had an especially stubborn lesion on my ankle that was not responding to the propolis salve ("wonder salve"), so on a whim, I tried the vitamin C serum I normally use on my face to prevent wrinkles. That stubborn lesion/scar had been itching and burning for weeks after the lesion appeared healed. The C serum cleared it the rest of the way in a few days.I hope this information helps someone else. This particular product (Now Foods Lysine) and their time-released vitamin C are invaluable tools in my Arsenal to fight any viruses in the herpes family, all of which stay with you for life.

I've done soy lecithin as a powder before, and it does great things for my bread. Taller, fluffier loaves that keep longer before molding. But when I tried this sunflower lecithin, it didn't help the bread at all. In fact, all it did as impart a rancid taste on my finished loaf.I love that it's organic and sunflower (I have family allergic to soy), but it doesn't help the bread at ALL that I can tell, and it smells and tastes quite rancid.I'm going to try liquid sunflower lecithin next and see if that works. I don't know if sunflower always tastes so rancid or not, but if it does, I'm going to have to either go back to soy or just leave it out of my recipes.

I really hate this cover. It came with three in the box, and 3/3 have been less than satisfactory. The first one, I couldn't get it to install correctly. There was no solution for a wet install, and I couldn't find the bottle from before. The second one, when I pulled off tab 2, it took the shield off with it instead of removing the mask layer. The third one got the tiniest specks of dust, and since it was a dry instal, those specks are now big ugly bubbles that won't come out.This shield also gets that greasy rainbow look so easily. Even with freshly washed hands, the surface becomes messed up enough that in only 5 minutes of use, it becomes difficult to read the text because of smudges. I'm wiping the thing down literally every 5 minutes.I used ArmorSuit for my last device. It wasn't perfect, but it was 1,000x better than this. I'm going back to that brand, because these are just awful.UPDATE: After 2 months of use, tolerating the bubbles, this shield caused my iPod to stop responding when I try to type the letters i, u, o, and p. There was no bubble in this area. It just couldn't detect my finger touch. I got so mad I finally took the screen cover off and threw it in the trash, and now the entire screen works. It's just ridiculous, and I wouldn't recommend this truly awful product to anyone.I've just ordered the IQ-Shield brand, hoping for better results there.

These would be great...if they worked. They seem sturdy and well made, but straight out of the box, they don't work. They cause the "this accessory is not supported" message when I plug them into my iPhone 6. I thought I had bought cords that were certified compatible, but I see now that is not the case. They look like lightning cables, but my nearly brand new device won't charge with these cables.What good are charging cables if they won't charge your device?I do not recommend this product or its manufacturer. Maybe they worked for others, but they did not work for me.

I ordered this camera maybe 6 months ago, which was the previous version R1, and then switched to the current version, which is the R1-Pro that's replaced the old model in the same listing. I liked the older version because it took extremely good video for my purposes. Even going 75mph down the interstate, when I reviewed the footage, I was able to clearly read mile marker signs and license plates. Much like our own vision, the edges of the far peripheral vision were not as clear, but they were still far better than I expected at high speeds. Driving around town it sees pretty well across the entire 170.My biggest problem with the old version was that the buttons and interface were somewhat hard to operate. I had to take it down and fiddle with it to do anything at all. The buttons just weren't user friendly. Thankfully, this has been fixed in the new model.The R1-Pro model that's listed now, I like much better. It has a number of improvements, three of which are really important to me.1) The video resolution is higher in the new model. I haven't tested it at high speeds yet, but around town so far it's great. This lens sees better than I do.2) The user interface is less clunky, and a bit more intuitive.3) They added a panic button. If something happens, you activate the panic state and it will lock the current file as protected, so it doesn't get recorded over when it loops around, just the same as if you've had it detect an accident.I need to fiddle with the parking and motion detection features. I turned motion detection OFF in the old one, because there was a delay, for example, when starting to move again after waiting at a stoplight. Motion detection I don't recommend. Parking protection I do recommend.Last thought - if it doesn't like your SD card at first, try using the device to format the card. It wouldn't accept one of my memory cards until it was formatted. Now I also like to carry a spare SD card in my purse. That way if there's a longer stretch I want to preserve (like on a two hour trip), I can swap the card out and deal with it later.Overall, I do recommend this if you've never had a dash camera before. It's a really good value for the price, it's easy to use and pretty much fool-proof, and the company's customer service people (at Vantrue) have been extremely patient with me bugging them with questions every two days. They really are very responsive.

I'm disgusted that I spent $30 on this thing, yet am unable to form a single cookie. I have made zillions of spritz cookies in my lifetime, but all with an old 70's plug-in electric press and my grandmother's recipe. I can't find the recipe. My sister can't find the recipe. My mom can't find the recipe. My grandma passed away 5 years ago. I tried the recipe that came with the press (the basic butter cookie version), and it just didn't work at all. I tried the plain ungreased pan, parchment paper, silpat, and foil. NONE of them worked. All you can do is peel the cookies off the press with your fingers, which distorts the shape and defeats the purpose of using the press at all. I am thoroughly disgusted.The product is sturdy and well-made.The barrel is easy to load and clean.The mechanism puts out an even amount of dough each time.BUT THE COOKIES WON'T STICK TO THE PAN FOR ANYTHING.If anyone has had any success with this press using a different recipe, please please please comment and let me know. I need my Gramma's recipe, and it's just gone. I've looked at dozens of recipes online and tried different variations, but nothing works.The press puts out the correct amount as what I was used to using the old electric trigger style. That was the amount we were always going for, so I am not sure how the press could be the problem, but the manufacturer claims that the recipes included are tried and true. Online forum users say to use the recipe that comes with your press. This isn't working. Very, very sad.

These are ok, and they will last a long time. They are like the professional lids used in laboratories. However, they are NOT the ones pictured. These are the black ones with the poly seal liner that can pop out for cleaning, and they are 100% plastic, no metal. My problem with them is that they seem to be "self-burping," which is maybe the idea, but I can't get any carbonation with this.If your brews (beer, kombucha, kefir) are prone to exploding the bottles, these would be a perfect solution for you. I just with the photo and description were more clear - these are NOT for getting carbonation, and they are NOT the white ones in the style in the first photo. Quality is good, these will last you a long time.
