What I really love, is on the 2 page format for each day, which includes the menu, he also tells you what  you need to prepare for the next day ahead of time, so you can really judge your whole day, without having an ugly surprise later, knowing you should have made something a day or two in advance and you didn't.I was familiar with a lot of the information in this book.  There were several things in here that are included with Macrobiotics (such as chewing the food many times, and not drinking with meals).  He explained the reasoning behind this which is so helpful, which I noted above.  There also are not snacks included on this, which helps your leptin get regulated.  Also info on not eating at night which is important, and he explains.  Acid/alkaline is also an important aspect of Macrobiotics.  Herman Aihara did a GREAT little book on acid and alkaline, but it was MUCH harder to understand than this book.  (Herman got much more technical, to say the least!)I found this book to be very inspiring!  And the inclusion of the pH litmus to test yourself is totally cool!  I VERY highly recommend this book!

I've had this shade about 6 weeks now, and so far it's perfect!  It was super easy to put on, it has stayed on, and shades the horrid glare of the bare light bulb.  I will be purchasing more of these and recommend it if you need a light shade!

Great folder to have to file everything away in to take with you, and keep your paperwork together and safe.  It's very pretty (never a bad thing, though it's not mandatory).  Totally recommend this.(And as a pleasant aside--this file is corded, and if you scrape your nail over it, it makes cool noises of different pitch.  Is GREAT for playing with the cats!)

I bought the new Roku 2 and the new Roku 3.  (Yes - I love this stuff.)  I think I'll return the Roku 3.  The new Roku 2 includes a lightning fast processor (which is actually the same processor as the new Roku 3, but with a lower price tag).  The best feature of Roku 2 is that it shows you the cheapest source for each movie, which can save a lot of money in the long run.  (The new Roku 3 also has this feature, but Apple TV and Fire TV do not.)MAIN NEW FEATURESFaster processor  The main reason to buy a Roku 2 is that it has a really fast processor at a cheap price.  The fast processor makes moving through menu options to find shows very fast.  It also has shorter loading times (if your internet connection is quick enough).  After using this processor, going back to a slower processor would drive me crazy.Other new features  The new Roku 2 does not have many other substantial new features, but still includes the many great features that Roku has developed over the years.  The new Roku 2 can be boiled down to a really fast processor at a good price and the ability to instantly see which source is renting each movie for the cheapest price.WHATS NOT INCLUDEDHere are a few other things youll need:- Internet- Credit card (to pay for movies and shows ... most require a subscription or rental fee)- HDMI cable- Mount (If you have a WALL-MOUNTED TV, youll need a mount to attach Roku to your TV.)UNLOCKED ECOSYSTEMThe main reason to buy a Roku is that Roku is not trying to push you towards certain content providers.  Apple TV, for example, does not allow you to access shows and movies from many sources.  Fire TV tries to encourage you to buy content from Amazon (although a few other content providers are available if you look for them).  Unlike Apple TV and Fire TV, Roku makes it easy to search for shows and movies from many sources AND lets you see how much different providers charge for shows and movies.  This difference is IMPORTANT  If you want to watch a certain movie, youll love instantly seeing which source rents the movie for lowest price!  Bottom line  Youll probably save money in the future by renting shows and movies via Roku 2.DIFFERENCE FROM OLD ROKU 2The most important thing to note is that the new Roku 2 is very similar to the old Roku 2, which one exception  The new Roku 2 includes a much faster processor than the old Roku 2.  If you want to be able to search for shows faster and load shows faster, then upgrading to the new Roku 2 is a smart move.  Note  If your internet connection is slow, then Roku 2s faster processor will not help load shows faster.DIFFERENCE FROM APPLE TVRoku 2 will enable you to access shows and movies from many more sources (often with lower rental prices).  The Roku 2 interface might not be quite as simple as the Apple TV interface, but Roku 2s interface is still easy to use.DIFFERENCE FROM FIRE TVFire TV provides access to several sources of shows and movies, but Roku 2 provides access to more sources of shows and movies (perhaps more sources than youll ever need).  Roku also makes finding the cheapest price much easier (by instantly showing you prices from different sources).  As of today, Roku 2 does not have games (unlike Fire TV).DIFFERENCE FROM OTHER ROKU PLAYERSBoth the new Roku 2 and Roku 3 include the same fast processor and 1080p (HD) resolution.  Buy Roku 3 if you want voice search on your remote (rather than by downloading an app on your phone), you want headphones, or you want to pick from a few simple games.  Otherwise, buy Roku 2.  Roku 1 also has 1080p (HD) resolution, but the processor is much slower.  Only buy Roku 1 if you dont mind a slower user interface and other delays.  Dont buy the Roku stick  you deserve better.

INTRODUCTION  The new Roku 3 is very easy to setup and use.  The processor is extremely fast.  The user interface makes accessing countless shows and movies simple and intuitive.  Rokus best feature is that it helps you find the cheapest source for each movie.MAIN NEW FEATURESVoice search  The voice recognition is not perfect, but it definitely beats trying to scroll to type one letter at a time!  While its great to have voice search built into the remote, you can just download the app for your phone to use voice search with older Rokus.  (As a result, you dont need to buy a new Roku 3 to get voice search, but the Roku 3 remotes voice search doesnt have reliability issues like the app.)Other new features  Well, in my opinion, there are not many other substantial new features.  That being said, the new Roku 3 is still an amazing player (because it has the same great features as the old Roku 3).  I cannot tell any difference in processor speed between the old Roku 3 and the new Roku 3.WHATS NOT INCLUDEDRoku 3 actually includes almost everything youll need.  Here are a few other things youll need:- Internet- Credit card (to pay for movies and shows)- HDMI cable- Mount (If you have a WALL-MOUNTED TV, youll need a mount to attach Roku to your TV.)UNLOCKED ECOSYSTEMThe main reason to buy a Roku is that Roku is not trying to push you towards certain content providers.  Apple TV, for example, does not allow you to access shows and movies from many sources.  Fire TV tries to encourage you to buy content from Amazon (although a few other content providers are available if you look for them).  Unlike Apple TV and Fire TV, Roku makes it easy to search for shows and movies from many sources AND lets you see how much different providers charge for shows and movies.  This difference is IMPORTANT  If you want to watch a certain movie, youll love instantly seeing which source rents the movie for lowest price!  Bottom line  Youll probably save money in the future by renting shows and movies via Roku 3.DIFFERENCE FROM OLD ROKU 3The most important thing to note is that the new Roku 3 is very similar to the old Roku 3.  I bought the new Roku 3 because I love having the latest tech.  After comparing the two devices, I would not recommend buying a new Roku 3 if you already have an old Roku 3.  However, if you have any other old Roku player, then the new Roku 3 is a great upgrade (mainly due to the faster processor).DIFFERENCE FROM APPLE TVRoku 3 will enable you to access shows and movies from many more sources (often with lower rental prices).  The Roku 3 interface might not be quite as simple as the Apple TV interface, but Roku 3s interface is still easy to use.  Unlike Apple TV, Roku 3 includes voice search, headphones that attach to the remote, and a few marginal games.DIFFERENCE FROM FIRE TVFire TV provides access to several sources of shows and movies, but Roku 3 provides access to more sources of shows and movies (perhaps more sources than youll ever need).  Roku also makes finding the cheapest price much easier (by instantly showing you prices from different sources).  Fire TV has much better games.  Both Fire TV and Roku 3 include voice search.  Unlike Fire TV, Roku 3 includes headphones that attach to the remote.DIFFERENCE FROM OTHER ROKU PLAYERSBoth the new Roku 2 and the new Roku 3 include the same fast processor and 1080p (HD) resolution.  Buy Roku 3 if you want voice search on your remote (rather than by downloading an app on your phone), you want headphones, or you want to pick from a few simple games.  Otherwise, buy Roku 2.  Roku 1 also has 1080p (HD) resolution, but the processor is much slower.  Only buy Roku 1 if you dont mind a slower user interface and other delays.  Dont buy the Roku stick  you deserve better.
Really easy way to get started with yoga.  Highly recommended as a first step towards taking yoga classes.
Great reminder of trip to Hawaii (without paying "tourist" prices)!
These shoes looks even better in person!  Tennis shoes that can almost pass as dressy shoes ... Super cool.

My second grader loves this book.  He caught on quickly and asks all the time to do his "pattern book."  However, there's no way these puzzles are hard enough for eighth graders.  They're the perfect level of challenge for my second grader (some in the beginning were even too easy) but higher grades will find them too simplistic.

My son and I had a great time putting this puzzle together.  The colors are GORGEOUS, and I love how well the Ravensburger puzzle pieces snap together.  There's a great tactile satisfaction when two pieces snap together so perfectly.However, to our disappointment, the puzzle was missing a piece!  Beautiful, vivid colors and high-quality pieces, but it loses a star for that missing piece.

I bought this book on a whim from Amazon's bargain books a few years ago.  I hadn't ever heard of it and knew nothing about it.  Surprisingly, it's become a true favorite of all three of my kids.  Even my 11-year-old son will sneak into his little brother's room to hear it when I'm reading it aloud.  They love the imagery of the bake shop and the ghost and all those delicious cakes.  The sweet story brought a little tear to my own eye the first time I read it.  It's a longer book that works well for kids who like to sit and listen to a story that creates all kinds of vivid pictures in their minds.  Highly recommend!

Pros - The Fire TV fits.Cons - The adhesive doesn't stick for very long.  If you want long term mounting, I recommend purchasing some industrial grade adhesive.  Two-part epoxy might also work (but you'll need some tape to hold the mount in place while the epoxy cures).  Good luck!
My kids really like this toy, but it's a little hard to load the nerf bullets.  Overall, it's a good value.

My dog loves her dog food, but it does not smell good.  I love this pet food container.  It seals in the smell while being easy to open  The lid includes large handles that are easy to grab.  The lid includes a reliable rubber seal.  Money well spent!

This monitor has worked well for me.  The resolution is sharp and the colors are rich.  My one complaint is the aspect ratio.  It is very wide, but is not very tall.  The aspect ratio works well for seeing two programs at once (e.g., a pdf and a word file).  When just viewing a word file, the short height is not ideal (and leaves a lot of extra space on the sides).  Overall, I am still happy with this high-quality monitor.

This mat strikes a good balance between being firm enough to really cushion with a persons weight on it while still being comfortable.  In other words, if it was too soft, it would not really protect the feet and back, but on the other hand, its nice that its still somewhat soft.  This mat has helped me to stand comfortably at my desk.

The price is great, but it's important to understand this air hockey table is not equivalent to higher priced tables.  The puck slides well enough, but not smoothly like in tables with more powerful blowers.  Also, the red paddle (to hit the puck) are much smaller than I expected.  (Someone should post a customer image to show a red paddle in a person's hand.)That being said, my kids really enjoy this table.
I have four of these solid racks.  They're very high quality for the price.  Each rack is almost entirely metal.

My kids absolutely LOVE this game.  It's great for all ages because falling off an obstacle area causes the player to be automatically advanced to the next section.The action is non-stop and highly customizable.  The kids think it's hilarious when people fall off obstacles.

My boys LOVED this car maker.  They learned all about injection molding and had a fabulous time Christmas morning making cars.  They don't actually get to do too much of the process because the maker does most of it, but they didn't mind at all.  This was all they wanted to do on Christmas morning...until it BROKE not once, but twice.  My son learned that if you don't load the wax sticks point first, two wax points will end up touching inside the first chamber and slip off of each other when you're trying to press the sticks in.  This creates a jam of two sticks stuck in the first chamber and no way to push them into the melting chamber.  The jam occurred where you can't easily access the sticks, so it took a long time for my engineer husband to fix the problem.  Sure, my son should have loaded the wax with the point first, but this is a toy for kids--Mattel should have anticipated things like wax jams would happen and at least create parental access to the chamber or at least make it harder for a wax jam to occur.  The wax sticks have tiny tips--it really isn't apparent the tip should go in first.  Lesson learned.So, the first jam was repaired by my handy husband who designs things for a living.  My kids proceeded to make a half dozen more cars when the car maker broke...again.  Who knows what's wrong with it this time.  My husband says he'll look at it later because the last repair sucked up an afternoon.  This toy should be more durable.  I don't spend $40 anticipating a toy will last an afternoon.  I was also lucky enough to find wax refills, so I dumped $25 on those, plus $10 on another mold set.  In total, I spent $75 on a toy that lasted a day.  Not good, Mattel.Also, Amazon won't let me return the car maker because I purchased it at the end of October from their Holiday Toy List for my kids for Christmas.  What that Holiday Toy List didn't mention was that Amazon's Christmas return policy of a January 31 return deadline didn't start until November 1st.  So even though I purchased the item from their Holiday Toy List that was out at the end of October and didn't give the toy to my kids until Christmas, I am unable to return it because 30 days has passed from my purchase date.  Thanks, Amazon.

This helicopter is slightly HARDER TO FLY than most non-quadcopter toys, but the advantage of this helicopter is that it's far more maneuverable than the non-quadcopters I've flone.This toy will not last forever.  A few really hard crashes will break it, but it's really fun while it lasts and it's a technological marvel.Please note that it fits in the palm of your hand.  In other words, it's far smaller than I expected.  It really reminds me of a flying bug.

This case is a little thick, but it provides good protection.  In person, it looks higher quality than most iPhone cases.  I would recommend this case to people who expect to drop their iPhone a few times, but don't mind a little extra bulk.

Apple invested an amazing amount of resources to make the iPhone thin.  I am sure their engineers struggled to remove each millimeter.  Why undo all that work by using a thick case?  This case keeps iPhone THIN.  It also has a clear back so people can see that you have the new iPhone.  This thin case combined with the new iPhone makes it looks light years ahead of an older iPhone in a thick case.
This is a solid value and a reliable product.  I plan to buy this cartridge again.  I would not recommend buying an off-brand cartridge that might not last as long or work reliably.

Let me start by saying I'm buying copies of this CD to include with every family member's Christmas gift this year.  It's that good.I don't really listen to this kind of music anymore, but I purchased this album to give to a family member for her birthday and CANNOT BELIEVE HOW GOOD IT IS.  I used to listen to Jon Schmidt back in the day (we're talking 90s here) when I was a teenager and he was just starting out.  I purchased his very first album when it was newly released and used to go to his concerts when they were held in little tiny venues.  "All of Me" was my favorite song, and I spent hours at the piano perfecting it.Fast forward almost two decades. I hadn't listened to Jon's music in years, and I was blown away by how good this album is.  Just...WOW.  I've been listening to it nonstop all afternoon as I've been designing my Christmas cards, and it's truly inspiring.  I could listen to "Where Are You Christmas?" on repeat all day.  I am duly impressed.  Count me as a re-converted fan!P.S. As I went to purchase tickets to the Piano Guys Christmas concert to give to my parents (and saw the prices) my husband and I had a little chuckle as we remembered attending one of Jon's concerts back in the day at our university.  I think the tickets were $5 and the room where it was held (not even a theater) wasn't even full.  Jon, you've come a long way and deserve every bit of success!  I love seeing someone make it big doing what they love, and Jon's passion for music rings in every note.  Bravo!

We gave it to our grandpa.  He totally loved it.  The fabric and quality were very good.  It was a perfect birthday gift.
I crashed it a lot and it held together.  It only lasted 70 flights, but it was amazingly fun.  Buy it, but don't expect it to last forever.

This is not an easy workout, but great results don't come without a little pain. I was very impressed by how it worked my entire body without requiring a lot of equipment. (I recommend buying a pair of light weights to use during this workout.) The workout simultaneously teaches two intensity levels, which helps beginners get started while still challenging more advanced exercisers.

When your kids grow up, understanding technology will be essential for many job opportunities.  This set is a really fun way to introduce children to engineering.  Its educational value is well worth the price.  My son owns a few snap circuit sets and really enjoys playing with them.

This movie is an instant classic!  Wow, what a gem!  It will stand beside (maybe even replace?) "Pride and Prejudice" as THE period piece of all period pieces!Let me just say, I rarely buy DVDs (especially without viewing them first), and I rarely watch movies again in a short time span.  However, after reading the reviews of this movie and finding my local library did not have it, I purchased the film.  I AM SO HAPPY I DID BECAUSE IT SURPASSED ALL OF MY EXPECTATIONS!  This movie is so HAUNTINGLY BEAUTIFUL and STUNNING that I have owned it for only five days and I've already watched it twice--and I can't wait to watch it again!  This movie just draws you in--it's so romantic and yet subtle, and it does a fabulous job exploring the social issues created by the Industrial Revolution.  It truly takes you on a remarkable journey, sweeping you off your feet!  The film makes you take a keen interest in the characters' lives, and you can't turn it off until you find out how it ends.  (And the ending is SUPERB!  *SIGH*  You will love it!  It's definitely THE most romantic movie ending I've ever seen, and it's accomplished with "less is more".  It's so tender and beautiful that I predict you'll watch the last 8 minutes over and over!)The characters and their development are FABULOUS!  Mr. Thornton is so complex and has so many dimensions--you come to appreciate what a compelling character he is after exploring his motivations and thoughts during the course of the film.  And to see how tender he is at the end (and to see him smile!) is so breathtaking and satisfying!  Richard Armitage is STUNNING in this role.  He gives the performance of a lifetime--a certain classic.  He really made Mr. Thornton into a real person, a person you want to understand and want Margaret to love.  WOW!  I have to admit, I thought Daniela Denby-Ashe was a little weak as Margaret (she was just a little too breathy and whiny at moments for me), but Richard Armitage made up for everything and was SUPERB.  Truly outstanding!I'm on a period-movie kick right now (much to my husband's dismay!) and have watched "Wives and Daughters", A&E's "Pride and Prejudice", the new "Pride and Prejudice", and "North and South" over the space of two weeks.  I have to say, "North and South" is the one that I can't stop thinking about.  The music is hauntingly gorgeous, and the story has so many fabulous dimensions to draw you in.  You will not be disappointed!  An absolute classic!

I purchased this doll for my 3-year-old daughter for Christmas, and I have to say, I'm really impressed.  It's amazing to hear it say your child's name!  You can also program it with three other names that Dora will incorporate into the things she says, which I love.  She really does "know" every name you can think of!  My son's name is Benson, and I thought we'd probably have to settle for Dora saying "Benny," but no!  Even Benson was on her list!  My husband is a product design engineer, and even he was super impressed by the features of this doll.  They really did think of everything--you can even program it while it's still in the box!  Yes, I think it's kind of a pain that Dora can't remember more and that I'll have to reprogram her twice a week or so, but to see your daughter's face on Christmas morning when she hears Dora say her name will be priceless!NOTE FOR PARENTS PROGRAMMING THE DOLL ON CHRISTMAS EVE WHEN FISHER-PRICE IS CLOSED: When I installed the drivers for this doll on my computer that runs Windows XP, I received an error message from Microsoft saying the software hadn't been tested by Microsoft for compatibility with Windows XP and that I shouldn't install it or it might make my computer unstable, susceptible to a virus, etc.  I called Fisher-Price's customer service, and they told me the software was tested by their engineers and that it's completely safe.  They told me to click "continue" to install the software.  I just thought I'd pass the tip along!Again, this doll is SO unqiue!  It's definitely the hot, must-have toy for Christmas!UPDATE FOR PARENTS HAVING TROUBLE INSTALLING THE DOLL'S SOFTWARE:  I have read other reviewers saying this doll keeps giving the error message that it's not connected to the computer when it is.  The doll is not defective--it goes back to the comments I made above about installing the drivers.  To fix this problem, you just uninstall the drivers using the "control panel" on the start menu, and then you reinstall the drivers and make sure Windows XP knows it's okay to install the software even though Microsoft hasn't tested it.  I, too, got the error message that the doll wasn't connected when it was because when I installed the drivers the first time, I stopped the installation process when I received the Microsoft error message.  To fix the problem, just uninstall the drivers and install them again, making sure to accept the installation despite the error message.  I hope that helps!

I, too, was SHOCKED to find Gordon Korman's funniest books out of print.  I loved his stories as a kid, especially the Bruno and Boots series, I Want To Go Home, and No Coins, Please.  Unbeknownst to me, my mom gave all of my books away while I was at college.  Now that I have children, I decided to again build my collection of Gordon Korman books so I could share these fantastic stories with them, only to find most of the classics are out of print.  This is honestly a travesty.  I have SO many wonderful memories reading this books and laughing until I cried.  I have read these books over and over and never got tired of them.  The stories are so witty and well written--the characters are fantastic!  If you have grade school kids or young teens, they will LOVE this series!  And to the publisher: PLEASE BRING BACK BRUNO AND BOOTS!  I can't believe this series is out of print!  Do a good turn for all of those kids out there who may grow up without Gordon Korman books and publish these again!

You get what you pay for with Technivorm. SCAA certified which means you get a hot cup of coffee. I originally did not purchase this on Amazon because it was only available at another company with initials WS. Technivorm incorporates a copper heating element which makes this a better choice than the aluminum heating element used in the China made Bonavita. This machine is well made in the Netherlands and seems built to last. If there is one thing I would love to change, it would be the plastic filter basket. Not because it doesn't do it's job, I just don't care for hot water mixing with plastic, although unlike other coffee makers I purchased, this one produced no plastic tasting coffee. Wish Technivorm sold a stainless steel filter basket option. Other than that, this makes a great cup of coffee and has been issue free for the year I've had it.
Fragile, very thin glass that breaks way too easily, especially during even the most gentle cleaning. Be prepared to buy several replacements.

Twenty-six short stories by twenty-six directors with maybe 3 or 4 that are interesting. Most are boring and inexplicable. Supposed to be horror but you'll be more infuriated and confused than scared. You may even laugh at a few. So many directors yet so many failures. I won't even waste my time watching the sequel.

A virus turns humanity into rabid zombie like creatures and two men along with a 9 year old girl barricade themselves against the onslaught, but eventually try to venture back out.Better than I expected it would be. Quality movie with excellent performances and a heartfelt human drama element. I was going to give this 4 stars becuase it does get a little slow going in the middle, but that's part of the character development and human drama being played out between father & daughter and their estranged neighbor. Reminiscent of '30 Days of Night.' Great looking creatures and cinematography.

Not scary, acting quite poor & amateurish. Horrible editing as another reviewer already pointed out. There are repeated shots of a family photo, repeated and pointless cuts to a stuffed crow, I mean the same exact face shots over and over. There are many continuity errors - night in one shot, daylight in the next. Sound, screenplay and directing, all sub par. Skip this. I found the film "Husk" to be a decent film if you're looking for a creepy scarecrow film.

Big fan here and this is another CD that delivers some very catchy tunes and a few ballads too. My favs: Talk About You; All She Wants; Good Guys; Oh Girl, You're The Devil; No Place In Heaven; Staring At The Sun; Promiseland; Porcelain and Rio. Mika fans should enjoy this one!

This thing really gets warm. So warm in fact that the water is heated like it was on a stove! Base and plug also got too warm for comfort. Checked the steam coming out and it too seemed warm. Yes, it's nice looking and gives out a decent amount of mist but you don't want a diffuser running this hot. It's not good for the oils and could be potentially dangerous if left unattended. Not taking a chance with another. Return.

When I checked the log in the app to see what requests were being asked,  I was surprised to see that Alexia was picking up my conversations and recording pieces of them.  I contacted Amazon Echo Tech Support and was told to shut the mic off and just use the remote control to speak commands. That was a bit disturbing to me since the echo was not being activated by it's keyword "Alexia."  Instead,  it was randomly turning on, listening and recording.  Not happy about that,  so I now have the mics turned off (hopefully) and just use the remote to issue commands. However, the Echo does keep track of everything you ask it and this will appear in your app request log which you can delete.  I use it to play my prime music and did sync it with my iTunes music library and that works well.  I check news and weather and on occasion have asked questions that she could and could not answer.  It's compatible with Pandora and Audible books. Also works with iheart radio and tunein radio so you can access a lot of internet radio content.  It's also compatible with IFTTT which opens up more possibilities. It's portable and the sound quality is decent for such a small speaker. Overall, I am satisfied with the device as long as it's not spying on me now that the mic was turned off.  Has a lot of potential for further expansion.

Coma is based on the 1977 novel by Robin Cook. The film stars Genevive Bujold as Dr. Susan Wheeler who becomes suspicious when her friend is left in an irreversible coma after a routine procedure. Once she uncovers evidence of other patients being left in comas after undergoing procedures in the same operating room, she fears a conspiracy. Michael Douglas plays Mark Bellows, her boyfriend who is skeptical about her findings, so she must go it alone to uncover the truth. Excellent suspense thriller that still holds up. Highly recommended! Just don't watch it before going into the hospital for any surgical procedure.

A group of travelers partying in an underground nightclub in Chile suddenly find themselves fighting for survival when a massive earthquake hits and chaos ensues. The first half-hour is quit boring but when the quake hits, the pace picks up and the film becomes action packed and quite grim, showing the dark side of humanity during a natural disaster. Acting & production are solid and the film has that B movie rough feeling to it. Overall, it was quite a ride.

I purchased this to use with my Sonos system. I moved my entire itunes library over to the flash drive to create a network attached storage device that's plugged in to my Asus router. I did not want an external hard drive because of the moving parts and possible disc failure. So far everything is working fine and the music plays easily. The storage is more than enough for my music library and if it grows beyond the 128GB, I will upgrade.For me, this is an excellent solution.

Product looks decent enough in the room and delivers a strong steady stream of mist. Nature sounds, which are low quality and on a very short (appox 10 second) loop, are easy enough to shut off by touching the rear button. The beeps when turning on, pressing buttons and shutting off, cannot be turned off. They are a bit annoying but no deal breaker for me. Each press of the start button increases the time from 30, 60, 120 and 180 and then off. One press of the light button emits a white light. Second press dims it and third press turns it off.My main concern about this diffuser is that the water in the tank gets very warm, almost hot which is not good for essential oils. Those who wrote an honest positive review (not those who wrote glowing reviews because they got the unit at a discounted price) need to check the water in their tanks after the diffuser has run for a couple of hours to verify the water temperature and ensure their units are functioning properly. I checked by putting my finger in the remaining water. The base and water were a bit too warm, and heat can alter or destroy certain constituents of the oils and thus the therapeutic benefit may not be as optimal. In addition, I am not comfortable with a diffuser that gets this warm as this could also be a potential fire hazard. It's possible that I received a defective unit, but my gut feeling tells me that they all run warm. I may order another and see how that goes. I will change my rating & review if it turns out the replacement machine works fine.**Update**I received my new diffuser today and filled it with water to the line, added essential oil and ran it for 1 hour before checking the water in the tank. Once again, it was very warm. So the first unit was not defective and these diffusers simply heat the water in the tank. Take this into consideration when purchasing this diffuser.

Two teenage boys, neighbors in a London high-rise housing project gradually become aware that they are in fact gay. This coming of age film is a small gem of a movie and a real classic. Probably one of the best gay themed film of the 90's and certainly one of my favorites! Great story, cast, and soundtrack featuring the music of Mama Cass.

Sound is very good for such small speakers. I have these in my living room and they sound perfectly fine. The volume, bass and treble is more than adequate. This is my first purchase of a Sonos system and I'm very pleased.  Sonos customer service was outstanding. I had to call them you get help setting the speakers up with a NAS through my router. The Representative I spoke to was extremely knowledgeable and patient, and resolved the issue. Highly recommend the speakers and the company!

I'm sorry but I have to agree with the bad reviews here.  Very cheesy, with wooden performances and no real chemistry between the two leads. The plot?  Best friends make a pact to be together in a decade if neither finds love. With two months left in their deadline, they both scramble to find someone to avoid being each other's last resort. But guess what happens?  The problem with the film is that it's never really interesting, amusing or sexy.Scenes are totally unbelievable with superficial characters who are not really interesting and the entire film just seems insincere.  I will admit that I found the character of Myles (Jack Turner) to be quite the catch despite his endearing flaws. Hey,  he can love, cook and knows how to be romantic: )

Funny, slapstick comedy from the Farrelly Brothers. This is a contemporary take on the classic comedy trio. Lot's of big laughs here and very entertaining. The casting is perfect!Looking forward to the sequel. Yuck yuck.....

I only have this sound bar for a few days but so far,  so good.  Sound is very good for a 29 inch bar.  One of my biggest issues is dialogue.  I had problems clearly hearing the dialogue in movies on my previous bar which was quite expensive. Even the clear voice option didn't really do much and dialogue sounded muffled.  This Vizio blows away my previous bar big time. I can now hear what is being said and there is ample bass and treble settings for me as well. It has Bluetooth,  Surround sound and Tru volume which keeps the volume at an even level.  The box contains the Sound Bar, Remote, RCA to 3.5mm Stereo Audio Cable, Digital Coaxial Cable (RCA), Digital Optical Cable (Toslink), Wall Mounts, Quick Start Guide, Sound Bar Power Cable. The rear has the following connections:Analog Audio Input1x Stereo RCAAnalog Audio Input1x 3.5mm stereo mini jackDigital Audio Input1x RCA (Coaxial)Digital Audio Input1x Optical (Toslink)Subwoofer Output1x RCAUSB Input1x USB (for .WAV Audio Playback)Overall, I am quite satisfied so far.  If anything changes,  I will update my review.

First radio arrived with a defective screen - display light was not working. Did some research on the web and found out this is a common problem usually related to a loose cable. Opened the unit, cable was in tact. Ordered a second radio. That one was completely dead on arrival. I would not recommend this radio to anyone. Very poor, made in China garbage. Price being charged is actually insulting.

Crissy Rock delivers one of the greatest acting performances in memory, in this riveting, powerful drama about a British woman's dispute with Social Services over custody of her children. Difficult to watch but highly recommend for it's strong performances, great direction and script.

Certainly not as good as Rec 1 and 2 but better than Rec 3 for sure. Our TV reporter ngela is rescued from the building and taken to an oil tanker to be examined. The film starts off in the building where it all began and shows her rescue. Once she's brought on board the tanker, things quickly get out of control when a rabid computer-generated zombie-monkey attacks a crew member transferring the virus into him. This is a pretty solid rollercoaster ride of a film. The acting is good and although it lacks the fear factor (and hand held camera element) of the original, it's still gory fun and entertaining.

15 months ago I bought my first Roku 2, a Roku 2 HD. Can't say enough good about it. When I upgraded to a 1080p HDTV in the living room I moved that 720p Roku 2 HD to the bedroom and added a Sony "Smart" Blu-Ray player that had Netflix, Amazon, Crackle and a few other channels for the new 1080p HDTV figuring to completely bypass adding a 1080p Roku. Even though I mainly watch the channels that were on the Sony Wi-Fi Blu Ray player I still wanted a 1080p Roku so I bought an XD last week.The reasons I prefer the Roku to the "Smart" Wi-Fi Blu Ray player are that the Roku is much faster to get watching since the Blu-Ray has to boot up from a cold start and the Roku of course has far more channel selection including the ability to add private channels. Adding private channels is something the Blu Ray player will not do. The Roku draws very little power, less than a nightlight and is always at the ready. Each time I started up the wi-fi enabled Blu Ray player I muttered that I needed a Roku.I was planning all along to buy the new Roku 3 but the Roku 2 XD went on sale Mother's Day week and I figured I'd be just as happy with it for less money, so I made a snap decision on an impulse buy which turns out to have been a good one. I was not needing the Roku 3's wireless headphones in the living room and I suspect that feature eats batteries in the remote faster. I don't play video games, I watch TV so I don't need the video game function of the Roku 3 either.With my first Roku 2, the HD model, setup went by the book with no issues so I never had any contact with Roku support. However with the XD I kept getting a "011" error. First I went online with Roku chat support, waited about 10 mins in que and was connected to a CSR. After explaining the issue and sending the IP CONFIG data the CSR requested I was instantly disconnected from chat. I pushed button to reconnect to chat and started calling the support phone number on the ROKU support page. The support phone number posted leads to a phone tree which instructs you to "Push 3" for player support. I pushed 3 and instantly heard a dial tone meaning I was disconnected. That's right Roku hung up on me.I tried phoning 3 more times with the same result each time. After about 15 minutes in chat que I got connected to a different CSR. While waiting in chat que I rebooted the player and it connected fine and I've not seen the error again since. I didn't change anything on my end at all! It has worked perfectly since. I don't know whether or not the CSR changed something in my network remotely that enabled it to connect and will probably never know. I've rebooted the XD unit several times to verify it reconnects with no errors. After this support experience it is easy to see why so many people get frustrated with Roku support and just give up returning the player. There is no excuse whatsoever for posting a non-working support phone number on your support webpage.While I'm not exactly thrilled with Roku's tech support I love the product itself. Both of mine are working great and I use both of them daily. I recommend them for expanding the variety of programming available in a fast, convenient, compact and economical package.With about 4 million players to support I can understand why Roku support isn't more personalized, but if they aren't actually doing phone support they should take the phone number off their support webpage because the "click-dial tone" after pressing 3 as instructed just increases customer frustration and makes Roku support look inept.A note about 720p vs 1080p on Roku's. There is practically no 1080p programming available! Even premium services like Netflix, Amazon, etc go 720p tops. Netflix did a 1080 HD experiment for a while however isn't currently pushing any 1080p at the moment, but this could change by the time you read this. You can get 1080p on Vudu at this moment though.Also the Wi Fi and internet bandwidth requirement for 1080p is much higher than 720p. This really became evident when watching 1080p movies on Vudu. I've ordered an upgrade on my DSL internet from 3mbs to 5 and going to a higher class of wi fi router. That will speed it up enough to make it workable without waiting as long for the streaming to start on 1080p video files and eliminate buffering pauses after streaming starts. Before going to a 1080p player like a Roku XD make sure your existing network can handle 1080p streaming or be willing and able to upgrade it. Upgrading may be a non-issue for cable modem fed wi-fi internet. In fact a 720p player like the HD model is fine for 99.5% of the programming available on Roku at this time. The only real 1080p stuff I've found is on Vudu and that is for movies you've bought the 1080p version of.I knocked off one full star for the support issues I had with this product. The product itself is a 5 star item and working great but I can't explain why it is working now when it wasn't initially. If you have connection issues out of the box as I did with this XD unit, then what good is a 5 star item that won't work with a support system that is somewhat frustrating? Some people just won't have the patience to stick with it. It took about 35 minutes to get the player to connect.

This Toshiba model is a "5 Star Value" but I'm giving it a 4 star rating because it isn't the very best of the best 32-inch HDTV's out there, but good enough for my needs. Honestly for the money you can not beat this model.I also have the Toshiba 40 inch 1080p version of this same set which is about 9 months old and the great performance I've enjoyed with it is at least part of the reason I decided to go with this 32 inch 720p version for the bedroom.  I already had a ROKU HD box in the bedroom which is also 720p so the two are now working perfectly together.  If I bought a 1080p HDTV I'd feel like I needed to upgrade the ROKU also and thought I'd try this 720p TV instead figuring that really I'm not a big watch TV in bed guy.Before deciding I looked in person at this one and at 1080p 32 inch sets by two other good name brands that cost substantially more.  Really on the 32 inch sets at five feet away the difference between 720p and 1080p didn't make all that much difference and I just didn't see spending so much more money for so little benefit.  This set was to replace a non-HD CRT that was over a decade old so about anything would be an improvement.  If you must have the very best of everything you probably aren't reading reviews for this model anyway because it is not 1080p.Cons:720p not 1080p.  This is a big deal for some people, I found that to me it isn't such a big deal.Large frame around screen so it isn't as compact as other good brands with thin frames that cost a lot more.Remote sort of clunky but functional.Takes about 12 seconds to boot up.Channel changes are not instantaneous but lag about 2 seconds behind pushing the button.2 stage mute.  Push Mute button 1x and volume goes to 50%, push again and it mutes 100%.No WI-FI, SMART TV or built-in DVD/Blu-Ray, just a basic HDTV.Pros:Great picture for 720p with really good colors, no dead or stuck pixels.  Sharper than I expected.Surprisingly robust full range sound with no external sound accessories required.  A real strong point!Audio leveling tames blaring commercials but can be defeated in the setup menu if you want commercials to blare.Cheap!Good brand name.Easy to set up.Really sturdy fixed stand that also is stylish.Versatile compliment of inputs including 2 HDMI, 1 Coax, 1 Component, 1 Computer, 1 USB.Various format sound outputs, more of them than some other budget sets, including Dolby digital.Good build appearance that doesn't look like a cheapie.Low key green pilot light on front isn't overly distracting.No freaky or unpleasant odors.Fairly energy efficient with a $13 sticker on it.200x200 mounting pattern for wall mounts.All programmable & universal remotes (cable/satellite/etc) have TOSHIBA codes.Simple to set variable SLEEP timer.I shopped around quite a bit making lots of comparisons by "showrooming" several stores.  I decided on this one and waited for a sale.  Amazon and a local Big Box had the same sale price for President's Day but I went with Amazon because of no sales tax.  That way I could get the extended warranty for about the same cost as the TV alone at the local Big Box.  My only concern then was having to return it if damaged or malfunctioning but I know from experience Amazon is great to worth with on returns.The set arrived on time with my free 2-day Prime Member shipping.  The box had a huge gouge in one side but the TV itself was fine so the box did what it should.  Stand assembly on these takes about 3 minutes or less and requires only a Phillips head screw driver and a smooth flat surface like a bed or sofa where you can lay the display face down with the bottom hanging over the edge in order to attach the stand and secure the 4 included screws.When you first power it up it will boot to a screen that asks you to choose between HOME or RETAIL mode.  I chose HOME and then it did a channel scan which took at least 5 minutes and then was ready to go.I found the tip about turning off the automatic brightness function last summer on these Toshibas.  Turning the auto brightness off does perk up the picture and make the colors vivid.  Turning this feature off makes it look like it does in the store in "retail" mode.  Turning off the auto brightness does make the display run at 100% all the time so it uses slightly more energy and I suspect it also may shorten backlight life, but still if you find the picture too dark or colors too dim this is a tip worth trying so I'm repeating it here:1. Press MENU.2. Scroll Right to PREFERENCES.3. Scroll down BEYOND the bottom of the visible menu to find ENERGY SAVING SETTINGS and press enter.4. Press RIGHT control once to turn Auto Brightness Sensor to OFF.5. Press MENU and press Menu a second time to exit menu.  Done.Under PICTURE category in menu settings I suggest you leave the DYNALIGHT function "ON" as this is completely different from the Auto Brightness function.  Dynalight improves contrast and it looks slightly better to me with it turned on, which is the default setting.  This is especially true on night scenes or any scene with lots of dark colors such as an old black & white film.Also under the PICTURE category on the main menu I set this one to DYNAMIC mode and it looks great with no other video adjustments at all.  All the video settings were left at the default except I turned the Automatic Brightness off and set the mode to DYNAMIC.Next I adjusted the sound EQ and set the bass to +8 and the treble to +2.  It sounds amazingly good for watching movies or normal TV shows. Dialog is crystal clear and music sounds ok.  Some 32 and even 40 inch TV's have weak sound and leave you wanting more, but both my Toshibas have great sound and don't need any external sound augmentation for normal movies or TV shows.  I think Toshiba's sound is way above average because bad sounding or weak audio is a frequent complaint, even with some other good brand names.I really like this 32 inch HDTV in my bedroom.  I'd buy this exact model again, especially when it is on sale.  I really shopped around and I don't think you can do better with a top name HDTV for the money.  I looked at some cheaper ones too.  I liked this one better than the cheaper ones and better than some of the more expensive ones.  Again my previous good experience with my 40 inch Toshiba weighed heavily in my decision.

This cable works great with my ROKU box.  I have other HDMI cables that are built sturdier with strain relief where the cable enters the connector.  So this one gets 4 stars for the less than military spec build quality.  The more expensive cables do not perform any better, they are just built to be more durable.  I'm not constantly connecting and disconnecting these cables, so decided to give this one a try to see how it would work.  It functions perfectly with no drop outs or smearing.  If you are setting up and tearing down a lot this cable won't be as durable as some of the more costly heavy duty cables with strain relief, but for a permanent or semi-permanent installation it seems sturdy enough and on par with economy cables costing at least twice as much at the local big box.  The cable is fairly flexible and not too stiff.  Liked the frustration free packaging.  It has plastic slip covers to protect the gold plated metal on the connectors so they are in great shape after shipping.  I got it next day instead of 2-days for some reason which was super quick.  Has the Amazon logo on the connectors too.  I'd definitely buy more of these when I need them and have no reservations recommending them for a permanent type installation.

I own five other Monster products which are musical instrument cables and speaker cables.  While not my favorite brand of instrument cables they are at least 5 years old and have been 100% reliable.  So I had more than a little confidence in the brand name and the reviews were way above average.Splitters are not all the same apparently.  I knew not to try a $5 one from Walmart as those hardly ever work with cable TV.  After installing this I lost one HD cable channel which now says the signal is too low.  Otherwise the splitter works fine.  Used the Wilson brand RG6 cable to run another line to the bedroom from it.  I actually expected even more signal loss, so only losing one HD channel was acceptable for getting cable into the bedroom and I'm happy with the product.  The only way I could be happier would be if I had lost no channels at all.  For me this worked out OK and is no doubt a bit better than some of the others out there which cost just a tad less.

Got this with a Monster Standard RF Splitter Mark II to run a line to a bedroom.  Works great!  No need to spend more on a 50 foot run.  Nice connectors, flexible cable that is not stiff.  Runs over doors well secured with 3-M Command Brand Round Cord Clips.  Great value!

In spite of what you might see about it not being the right part, the part I got from Starkville Ford was exactly correct for my 2001 Grand Marquis.This is the part to fix AC/Heater fan malfunctions if:1.  You have the automatic temperature control with digital temperature readout and the readout works.2.  When operating various functions you hear the damper/actuator moving or making the hissing noise indicating it is changing functions such as changing from vent to defrost.3.  The AC/Heater fan doesn't run at all or runs only on one speed, such as high, no matter what speed the dash control is set to.  (Once the fan speed control no longer controls the fan speed it is only a matter of time before the fan will fail to run at all.  Mine ran about 16 months constantly on high until eventually it only ran part of the time and turning the vehicle left or right would make the fan stop or run sometimes until eventually it wouldn't blow air at all.)There are several videos online such as youtube that shows having to drain coolant, completely remove one hose, partially remove another hose and relocate several other parts.  However not all of that was actually necessary with some specialized mechanic tools such as pivoting head sockets.  All that would be necessary for shade tree mechanics without these specialized tools though.The Ford Crown Victoria is essentially the same as a Mercury Grand Marquis.  The Crown Vic is still being used by law enforcement.  Most of these agencies do not use a Ford dealership for service out of warranty but will have one local repair shop that does their repairs because this costs far less.  I found out which shop here works on them for the local Sheriff's Office and various municipal police departments in the county.  I took the Mercury and this new part to this shop figuring they would probably know how to do it better than I would.  I watched as the mechanic did the part swap in 30 minutes including taking time out to take a couple of phone calls.  He had done this before and had the right pivoting head Mac tools and super long needle noise pliers for the job.  The engine was just warm, not hot and he didn't drain coolant at all except what coolant bled from the single heater hose he disconnected from the heater core.  I was really surprised when the job was done so quickly having heard it was a two hour job.  I got there at 2:15 PM and was out at 2:45 PM.  He added about a pint of fresh anti-freeze to replace the tiny bit that bled when he removed one of the hoses from the connector to the heater core mounted on the firewall.  I was impressed at the ease with which he did a job I had anticipated would take me 2 hours if I was lucky even if I had all the right tools, which I don't.  I suggest asking a deputy or police officer what shop does their Crown Vic repairs.  This is good info to have with this vehicle platform for any repair on them.  If you take it to the dealership you can expect to pay many times over what an independent shop charges for exactly the same work.This part is the exact replacement part and I was very impressed with the speed of shipping and glad to get the genuine Motorcraft part.  It cost about the same as aftermarket knockoffs on eBay.  I would order genuine Ford/Mercury/Lincoln parts from Starkville Ford again.  They saved me about 30 dollars over buying the exact same part from the local Ford dealer.There is no telling how many people buy the much more expensive fan motor assembly only to find out that the fan was fine and this controller was bad.  This part frequently fails and sooner or later many Ford Crown Vics and their various incarnations including Mercury and Lincoln versions will need this part swapped out.  I love my Grand Marquis and consider it the best vehicle I ever owned surpassing reliability of the Buicks and Cadillacs I've owned, but this part's failure rate and the difficulty of replacing it is one of the very few things I don't like about my Marquis.  Otherwise it has been a very reliable vehicle.  I dread trading it and don't want to yet.This part mounts to the firewall and the metal heat sink part goes inside the vent system for airflow cooling.  It is secured to the vent housing by two screws and is located just under where the hoses clamp onto the heater core nipples on the firewall.  There is only one electrical connector that pulls off the old part and pushes on the new one on the right side when mounted.  Changing it out isn't a problem but getting to it is.

I've used electronic tuners for a long time.  Most of them that I've owned you have to plug into your instrument.  That means they don't tune with a microphone but only with an electronic signal directly from the instrument.  I bought a Korg GA-30 that was about the size of a credit card with a built in microphone to tune acoustic instruments about 8 or 10 years ago.  I used that Korg until getting the Snark.  The Korg was durable and fairly accurate but the LCD display wasn't lit making it tough to read in low light and the needle seemed to jump around sometimes for no good reason.  Still for the money the Korg was a good deal on a tuner with a microphone in it's day.Enter the Snark SN-2.  This Snark will tune about anything.  It will tune either by vibration clipped onto the headstock of a stringed instrument or don't clip it to the instrument and use the built in microphone.  Clip it to a music stand, clip it to anything and it still works when you use the built in microphone for a guitar, upright bass, violin, saxophone, trumpet or even a tympani.  Use the vibration setting for tuning an acoustic or electric guitar or ukulele or mandolin or banjo without interference from other sound sources.  It tunes about anything no matter the notes or key you want to tune your instrument to.  It senses the entire scale.The Snark SN-2 has a well lit, clean and bright display that is easy to read in bright light or total darkness.  The display pivots to any angle.  It is very light so it adds very little weight to the headstock.  The battery seems to last a fairly long time, longer than the 9-Volt battery in my tuner pedal that burns through pricey 9 volt Duracells at the rate of about 1 per month.Long term durability seems to be a question to me due the small pivot on all the Snark clip-on tuners.  I've only been using mine for about 2 months now and while the pivot part seems sort of fragile I've had no issues at all yet and it still works good.  I don't think you should drop it very often.  So far I've dropped mine once with no damage.  Even if it did break, 10 Snarks are cheaper than the rack tuner I have and the Snark is just as accurate.While long term durability is undecided I can't complain at all about the versatility, accuracy, high visibility display or the low cost.  I really like mine and use it everyday on an electric bass or a ukulele or a guitar.  It really gets around and tunes them all.  The color is sort of a metallic red, almost Candy Apple Red.  I ordered spare batteries but haven't needed to change one yet.I'd buy it again and suggest one as a gift for any musician that doesn't have one.  I'm sure they'll use it often.  This tuner is a real good buy at a good price.  Spare CR2032 Lithium batteries are less expensive on Amazon, so I suggest ordering several with your tuner so you'll be prepared.I've never used the metronome feature other than to check it out.  It flashed a locked tempo but I really don't need that feature.

Ukulele straps are a rare thing and I've yet to find the perfect one.  This one gets close.  Not all uke players use straps, some do and some don't.  Purists say not to use one and that using one makes you look lazy or inexperienced.  However I have two acoustic-electric ukes and they are heavier than the non-electrified ones the purists use.  I've found that using a strap on my electric ukes helps with right arm fatigue from clutching the thing.  A preamp and battery adds a surprising amount of weight percentage wise to a uke when compared to a guitar.  This Neotech strap frees me up to worry about my strumming and fingering techniques more and dropping the instrument less.There is another device called a Uke Leash that also works well.  It ties onto the headstock. I like this Neotech better because even though the instrument isn't balanced perfectly, it is balanced better than with the Uke Leash.  The Uke Leash is easier to get on and off my body so it has some advantage over the Neotech Simple Sling.This Neotech Simple Sling soundhole clip strap works on my Concert and Tenor ukes equally well, but I have to adjust it some when switching it between the two.The wide clip is felt lined and it does not scratch the instrument.  I don't know how long this felt lasts but it seems well attached.  This strap should work fine on any number of various stringed instruments.You have to use reasonable care with a soundhole clip strap on a ukulele or you can damage the top by jerking down on the instrument.  The clip on the Neotech Sling is wider than most I've seen and this extra width reduces, but does not completely eliminate, that risk. The wider clip spreads the stress out.  I've seen other soundhole clip straps with much narrower clips and I'm afraid to try them on a ukulele.  I like this one with the wide clip and will keep it.The Uke Leash type strap that ties on the headstock still requires full right arm pressure to hold the instrument in place, so I like this Neotech soundhole clip device better.The only thing I don't like about it is putting it on is a little clumsy when compared to a traditional guitar strap.  But once on it is great!  You look a little dorky slipping your arm into it and then over your head and you can't do it with a hat on.  It gets easier the more you do it.I'd buy the Neotech Simple Sling again.  I recommend it to electric ukelele players who want to use a strap but don't want to drill holes for strap buttons on their ukes.  Just put it on in private because you look dorky putting it on.

You are looking at what I consider to be the best friend a voice ever had.  During a 40 year broadcast and voiceover career I have used (or been forced to use) every other large diaphragm studio mic on the planet along with the Shure SM7B and it's predecessors the SM7 and SM5.Large diaphragm dynamics have some notable advantages over condenser microphones for voiceover work and solo vocalists in multi-track studio work.  I've used over the years the Sennheiser MD421, EV RE20, EV RE27N/D, Shure SM7B, Shure SM7, Shure SM5 and most recently tried a Heil PR-40.  Sometimes this was not of my own selection, but I just used what was available.  Of the lot the Shure SM7B is my favorite of the ones still available.  The SM7B is a better shielded SM7 and the SM7B of today has a better shock mount than the old SM7 or earlier SM7B.  The shielding in the B model minimizes RFI from computer monitors, florescent lighting, radio transmitter proximity, etc.  The SM7 was a redesign of the SM5.  I consider the SM5 to have been the very best vocal dynamic microphone ever created but it hasn't been in production in ages.  I have used a few ribbon microphones that were also pretty good such as the RCA 77DX and RCA 44 but they were not as good as the SM5 or SM7 or SM7B.Today's SM7B is the best non-condenser vocal microphone still in production.  Stop looking and buy one.  You will not find a better microphone for voice work whether singing or spoken word.  It has a very controllable proximity effect, something that is missing from the EV's.  I can play a SM7B like a violin, the others I just don't seem to have nearly as much proximity effect to toy with for dramatic impact.Everything that is good about condensers for voice work is in an SM7B while everything that is bad about condensers for voice work isn't.DJ's change jobs a lot and I got tired of finding the EV RE20 & RE27N/D mics or the Sennheiser everywhere I went, so I bought my own SM7B.  I never liked the EV's or Sennheiser much and didn't ever feel like they were much of a tool.  The Heil PR-40 is pretty good but doesn't have any on-board EQ options.  For recording not having the EQ is probably no big deal as you can tweak it in post production but for live radio you can't do much of that.The SM7B is a tool for skilled vocal talent, so if you are trying to make a novice sound good you might do better with an RE27N/D but for someone who actually knows how to really work a microphone over then the SM7B is only dynamic large diaphragm mic I know of that can deliver everything a real voice artist has to give.  The reason is that this microphone is designed for one thing, voice work.  The others are more versatile, but the SM7B is "THE VOICE" microphone and that was all it was intended to be. It has however found secondary duty as a bass cab microphone and it is pretty good at recording some very loud and boomy sound effects, but it is primarily a vocal microphone.Of all the instruments that have ever been recorded or broadcast, the human voice is the most complex and difficult to capture reliably.  That is one reason vocals sound good on a $4,000 tube condenser microphone, since it can capture all the complexity, inflection and multi-frequency overtones of the human voice.  Unfortunately even these very best condensers also pick up lots of things you didn't intend and also have at least a trace of self generated noise.  If you are doing a dry voiceover you can't hide the hiss of a condenser under something else.  With the SM7B you don't have to.Even for singing this microphone is sort of a secret weapon that kids calling themselves "Recording Engineers" today are usually totally ignorant about.  They figure anything short of a multi-thousand dollar tube condenser microphone is inferior for studio vocals and this microphone proves them wrong.If you want a good all around microphone, this is NOT it.  If you want the best dynamic vocal microphone, here it is.  As others have mentioned the output needs a decent preamp but works with all the pro studio gear I've ever connected to it.  I think if you have some cheap USB interface then you will want to put another preamp in front of it and that will make it far more usable for recording whispers.  Most real studio preamps are a good match for it. I've plugged it into some real junky mixers and had it work too.  You need at least 60 dB of gain, the spec sheet actually says 59.  70 dB would be better. Lots is made of the "LOW OUTPUT" of -59 dB but it isn't all that much less than the Shure SM58 which is -54.5 dB! -4.5 dB isn't much at all for any decent mic preamp.  But again most of the "one-box-solution" USB interfaces with built-in mic preamps is probably going to need some help as they were designed with the hotter output of a condenser in mind.The Shure SM7B comes with the built in shock mount in the stand mounting and yoke attachments.  Every other large diaphragm dynamic has a shock mount made for it but it costs extra.  They all need an external windscreen but only the SM7B comes with one! I got mine 10 years ago when it still came with two windscreens.  It has a nice metal case for storage/travel.  I think now they just come with one windscreen which is the bigger one Shure calls the A7WS but still come in the metal case.  I use the smaller windscreen mostly and Shure calls them the RK345 and their distributors still carry them. The smaller windscreen makes the microphone more open and airy for me and I'd suggest getting one of the RK345's, but that is the only accessory you'll need to add.  The windscreens are held on by some little Velcro tabs but easily interchanged.  They are also very durable for foam screens.On the back end of the tube is a round plate you remove with a hex key and under the plate are multiple EQ adjustments for Flat/Bass Rolloff/Presence Boost settings that you can fiddle with to get the sound you like best. You can just leave the plate off if you want. This is easily the most EQ flexibility of any large diaphragm dynamic.So I'm just adding my two cents worth here and joining the others who pretty much all agree this thing rules for voice work.  I should have written this review earlier but wanted to try the new Heil PR-40 first to make sure I was still an SM7B guy and it took a while for the Heil tryout to happen since I didn't want to actually buy one.  I still am an SM7B guy.  I would give it 4.5 stars but it won't let me do that, since there is nothing better right now in the class I rounded it up to 5 stars, but the SM5 was actually a bit closer to a 5 star vocal mic.

Surprised when this one piece unit was smaller than I thought it would be and yet sounds a bit better than I expected for the price. Sort of a WOW moment.  This fat banana sized speaker box can get pretty loud for the size of it, but you won't be DJing dances with it.  It is a more personal type "near-field" speaker than a speaker for a big room or even a small crowd. I turned it down to about half volume to run it for a while to break it in. After a few hours of break-in time I cranked the speaker wide open I heard nearly no hiss or noise even when there was no music playing. Remarkably quiet actually, possibly because it is digital and not analog.  At first I thought it was dead quiet but if I hold the HP unit right next to my ears with no music playing I can hear a very faint hiss, but the hiss is negligible and I really had to go looking for it which is far lower hiss than most conventional 2.0 desktop type speaker systems.The digital operation also explains the clarity.  It does have exceptional clarity and to my amazement retains this low distortion even when cranked wide open.  If you are looking for the window rattling BOOM-BOOM-BOOM of a 2.1 desktop system you will be disappointed with this, but if you want a very small speaker box that fits in your laptop bag which delivers clarity at a much louder volume than typical built-in laptop speakers, low distortion at full volume and no artifacts in the sound then this might work well for you. If you want the boom-boom-boom rap music style bass then you'll need to get a conventional 2.1 desktop system with a subwoofer as no sound solution this small or this simple is going to deliver the boom-boom of a 30 watt 2.1 desktop system.  This thing only has a slightly over 2 watt output capability, but it is a really clean 2 watts.When I play music it is not noticeably distorted at all. This HP unit is not a Hi-Fi speaker set or a studio monitor set, but soundly beats the laptop's built-in speakers. The Dell laptop I bought this past August never was very loud, but it is at least 5 times louder with this HP speaker box connected. That is seriously louder.  Plus the HP speaker has better low end and mids since the laptop speakers have no low end whatsoever and lack even lower mids.  I would liken the HP unit's sound quality to a high-end stereo table radio. I've got a set of traditional 2.0 desktop speakers that are louder but also have much higher distortion and are sort of hollow sounding in general compared to the HP speaker.  The HP speaker box sounds clearer with lower listener fatigue than my typical desktop speakers which I would characterize as being midrange heavy with much higher distortion than the HP digital USB speaker box.With this HP sound solution there is one cord instead of a bunch of cords all over the place plus there is no power adapter drawing current all the time as is the case with more conventional desktop computer speakers.  When the computer shuts down so does the speaker power so there is nothing else to turn off.  All you need is one available USB port to plug it into.  There are no other wires at all so it could not be simpler.  Plug it in and your Windows computer will automatically install the USB PnP driver for it in a few seconds and it is ready to use.  No other software is required.  No batteries required either, as it is powered by the USB power from your computer.As others mentioned the cord could be longer, but for use with a laptop the cord length is fine but the cable is sort of stiff and tends to go where it wants to go, so that makes it seem shorter than it actually is. If you want to use it with a desktop machine you'll want a longer cord and extensions are available from any store selling computer items including Amazon.  The cord included with mine is exactly 26.5 inches from connector tip to connector tip.  There is a Velcro wrap attached to the cable for storage convenience.  The included cord will do for my purposes.I use the HP speaker box mostly for listening to music.  This HP unit sounds best when playing music from my Dell laptop when I set Windows Media Player's graphic equalizer to the CLASSICAL preset and I've found I can't really improve much on that preset manually. When set that way I put on a 320 MP3 of the remastered "MY GIRL" by the Temptations and could actually hear the bass part all the way through. Impressive for a speaker box this size.  I found that over-boosting the bass on the graphic EQ of Media Player decreased the overall volume but didn't increase the bass much, a gentle bass boost works better and the CLASSICAL preset actually sounds best over all no matter what type of music I played and none of it was classical. The EQ seems very sensitive when this speaker is connected and a minor EQ adjustment goes a long way.As others have mentioned the volume control on top is handy and so is the mute/power button on front.  The black velvet pouch fits it perfectly, looks classy, keeps the box and cable together and offers protection for the unit in your laptop bag.  Lacking is a headphone jack on the unit which would have been a nice feature so you could use the digital processing with headphones instead of being restricted to using the computer's analog soundcard output with headphones.I've read reviews that this unit only works with computers running Windows, but then again I've read some people use it with a Mac.  I run Windows so I can't say whether it works with a Mac or what you have to do to get it to work with a Mac.  Some people also ask about using it with other devices like phones, video players, TV's etc, but it is a computer speaker and will only work connected to a computer's USB port.  Others want it to work like Bluetooth speaker but it requires a wired USB connection.For the money I don't think you'll find a better USB powered Windows laptop digital speaker box that is so small it easily fits in most laptop bags and adds very little weight. I've seen other small speakers that cost more but this one is really a good value and works just fine for me. If it had some way to attach to the top of the laptop screen and had a headphone jack then it would be perfect.  As it is it is close enough. It is a neat little add-on for my desktop and it travels well.  I can recommend it as being a good quality item suitable for personal use.

Mysteries in Space [art by Rick Veitch and Alfredo Alcala] - In hopping to another planet Swamp Thing bumps into Adam Strange who is travelling on the Zeta beam and ends up on Rann. Meanwhile, a pair of Thanagarians (Hawk People) are offering to help with a famine on Rann in return for a few pieces of knowledge including the technology behind the Zeta beam which they claim they want out of simple curiosity. Swamp Thing, now orange and bumpy, is spotted and Adam Strange is called out to handle the monster. Before Swamp Thing can utter a word Swampy is blasted into oblivion. I don't LOVE that Swamp Thing has moved into the realm of outer space sci-fi but Alan Moore's writing remains spectacular.Exiles [art by Rick Veitch and Alfredo Alcala] - Naturally, Swamp Thing manages to reconstitute himself and next time he meets Adam Strange he quickly demonstrates his ability to speak English. The unexpected meeting of two Earthlings on an alien planet is handled very cool but what else would one expect from Moore. Swamp Thing offers an alternative solution to what the Thanagarians offer, mainly using his own ability to tap into the green to solve the famine, but the Thanagarians have no intention of simply walking away from the opportunity to get the Zeta beam technology. I'm still not a huge fan of Swamp Thing In Space this is remains an excellent story.Reunion [art by Rick Veitch and Alfredo Alcala] - We get the return of Anton Arcane suffering in Hell but more importantly hos brother Gregory Arcane (The Patchwork Man), father of Abigail. As far as I'm concerned this is one of the all time great Alan Moore stories. As a 17 year old I found this story very emotional but as a father of two daughters I it's heart wrenching. As if Abbi hasn't faced enough tragedy of late this final encounter with what's left of her father is just to terrible for words. Only Alan Moore could write this story. No other comic writer could improve on this tale and that's despite the fact that the Swamp Thing makes no actual appearance.Loving the Alien [art by John Totleben] - When I was 17 I really did not enjoy this issue. This is an experimental comic both in writing and visuals and it is not an easy read. In jumping to another planet Swamp Thing ends up entangled with a sentient alien vessel. Swamp Thing constitutes his body using biological material, in particular vegetation but in this case he uses the biological material at hand which is the body of the ship itself. The ending is very surprising and poignant. You really have to read this one slowly and carefully but there is a great story here.All Flesh is Grass [art by Rick Veitch and Alfredo Alcala] - At the suggestion of Adam Strange, Swamp Thing arrives at planet J586 and as always merges with the indigenous plant life. Unfortunately J586 is a planet of bipedal sentient plant life and Swamp Thing ends up becoming a massive version of himself composed of hundreds of beings who's thoughts confuse him. The planets resident Green Lantern is able to extract the essence of Swamp Thing from the mass of creatures and he is able to continue on his quest. This is a very well written, intelligent story but I didn't love it in 1987 and I don't love it now. It's just so far from the Swamp Thing formula that even though I can recognize the genius of Alan Moore I find myself looking back fondly to his earlier writings.Wavelength [art by Rick Veitch and Alfredo Alcala] - One of the better issues in a story arc I really wasn't loving. Swamp Thing meets Metron of the New Gods and the two manage to pierce the unbreachable "Source Wall". I loved the appearance of Darkseid. No one but Alan Moore could give Darkseid such effortless menace.Loose Ends [art by Rick Veitch and Alfredo Alcala] - Swamp Thing returns to Earth and kills everyone involved in his execution in true horror movie fashion. In the end he is reunited with Abby.Return of the Good Gumbo [art by Rick Veitch, Alfredo Alcala, Stephen Bissette] - I consider Alan Moore's run on Swamp Thing to be the greatest run in a continuing comics series. Having said that this was not the conclusion I would have hoped for. Alan Moore was REALLY trying to test the limits of his writing abilities but I found the stories increasingly difficult to read. I just wanted to sit down and read a comic book not Shakespeare or Chaucer. Moore also left Swamp Thing in a very difficult state for other authors to run with. Swamp Thing was now a God who resisted solving all human pollution and hunger problems simply because human's would then feel no no need to conserve the planet. It's a fine idea but where do you now take a character who is unkillable and able to control all plant life even creating semi sentient humanoid plants and entire plant cities? Moore also left it pretty clear the Swamp Thing had retired with Abby.I love this series but I would say it peaked with book two and by books five and six had really lost it's original intent.

Background:Before 1985s Crisis on Infinite Earths DC comics had but one continuity. Sure, there were events that DC would conveniently ignore or forget about but mostly it was accepted that there was a continuation of events starting in 1938. In order to get around the radical change of superheroes that started with 1961s Flash of Two Worlds DC introduced the idea of a multiverse with Earths 1 and 2. Somehow the original Earth got relegated to the number 2 spot. Crisis started the idea of simply wiping out or changing continuity sometimes coinciding with large crossover events.The idea of Convergence is that Brainiac had been grabbing up cities prior to them being erased from continuity.
