From this, the tensions amongst the members are exposed and examined.The characters are portrayed and their relationships are examined in exquisite detail- thanks to superb acting, fine direction, and an intelligent script.The music is excellent.This movie is a joy for the overall experience, and it stands a second viewing.

This is another take on a familiar genre, which, when you find the right pairing, delivers laughter for audiences and a gold mine for movie makers.Sandra Bullock and Melissa McCarthy are such a pairing.They take a familiar storyline, and deliver consistent laughter through the entire film.Note that some viewers may find some scenes offensive- mainly the language.The performances from the two lead actors are excellent: Ms McCarthy is a genuine comedic talent, and Ms Bullock demonstrates yet again the depth and breadth of her ability as an actor who can play both major dramatic and comedy roles triumphantly.The script is genuinely funny. The direction is clever and enhances the talent of the actors.Is this a great film? No. But, it is great entertainment, when you are looking for a funny movie!

This is one of the all time classic movies- an example of motion picture making at its best.If you've never seen it- do yourself a favor.Don Siegel's tight direction, fine acting, excellent cinematography and a strong script combine to deliver this gripping and terrifying tale.Highly recommended

This is a funny movie, with a clever and entertaining storyline and a happy ending- for most of the characters.....It combines the tried and true themes of the fish out of water and the road trip. They're cleverly intertwined.It's helped along by a strong cast- Jason Sudeikis is excellent, as is Jennifer Aniston. The supporting cast are uniformly good.The subject matter, which includes drug smuggling and some adult themes, may offend some people.However, I suspect the majority of viewers will see this as an entertaining and amusing way to spend a couple of hours, without having to wear out their brain cells trying to unravel the plot!

Even over twenty years after it was made, this remains a masterpiece of audacious movie making: imagining and creating the vision of the future, and capturing it so convincingly.Then, the roller coaster storyline- is it entirely logical? Who cares! It's a fast moving and thrilling ride, which keeps you entertained for two hours.For anyone who hasn't seen it- do your self a favor. And for anyone who hasn't seen it for some time, maybe it's time to revisit this fascinating movie.By the way, I much prefer this classic original to the competent, but not comparable remake.

These are a welcome seasonal treat!Hershey only produce these special cherry cordial flavor Kisses for the holiday season each year.The cherry cordial filling combines well with the chocolate coating.If you haven't tried these, I recommend you do so- they are delicious!Another delightful piece of Americana!

This is a genuinely inspirational true story.It's ideal for family viewing.I highly recommend this movie for anyone who wants to see a warm and genuinely uplifting movie, in the same genre as movies such as "The Blind Side".

This small budget British "kitchen sink" drama was John Schlesinger's first feature movie, made in 1962.It was one of several influential British movies in the day, depicting the "real life" of "ordinary people", rather than portraying glamor, fantasy or escapism.This approach continued as a persistent theme of British movies and television.While for some this film may seem dated, I have enjoyed watching it again recently, as simply a well made movie.With hindsight, you can see the talent of Schlesinger, which led him to win an Oscar for his direction of his first US film: Midnight Cowboy- another influential movie of its day.Rewarding viewing, if you enjoy this genre of film.

This small budget British "kitchen sink" drama was John Schlesinger's first feature movie, made in 1962.It was one of several influential British movies in the day, depicting the "real life" of "ordinary people", rather than portraying glamor, fantasy or escapism.This approach continued as a persistent theme of British movies and television.While for some this film may seem dated, I have enjoyed watching it again recently, as simply a well made movie.With hindsight, you can see the talent of Schlesinger, which led him to win an Oscar for his direction of his first US film: Midnight Cowboy- another influential movie of its day.Rewarding viewing, if you enjoy this genre of film.

An amusing light souffl of a movie.This is light and uplifting comedic entertainment which gives you a couple of hours of amusement, with the messages that "you can achieve success if you try" and "work together as a team to achieve success". These are mildly and amusingly conveyed, without overpowering the light comedy.I enjoyed watching this movie- Messrs Vaughn and Wilson reprise the successful "Wedding Crasher" buddy characters formula- although in this movie they are more sympathetically drawn.Fun and amusing, but I wouldn't hurry back to watch it twice.

Everyday excellence at a modest price!I have had these Pyrex storage containers for over a decade.They are versatile: suitable for storing food in the refrigerator or freezer, and for heating/ reheating in a microwave oven.The glass container is durable and hygienic- I prefer the clear glass to plastic alternatives.The plastic lids are durable and effective.I have found these containers to be very durable, and they retain their attractive appearance- I have had mine for over a decade.Well worth considering- and good value for money.

My back pain from Spinal Stenosis and 2 herniated discs is so bad, my doctor offered me actual narcotics for the pain. I don't want to take those heavy drugs.  :( I tried all kinds of ointments and even a masseuse. Nothing helped but my heating pad, and you can't walk around all day with a heating pad.Then I discovered these Beyond BodiHeat pads. Truly a Godsend, and they work the admitted 12 hours. I always carry a spare in my purse even when my back is feeling ok, because you never know when the pain will return.  I just tear open and stick one on.  Works well for a sore knee or most places on the back, I'd say.Ask your doctor about other places. Thank you for carrying them Amazon! ..........Such a Relief!

If there's a stronger umbrella out there, the President's using it.I'm simply amazed at the capabilities of this umbrella.  This Wooqwin automatic opening and closing travel umbrella is the answer to all gift giving!  You push a button it opens, you push another and it shuts. Then you just push the top into the bottom. And you can do all of that dryly.  Nice sturdy grip on the handle too. Nylon strap to hang also.I live in thee -''windy city'' so when I heard this was wind proof and rainproof, I was over joyed. We got it yesterday and since it was a rainy day today, we took this out to an empty golf course to test it out. No matter how hard it was blowing, (45 MPH winds clocked) this umbrella never collapsed! Standing still in a down pour, he was dry.He (husband) ran almost 300 yards with it completely opened, turned it against the wind, stood there and just let the wind TRY. Nope.The umbrella won.I'll bet I've gone through more than 100 umbrellas in my lifetime so far, but I've never seen one stand up as well as this one. When you hold it you can just tell it's a quality piece by the feel of it, not heavy, -but solid, and about 11 inches tall. I have found my dream umbrella!  Thank you Woogwin!*I received this umbrella free for my honest review*

If you are reading this, -believe all of the 5 star reviews, because they are true.These are wonderful!  In my experience with headphones, what I look for  now--is comfort, clarity, construction and weight.These Thorx Sentey LS-4430  Headphones provide all of those features. Made to last with a brushed aluminum and padded over head low tension bar, that is so light I can wear then for hours with no problems whatsoever. I'm thrilled. No shmushing my head too tightly! My most comfortable headset yet.  The over ear--ear cups are really well padded and they even rotate to suit your head. They're collapsible too.  Considering what they're asking for headphones of lesser quality out there, I'd say these were of studio quality with an excellent and very high performance level. Audio quality is beyond my expectations.For this price point you will not find better.The black case they come in is very handsome and sturdy, with a nice strong zipper. Looks wise (aside from the quality) -it's worthy of gift giving. I can easily answer calls with the controls on the cord, with a built in microphone, and you can also play and pause the music from the same controls.  The aux post is in the base of the Left ear phone, and other end goes into your device. This headset is a no brainer.It's just a great set by ANY standards.*I received these complimentary from Sentley for an honest review*

No one hates the smart phones more than my husband. He sent 3 back because they didn't hold a charge for more than 3 hours, they didn't fit in his chest pocket without slipping out, and he wasn't about to carry one around like a hat box or a pizza, anymore. So he went back to a beloved flip phone, and found this Turtle back case, REALLY well made leather (made in the USA) case that fit his LG 450 flip phone, -AND his needs, just perfectly. Super strong and really well made!It comes in 2 pieces, it snaps together. He's thrilled. It's perfect. The clear vinyl covers the keys and the back clip is very sturdy. Ports line up just perfectly.  He MUST keep it clipped on his chest pocket, as he doesn't want look at his phone screen for comfort all day. ..I'm here for that.Is this a snug case? OF course!  It's real Leather! Yes!  Is it strong? Yes!  \IT HAS to be snug--because they eventually stretch out a little so you must have a case with snug-ness! You must EASE your phone into it.The numbers are just a tap away with this clear vinyl cover, close over them -as is the face.  Now he can crawl on the floor with the kids and not worry about hurting an expensive touchy phone. -Says he.I have my fancy phone, and my tablet... and he's got no say there.

This necklace is just beautiful.A shiny rich shade of silver -this could quite easily pass for real. Has a nice weight to it, not feather light or cheesy feeling. This looks really expensive.  I can't tell the difference of this shade of silver--when I wear this and one of my real silver bracelets.As you can see by the picture the chain links are box shapes and the main medallion is around 4.5 inches long a it's highest point.The whole necklace measures 20 inches long, and looks really rich around your neck. The links that hang with the coins have tiny onyx colored stones adorning them also. Very striking, feminine, and very pretty!Great with a turtleneck and jeans- a simple white blouse open at the neck-- or even a strapless top.I like my necklaces to hang longer than this one is, so I got an 8 inch extender here on Amazon, and now it hangs at the exact length I like.I'm always getting compliments on this. Down with boring jewelry!

I liked this Bluetooth 4.1 magnetic wireless i9 headphone by SmartOmni. The magnet  and the minimalism of this set is made for a sports headset that is resistant to moisture such as sweat and doesn't have long cords hanging around as you exercise or participate in a sport or activityA very advanced integrated magnetic design that uses strong magnets at both ends creates this whole unit as a circle to really hang on your neck nicely. Indicator light, in line microphone, and the multi-function button along with V + / next track, V-/ previous track are on the control bar. A little small for my bigger fingers, but I got the hang of it eventually. I really don't use this for calls or take calls with Bluetooth head phones when I'm running, but tried once for reviewing purposes- and the call was clear.Nice, well balanced, satisfying sound. No shuffling, or tinny sounds--these are unusually clear. Not bombastically loud, but rather in the safer range. Loud enough.I think they cancel out noise pretty well, considering the racket on my busy street.  Ear buds are clearly marked left and right, and all the controls are on the bar-in the cord and near your right ear. The only control on the ear buds themselves is the USB port for charging. Charging took me about 3 hours. Pairing was not a problem and I'm not using them the predicted 7 hour playtime, a few hours a day is all I need them for, although the instructions will say a probable 7 hours talk time and 7 hours play time, standby time, up to 200 hours.The ear pads they came with fit me well but an extra pair comes with. I'd call this a Hematite shade of black as they have a nice glow to them..All in all, a very cool set. Would recommend!*I received this headset in exchange for my honest review*  -my opinion of them is just my own

I love fringe, and so for me, this fit the bill. I's like an ultra suede, because it looks like suede to the naked eye, but isn't and has no bulk factor like the real thing.  It just barely meets in the front, but that ok with me because I don't tie it anyway. I think it's meant to be worn open so the fringe will blow.. It's comfortable and I can hand wash it in cold water or dry clean it. It comes down to the middle of my thigh and I'm 5' 7''. On each height, it will of course, differ. Really cute and sets you apart from the women's league of bowlers.and puts you in the more-Hippie category. Fringe is really IN this year, so I guess I'll be IN too. ..

I wouldn't rule out any woman wearing this necklace, if you're a tall or larger lady--even better.Wow. This is a heavy looking --(but Not a heavy feeling piece) that looks like a beautiful story from a fairy tale or history book. Egyptian type or Gypsy -type necklace--take your pick.A shiny silver, with 3 larger medallions touching each other,  with black onyx type stones in the enter of each.And such pretty coins hanging at the end!  This piece is Very detailed and flashy.About 4 and a half inches long-  at it's longest part in the center.This is a really unusual piece, especially if you're wearing a simple black top. Let the necklace talkIt's about 18 inches end to end ---not long like the picture..ONE CON!:The chain on this is way too short for this necklace, so I got an extender here at Amazon and I made the length longer.It's is perfectly beautiful now at 28 inches long.  LOVE this!

This ivory 100% silk mulberry silk pillow case will be the softest, and coolest pillow case you will most likely ever find.Why Mulberry silk?Local farmers in China have been growing Mulberry leaves for years so silk worms can feed on them. The resulting cocoons are spun into raw Mulberry fibers!These are grade A- Mulberry silk on both sides, 400 thread count, hypo-allergenic, chemical free, naturally colored, and my king case is 20 inches X 30 inches. These cases come in a variety of colors too  Black, beige, white, and a beautiful shade of blue. The swatches are in the tiny mesh bag that comes with along with a real cocoon.  :)There's a hidden zipper closure at the side that prevents slipping. They even say that your face wrinkles less using these silk cases!Along with the ultra luxurious, cool, soft and authentic feel of silk on your face at night, getting less wrinkles may be a huge plus!I would recommend these silk pillow cases 100%. for a gift, or for yourself. It's a quality, lovely, and an almost rare item for the pillows in your home.I think we spend 30% of our lives in bed. Why not get silk for yourself?*I received this item at a discounted price in exchange for my honest review*

Classy!  Really shows nice on your kitchen table, like a high end restaurant. These work just beautifully,. You just give a big pull on the metal top and it will pop off easily. Don't be afraid to use some muscle. SO easy to fill!!  No spilling like the smaller salt and pepper shakers--these have a wide mouth to pour in and are just so accommodating when you're doing it! They are adjustable to a fine or coarse level of salt or pepper, with ultra sharp blades that will not rust or corrode. (-and we're talking salt here)  Dishwasher safeMade of thick acrylic and stainless steel. Salt and pepper always tastes fresher and better when it's ground fresh. Other spices as well can be used.I got rid of my ugly, mangled salt and pepper shakers and was so happy to have been asked to try these out!  They're So beautiful!Dress up your table and spice things up with these stunning shakers. I Love them!*I received these at a discounted price for an unbiased review*

This Woogin Sports running waist pack is a perfect runner ( power walker)  belt is a compact version that may benefit many -as the size is just that. Compact. This should carry what you must have with you at all times. Your phone, house keys, some cash or or credit cards. Being in touch with family is a must and this carries what you'd really need -just in case. Made of a neoprene type material on one side and a strong mesh pocket on the other, with small dividers within that.  The belt is 45'' long,  end to end,  and 1 1/2 inches wide-- and the pouch is 4 inches high and 10 inches wide.The nylon waist belt does not stretch, but is adjustable, and fits very comfortably.  Water and sweat proof too.Clasps securely with the back buckle,  isn't chunky or thick, and doesn't dig into your waist either. Priced very fairly for it's quality and style. The black trimmed in lime green looks very sharp and contemporary.This is a really useful item we All should have if leaving to go walking, exercising, biking -anything physical, as it adds so little bulk.A real must have!*I received this complimentary for my honest review*

I really enjoyed using this Sahara Sailor waterproof Tail light.  :) It measures about 3 X 3 inches, not round and full but rather flattened. It's bright startling RED, with several different modes that you can alter with just a touch of your finger, with the two red dots on top of the light. The mounter goes on this light in a snap.Makes a flurry of spotted lights, some other fun modes of lights--a still light--  and hazard blinkers too.Octagon in shape, it's faceted, like a red plastic diamond. Waterproof too. Very easy to mount, easy to remove, and adjustable too. Takes 2 triple A batteries (included) and rechargeable.  3 LED lights -so if one goes out on you the other 2 take over, and you still have light.  I'd say you can also remove this and carry it if you walk in the evening. I did. It's really handy anytime--day or night, so they can SEE you coming and danger stays out of your way!Quite Affordable too.  :)*I received this free for my sincere review of it*

I have been a Cosmetician for more than half my life, and have yet to see a phenomenal make-up and brush case such as this one.Glamorous black PU leather case, richly unfolds with a stunning display of every type of make-up utensil you will most likely ever need!This kit rolls up easily for later use and has long PU leather ties to keep it all tied together neatly.All 32 black professional and luxurious pieces come with sturdy bamboo handles and with excellent quality brushes, wands, eye liner brushes, eye brow and eye lash combs, and more- to blend make up, blend eye shadows, smooth and blend your foundations-- truly incredible!  Years back,- brushes were actually made of mink fibers, but the hairs on these brushes equal them in softness and quality..- And that's saying something.I am so impressed by this whole 32 piece kit, and the fantastic assortment of beauty brushes tools and needs!  Every woman should have this kit for all of her make-up experiments, or daily use.  I am just so in love with this case and all of my  32 piece LiteXim beauty implements. A must have!*I received this quality set free, for my honest and sincere review"

This G.G Martinsen 16 G MP3 player functions really nicely. No this isn't an pod. It might feel like one though, and the price is certainly better.So many functions, on this one tiny, little blue player. It simply does all you want it to do.You can listen to music, watch movies,  play games, use it as a voice recorder, view photos,(1.78" High resolution real color LCD screen)  read e-books, and even store data and drive! Amazing! You'll be able to store approximately 1000's of songs too.. I have had a really good time testing this and using all of it's functions. Keeps my kids busy on long trips! My dad won't let go of it !MP3 playerearphone1 USB cableUser manual*I reviewed this honestly and fairly and received this for free*  I also believe in this for it's great quality.

What's not to love? Compact size,  (less than 1.5 inches prong in)  prongs fold in to prevent breakage, great for travel and such very pretty colors! Compatible with all USB charging cords, works with my iPhone, gaming headset, my tablet, my PC... ALL of it.  I love them! :)I can leave a few in my car, or luggage or anywhere I might need one. Made by Magic T.SO handy!  Sturdy ABS housing so they aren't delicate--tough enough for rough use.  There's 4 in one package!!  So USE them!Magic T warranty is for a full year. It's so easy writing a review for some thing that you use a lot and love!  Fantastic.*I received these free for my sincere review*

This Alexstudio brand luggage strap is a super excellent. This belt can help keep your piece of luggage closed safely in case of an emergency opening. This thing is really strong!.  Around 2 inches wide and at rest, is about 36 inches long and fully stretched (by hand) this is about a 60 inch stretch long (as we pulled it) and I'm even sure there's MORE give if necessary, as it's made as a belt and it will compress the extra.It's adjustable, and the clasp is much like a seat belt type of closure. I try not to over pack but if I don't, then I buy souvenir's and my luggage ends up stuffed anyway. :(Even after trying out another one of these, I know I would never travel without one for Each suitcase or bag--what ever the fabric of my bag is.It's just a much more secure feeling -since we can no longer lock our luggage- during air travel,  knowing that these would help contain, any accidentally jarred opened luggage.. I would really highly recommend a few of these -or more- for yourself or for your family.Peace of mind isn't really expensive in this case!*received free for my unbiased review*

Sentey has truly out done them selves this time.  This Artix Sentey Gaming Head set has an incredible sound, through their explosive internal speakers.  Well built and amazing!  First of all, the ear cups are so soft and fully padded, and omni directional- I could wear them for hours, (and have) without any discomfort whatsoever. Headset is plastic and light, not a heavy piece of metal hanging over, and on top of your head.The ear cups are made to sit around your ear-- not on them.  The inner overhead strap makes an ideal cushion for almost all size heads, and the strap on the very top meets this inner strap for an even more comforting and secured fit.  The controls are all located on the clearly marked left ear cup, and in this left ear- flips out the microphone. After the microphone flips down and it then can be flipped back up up for your convenience.In-line controller for Microphone, Mute and Volume. All switches on same side. Extremely clear microphone picks up your voice with out directly speaking into it. Sound so astonishing clear and realistic it Almost scared me-- (I thought bullets were whizzing by my head on one of the games!)  (ha ha)The braided audio cable -about 7 ft. 5 inches long, and is thickly covered in heavy duty plastic. Much easier to clean and very durable!When you turn on those led blue lights on the ears- you feel ready for lift off!  So Beautiful!  Gold plated USB 2.0 connector to increase connectivity. One year warranty. If you really want to impress someone with quality and performance, THIS is the head set to get!  A Huge 5 stars!*I had the opportunity to receive these for my unbiased review*

This is Wolverine LED Headlamp-is a VERY necessary light that ought to be in every ones car, hiking bag or home.Maybe even a few scattered around your home.It's very comfortable, softly padded to fit well, great stretch, water proof, adjusts either up or down, with an led light, that lasts approx 100,000  hours. 3 settings, medium high, and hazard blinking. Scope pulls out for a more narrow beam. Takes 3 triple A batteries. So easy to use, and for so many different uses!  Of course the usual, biking, camping, night riding, and incidents in strange dark places, dim attics, crawl spaces, black outs, night walking, looking for something small you've dropped or lost.  There are countless reasons more!Having a light such as this, makes me wonder what I did with out it.This has even helped me thread the dreaded needle. :(My eyes aren't great anymore for tiny objects-but with this head light, I can see Much easier.It helps so much with my jewelry making, my embroidery, tweezing my eye brows, and even painting my fingers and toe nails with a more exacting ''aimed'' light, because my hands are free wearing this. This is the best milk substitute I've found to date! It actually tastes really close to milk, especially the creamy texture and the slight sweetness. I am lactose intolerant and don't really like Lactaid, so I pretty much only drink soy, almond, hemp, rice, or flax milk (which ever is available). I've tried all kinds of brands of these milks, Silk, Blue Diamond Almond Breeze, Almond Dream, Trader Joe's, Whole Foods 365, literally at least 20 different combinations of nut/seed milks and brands. I've concluded this is the FIRST product that I've had that actually tastes like it could be milk.Prior to this brand, I actually really disliked almond milk. I could not get over the almond nut taste and the ever so slight gelatinous texture. I thought flax milk tasted the most like milk but the separation and grittiness was insane. Rice milk had the texture closest to milk but was sickening sweet and tasted like rice. I actually like the taste of certain soy milks but it definitely does not taste like milk.I would say Pacific's almond milk comes really close! I mainly use milk as creamer in coffee and tea and I believe this would make a great substitute for milk without adding additional nutty flavors to the drink while keeping the consistency. Even confident enough to say this would go great in a hot chocolate (almond and soy milk usually just don't taste right). I highly recommend.

This item does not look like the picture, especially the top, and does not fit right at all. First of all, if you don't have personal watermelon sized protruded boobs, the top will not fit! This screen did not work with my phone! My old LCD was still working on my crack iphone but glass was everywhere and the digitizer no longer worked.Upon opening the kit, I was impressed by the contents, especially the tools that came with the set. It seemed they included everything you needed although there were no instructions, just a link to iFixit.To my dismay, after putting the new screen in, I found out that the screen won't even power on. My phone was on and functional though because iTunes was able to detect it. I even booted into DFU mode and did a full restore. After extensive googling, the problem lies with the screen being a non-OEM aftermarket part with outdated firmware. The funny thing is, if I boot my phone with the old broken screen and then unplug it and plug the replacement back in, the replacement does turn on. This shows the Apple logic board does a part check in the beginning and some how knows the replacement screen isn't a genuine part. I don't know what about my iphone 5c makes it unique to not take aftermarket screens. I have a yellow 16GB unlocked phone purchased in Jan 2014.The screen bezel that came with the replacement also felt like it was made from a cheaper plastic and did not fit 100% flush with the phone! The screw drivers that came with the kit were also crap. Overall the kit is pretty complete but it's a pain to spend hours taking the phone apart, putting it back together, deal with the tiny pieces, only to find out the screen won't even power on. Avoid all the pain and just sell your phone for parts on Ebay or bring it into a shop!

DO. NOT. BUY. THIS! This product is WAY too expensive for what it is and is a huge rip off! All it is is a cheaply made wooden Victor mouse trap you can buy for 50 cents at the hardware store and a red piece of plastic that goes over the metal part of the trap. You can probably make your own by cutting a plastic take out box, paint it red and just hot glue it to the metal part of a mouse trap. You have been warned.The worse part is this thing doesn't even work. I put this next to my bedroom door because my cats like to bite at my door at night. This thing didn't trigger at all and the cats just stepped over it. They also put their nose up to the yellow trigger and sniffed it and it did NOTHING. The only time this thing triggered was when I tried to set it and it would unset itself when I put it down. When it did trigger, the red plastic thing came flying off because it didn't quite fit.I also don't think this device is all that safe. It is a fifty cent mouse trap! You don't want your pets stepping on the trigger and getting their paws slammed on by the mouse trap. I even snapped my own fingers setting this. Unfortunately, it seems the only way your pets will set it off is if they step on the yellow part, which would make the metal part snap down on whatever pressed the trigger.This device might work if you have a giant 100 pound dog that romps and bangs into things but definitely not for graceful animals like cats. Even then, there's better devices like the ssscat air canisters or a sound deterrent like the sofa scram.I can't believe I paid $16 for 2 of these things that probably cost a total of $1 to make.

I bought this bike light because I own another Inova flashlight, their ultraviolet inspection light. This light is the exact same size and style as that light and works exactly the same way, twist to turn on and press and hold the end to temporarily turn on. This light is nice and bright and I mainly use the flash mode for biking at night in the city. The light shines through at least 2 blocks and lights up street signs like a high beam! The construction of this flashlight is solid (not like the cheapo painted aluminum flashlights from Harbor Freight) and will last you many years.The only reason I'm not giving this light 5 stars is because the twisty tie mount is garbage. You can only mount the light on the handlebars of the bike and even then it doesn't stay put. The mount rotates a little when the bike bumps which misdirects the beam.Tip: you can just press the end of the flashlight 2 times and twist the 3rd time to cycle to flashing mode, no need to twist and turn the flashlight on and off 3 times.

Wow, this spoon is beautiful. I was worried that the handle part would be hollow on the inside and thus trapping dirty dish water but I think it's completely solid and closed off. No worries about dirty water leaking out into your food. I love that this ladle is made in Germany and not China. The workmanship really shows. I have WMF spoons that are made in china and this spoon looks and feel way better in comparison. Functionaly, it ladles soup fine and I haven't haven't have problems with spills or the handle being too short.

This toilet seat in TOP quality! Everything is made from solid wood with a hard polished layer of white paint that almost feel like porcelain. The color of the toilet seat is not pure white but somewhat off-white. It's quite sturdy and the chrome is quite shiny although I'd imagine it would rust after a while.Unfortunately, I cannot use this toilet seat because I bought it for my cats. They are toilet trained and I bought this seat so I can bring the child seat down and give them more space to stand on the toilet. The problem was this toilet seat (both the adult and child) is QUITE thick. This is good in terms of quality but bad for my cat. The stacking of thick toilet seats created a "tower of hanoi" effect for my cat and he couldn't find a complete level surface to squat. The child seat is raised about another inch above the adult seat.The seats are also completely flat. They do not dip in like some other toilet seats so no contour for your butt! As a result, it's not so comfortable to sit on for adults either. If you don't care about seat height and contour, then this toilet seat would be an excellent choice.

All this thing does is make your nipples larger and make them really sensitive afterwards, but not in a good way, more like a your nipple is chaffed way. If you twist the device up too hard, the suction it makes really hurts, too. Using these devices not the same as having your nipples stimulated by another person as that was what I was looking for. Also, even the size "small" is too big for me. It covered most of my areola. The only point of this device is to make your nipples bigger but I don't want that.Also, one of the devices in my set came with lube stuck at the top of the tube. My set was sold by Eros Art and fulfilled by Amazon. It looks like I got a set someone returned. Ick! Beware!

I have one of those pop-up, twist and turn, stoppers. This protector fits over my stopper fine. It works fine and catches hair fine. The suction does come off the tub. This doesn't seem to be a problem though because the device stays put regardless and does not "float" anywhere.

I have a Neato XV-21 and bought this robot because it was on sale at Best Buy. I also bought the combo brush accessory with it effectively turning into the equivalent of the Botvac 80. I am however extremely disappointed. There is a serious manufacturing defect with my new Botvac. It gets stuck in a 2 by 2 feet area and consistently tries to go backwards and back into walls. I know this is not normal because my XV-21 never did that. I am going to try to do a software update on it and if there is no fix for that, this unit is going back to the store.Update: I was able to get a replacement robot from Neato. The diagnosis was a stuck bumper. The bumper on the robot would not click so the robot thought it was consistently bumping into a wall, thus it would back up repeatedly. However, Neato still messed up or something and sent me the Botvac 80 (the purple model) instead of the 75 that I originally purchased. The Botvac 80 is the except same robot except different color and different accessories. I guess this worked in my favor because I got to keep the old accessories that came with the 75 (extra filters) AND the new accessories that came with the 80 (combo brush).  My only concern is that if the Botvac 80 they sent me breaks, I'm not sure what I would do about proof of purchase since I had originally bought the 75 and not the 80. Oh well, I'll worry about it when it happens.Anyway, my replacement Botvac works fine except it has problems with turning around next to stairs. It keeps getting stuck between the corner between the top of the stairs and the hall way wall when it tries to turn around. My Neato XV-21 never did that. I do notice the battery on the Botvac has a little more power than the battery on the XV-21. It was able to get over a slightly higher ledge going from my bathroom to the hallway where as my Neato XV-21 would always get stuck at that point. Lastly, the wall brush on the Botvac is useless. I found that my XV-21 hugged walls better and got more debris along the edge compared to the Botvac!The only improvements on the Botvac seems to be that the battery is better and it is slightly quieter. Otherwise, this machine is quite buggy and not worth the extra money. I would recommend the XV-21 over the Botvac.

I bought my mask in the Ulta store. I wanted the red led anti-aging version but they only had the acne mask which has both red and blue leds. I paid $26 there with an in-store coupon you can find online ($29.99 + tax normal price). I bought this mask with the full intention of resetting it after 30 days so I can continue using it. There is no reason why you can't use this mask afterwards. The LEDs in the mask might eventually get dimmer or burn out though but that shouldn't be after 30 uses. I would use fresh batteries after each reset.Anyway, I am 10 days into this treatment and I don't see any noticeable results. I still have black heads on my nose, old acne scars, and uneven bumps near my chin (where the light doesn't reach). The worst part about this mask is while wearing it, I find it difficult to breathe behind the mask. It also messes up my vision. After taking the mask off, things look green tinted for 10 minutes. I'm not sure this is good for your eyes!I'm going to leave 3 stars for now, will update at the end of 30 treatments with final verdict on whether this thing actually works.

This works better than a tooth brush because you can be gentler with the kitty and control your pressure. I would recommend you go slow if you are brushing your cat's teeth for the first time. My cat freaked out and scratched me up really bad while trying to jump out of my arms. Don't be too ambitious and go for the back molars the very first time like I did. I would recommend you take it slowly over the course of a mouth, starting with just a dab of toothpaste on the front canines.It's actually kind of scary to brush a cat's teeth because I don't think these gloves will protect you if kitty freaks out and sink its teeth into your hand.

I'm not sure how accurate the fat measure part of this device is but I will say this device is incorrect with how it measures your weight depending on what mode you use it in. This is pretty bad considering this is a WEIGHT SCALE before it is a body composition monitor. It could also be that the instructions are wrong in that case, they need to fix it so people can use this device correctly because the instructions themselves make up 20% of this product. I would say, without the instructions, you would not be able to figure out how to even use this thing correctly because it's super non-intuitive and finicky.I've read the instructions multiple times and it tells me that if I want to measure my body composition along with my weight, I have to step on the scale with the hand sensor already in my hands. The device will then measure my weight first then I need to hold my arms out for the body composition process. If I just want to measure my weight, I don't have to pick up the hand sensor at all, and just step on the scale. I have no problems with this process except whenever I measure my body composition and weight at the same time, I end up weighing at 2 pounds heavier than I am while using weight only mode.I'm not sure if the scale "forgets" to calibrate for the sensor being in my hands or whether their instructions are written incorrectly to mislead you into thinking the scale actually calibrates for the hand sensor. This seems like a really stupid error for the company to make if they are going to release an $80 complicated product that comes with a complicated instructions manual.AND YES, this product's operations are complicated. Another majorly inconvenient thing about it is, despite having the ability to recall 4 profiles, you have to REMEMBER to select the profile right after you turn on the device and before you step on the scale. If you step on the scale and try to recall your profile after, it's too late and your have to turn the scale off and on again. I hate how this scale does not actually work like any other "dumb" digital scale. Other digital scales reset to 0 pretty quickly when you step off. This scale remembers and forces you to manually turn it on and off to reset it back to 0. Such a hassle to just measure your weight!

I bought this book because I was trying to change my lifestyle and drink more water instead of sugary sodas and juices. I was excited to try the recipes because of the beautiful photos in this book but I have to say I am rather disappointed. So far I've tried 4 recipes in this book, I don't remember the names but they were the one with blueberries, lemon, and ginger, one with orange juice and tamarind paste, another with watermelon and basil, and another with celery and green grapes. All these recipes sounded good in principle but they either tasted like flavored water or reminded me of dishwater. What I mean by that is, even though there is good tasting fruit juice in your water, the recipe always tacks on one weird vegetable/herb ingredient that ruins everything. The blueberry drink was way too gingery. The orange juice and tamarind drink had cilantro in it that made it taste like I was drinking leftover dish washing water from a pot of soup. The watermelon and basil combination by itself was great except the recipe called for vinegar that made the watermelon juice taste like a vinegrette salad dressing. The carbonated water did not help and made the watermelon juice more sour when watermelon is suppose to be nice and sweet. The celery and green grape was just nasty salty and sour. Also, the book says you can keep the waters for up to 3 days. I would not keep them for more than 24 hours. I ended up with a big almost half gallon of celery water, and the morning after getting it out of the fridge, what was a nice green turned into a boogey green. It just did not look or taste appetizing after that.Overall I dislike how the author tries to be "inventive" with the recipes and make them more packed with flavor than they should. I think you are just better off infusing slices of cucumber or lemons in water and drinking that! More refreshing and fewer weird ingredients.

It was VERY difficult for me to find a good boston style cocktail shaker!! I finally gave this set a try and it works great!Before this set, I tried the True Boston Shaker and the Stainless Steel Cocktail Shaker (28 oz.). The True Boston Shaker leaked!! The 28oz boston shaker cup was 30oz and did not go well with the standard 16oz pint glass I had at home.This set comes with a metal cup that is maybe 32 ounces and the glass can hold maybe 24 ounces of fluid. This could be a pro or con. For me it is a little too big because I have small hands and it gets difficult to hold due to the size and weight. The good thing is this set does not leak and the recipes printed on the side of the glass are traditionally correct recipes for some standard bar drinks.I have not used the strainer. From what I can tell, it looks really cheap and will probably rust. I have OXO SteeL Cocktail Strainer as well as the OXO SteeL Double Jigger. The OXO strainer is a little too small to cover the big cup that comes with this set but it works. I love the jigger from OXO though, highly recommend.Even if you don't use the strainer that comes with this set, it is still a VERY good value! You can get this set even cheaper at Target. I got mine for $10. All the other sets I found cost at least double.

This ice tray is indeed spill proof and you can just throw it on top of your pile of stuff in your freeze without needing to worry about water spilling out.However, there are a few annoying flaws.1. The ice cubes are a tad too big and weird shaped. They are more like ice oblongs.2. If you want to fill the tray with filtered water, anything other than over a sink with a tap, you will have a hard time because unlike in a regular ice tray, the water does not flow easily from one block to the other. In a regular traditional ice tray, you can just keep pouring water in one space and tilt the ice tray and the water will overflow to the other spaces. Not so much with this tray. There are no "channels" in between the spaces so if you keep pouring into one space, water just spills out all over the place.3. I have a hard time getting the tray to release the ice cubes.4. It makes ice cubes that are not filled in all the way. This is because I have to press out the extra water when sealing the tray and sometimes I press out too much water or it doesn't seal properly and I end up dumping some water out from one of the spaces.

I have tried a majority of Annie Chun's noodle bowls. The udon bowl is my favorite. The soup really just tastes like soysauce and beef boulion but I like it, especially the noodles. I like how i can taste the mushrooms in it as well.

It's weird because the ingredients on the box has all the traditional pad thai ingredients but this does NOT taste like pad thai! The sauce tastes like a black bean sauce with vinegar and sugar. I don't taste any fish sauce or tamarind. How is this even possible?This is the possibly the worst Annie Chun Noodle Bowl. The other one is miso soup which does not taste like miso soup either. Nonetheless, all the noodles in these bowls are superb for instant noodles.

I bought this mattress protector to put on top of my latex topper. The topper fabric feel like velvet and does not crinkle as advertised. However, I would not call it "plush" as the topper is still rather thin. Unfortunately, this protector retains heat like no other. I got a latex mattress topper and it's suppose to keep the sleeping surface cool, but putting the protector on top totally reversed the affect. Sometimes I wake up drenched in my own sweat at night and this is sleeping at 67 degrees in the winter.I might just stop using the protector. I was afraid my cats would pee on my new bed as we just moved to a new place but they haven't and it's been 2 months.Overall, I would not recommend this topper for people who sleep hot. It is also expensive for the thin fabric you get. Too bad it is the only water proof none crinkly/plastic feeling mattress protector I know of!

Great. These socks are breathable and they don't fall off. The silicon heels do work unlike other socks I have tried in the past. I wear a size 6.5 and the small fit my feet no problem. I have washed them in the washer and dried them and no shrinkage or damage. I don't have anything else to say as they are just socks!

These boots fit great. I wear 6.5W and these are true to size where as other shoes I've ordered, the 6.5Ws were too long and I had to go down a size. There is enough room for me to were some no show liner socks.What I like about these shoes is that the heels are angle inward instead of going straight down. At first this felt really awkward but it made the shoes more comfortable as the angled heel gave more arch support. I found I was able to walk longer in these shoes without arch or ball of the foot pain. The shoes really fit like they were part of my feet and after I got used to the heel, walking was natural for me. I've never experienced that with any other pair of heels as they were never a perfect fit. I could still not get rid of pain completely of course. After walking 10 city blocks, my feed still needed rest.  If anyone know of heels that don't hurt your feet at all,let me know.My only complaint about these shoes are that the inner zipper rub up against my ankles and agitate them. This might be a problem if you wear tights. The zipper lining could snag your tights. These boots might work better with sturdy thick leggings. I was wearing them with no leggings under pants and against bare skin, the lining was super rough and tore at my skin!

The item title says 28 oz and the description says 30 oz. Well the title's wrong. The shaker I received is 30 oz. Overall the discrepancy made it difficult to tell whether peoples' reviews were correct in saying that this shaker fit a standard bar pint glass. Well i can tell you it is a little too big and the pint glass sinks quite a bit. I'm guessing at some point in time the item being sold was actually 28 oz but now it's 2 oz bigger.If I can find a good set, I'm returning this item. It doesn't seem to leak, but I don't like how it's so big either.

I put this dish mat underneath an IKEA ORDNING bi-level dish rack to dry all my dishes. I got two of these dish mats so I could alternate/wash one each week with my laundry. Upon removing the dish mat at the end of the week, my counter was soaking wet and there were obvious soak through spots on the bottom of the mat. Good thing 1 week was not enough for mold to grow on the counter I have. I would not recommend this if you have a lot of dishes to dry or plan to place a whole rack over it.I could have destroyed/ripped the bottom lining by putting the mat in the washing machine but this mat was advertised as machine washable, too.And FYI for those of you who are wondering because it's not very apparent in the description or in the positive reviews. In the picture, it looks like a real bamboo weaved mat. However I can assure you it's just a bamboo print. The mat itself feels like felt with a nylon backing. It also comes in a cheap plastic bag and looks like they just cut a square of this fabric off and stuck it in the bag. It's kind of pricey for what it is, absorbent felt in a bag. If you don't care what kind of print you get, the same company sells another product that is the same thing but markets it as a litter mat or dog food bowl mat. These mats come in paw prints and are bigger but cost less. They are rubber backed instead of nylon and seem to be more waterproof.

Yeah, this is a winner.WARNING: You have to get the right size. This is not one of the ones you can cut and shape. If you get the wrong size/width your feet *won't* be happy. So Amazon asks me to try these out and tell people what I think. I think "sure, why not?" These are so much better than the old fashioned ones I used to see a lot as a kid. I tried those once: the foam rubber ones with the tiny holes in them. They sucked! This is high tech. It is like having an extra set of soles in your shoes. I suppose you can replace the top foam rubber layer show manufacturer's put in most shoes, but I found that just slipping these in worked fine. They raise your heel noticeably (1/4" - you will feel the difference), but the ball and toe not so much. These will make your shoes feel tighter, but it is worth the small annoyance because the extra bounce in your step makes your feet feel better, and possibly your knees and hips if you hate being jolted by harsh impacts.These aren't miracle springs in your shoes (although I have see ad for those - and they sound pretty  cool) but they definitely make a difference if you walk a lot. Of course show manufacturers could simply add some REAL padding and support to the insides of their shoes, but since that will never happen, these "after market" inserts do the trick nicely. I am a believer now. I will never get another pair of shoes or boots without grabbing a set of these because my feet are worth the extra ten bucks or whatever these cost.  Thanks for reading; hope this helps. If you have any questions I will try to answer them.

Holy crap these things are big.I saw these advertised in jr. high school as a kid (if we sold enough magazines for the school we could get this or a Three Dog Knight album) and I never saw the value in them, coming from Southern California. Amazon asked me to review one, and since I was a kid I have been in MANY cold places. First off, I was surprised how big it is (like a pack of smokes). I seriously thought they were the size of a regular zippo lighter. Unless you have giant sized hands, this should lay flay on your palm and cover the whole of it, and your fingers if you have small hands. It is easy to use, it works like it says, and lasts for hours.You pop the top off and then remove the tiny slide-off burner part, which exposes a hole. Then you pour that lighter fluid that comes in the yellow squeeze bottle with the blue cap into a small plastic bottle that comes with your hand warmer--and fill your handwarmer from that. It is like a measuring cup so that you don't under/over fill your handwarmer and it makes more sense than I want to give it credit for. After that you just make sure the hand warmer stays upright until you light it. It even comes with a little bag/pouch that absorbs the excess naptha (lighter fluid) and keeps the metal from burning your skin.it works well, not super hot, but comfortably warm, for at least 6 hours. the instructions say up to 12 hours, but I am never out in the cold that long at one stretch. I carried it around in my (various) pockets a few times to test it for leaks (naptha burns on the skin, like when you overfill your Zippo) and had not troubles. It doesn't smell very much; I would dare say not at all unless you are really inhaling (kids, don't try this at home--I am a professional product tester :-)It is a handy item. I wish I had known how cool these are years ago; I would have bought two (*not* one for a friend). But I like mine and I will be buying one to have on hand when I am out in the biting night chill soon. Thanks for reading; hope this helps. If you have any questions I will try to answer them.

Okay, so here's the straight dope: This is a cool atomizer/vaporizer. This is not a perfumery. It won't make your house smell pretty, and it does not create a strong smell like burning incense. I did not try it with Vicks, so I did not give it the old fashioned vaporizer test, but I did follow the instructions several times. You only put in a few drops of fragrance or essential oil in comparison to the 1/2 cup or so of water, so the scent is very faint. I will try it with much stronger doses next and see if I can break this thing.The gray ring around the middle is actually a light that comes on when this thing is operating. It creates a nice effect; very spa-like. So, I got mine free for testing it out. I like it, but you have to know what it does to know if it is right for you. It runs for about 45 minutes in a real world application. It is so simple that the instructions are almost pointless. My concern is simply that you may not get the level of smell you would with a tea-light candle and a ceramic warmer; but then again, that would mean a LOT less water used. But, it does put out a vast amount of cool steam, so it does exactly what it says. The only scent or medication dispersal that will occur is in direct relation to how potent your blend is. Keeping that in mind, you can vaporize ANY essential oil with this thing, easily and with no mess. ;-)

Neoprene pad, but the top surface is different. THAT is what make all the difference.I am not a mousepad kind of guy. They are always too small and my mouse runs off of the edge because I have dual giant screen monitors. It always feels like the standard mousepad was made by stingy people, and the various images don't impress me. I never look at my mousepad; I am looking at the screen. I read a few reviews before agreeing to try this one out and the word on the street was that "it is large." It is, in fact> TWICE the size of a normal mousepad. It is my humble opinion that this should be the size of all mousepads.I tested this with my $100 Kensington state of the art ultra mouse that claims not to need a mousepad, but works a LOT better with one, my $80 Logitech m705 (which apparently is now cheap at fifty bucks), and my $120 Logitech "dark surface" mouse. ALl of these mice claim they do not need a pad, but they give me problems no matter what surface I use. This pad made **significant improvements** on all three mice. the top surface feels like a teflon skillet; a flexible teflon skillet, but definitely like a smooth surface that has been gently roughed but with sandpaper. I am seriously liking this thing. I wish it had not taken so long for someone to get this right.

This is the best cookie sheet I have ever encountered. Technically it is a "baking mat," but I was new to the idea when I first tried it out. I didn't bother to read any instructions. I just tried it out to see if I could break it (I failed). I am attaching images to show how this thing performs. I started my first test with a batch of peanut butter cookies (pictured below). They came out perfect - not burned on the bottom, or even dark at all. The heat distribution was far superior to anything I have ever experienced. I had no idea this was how the pros do it. My greatest surprise was when I pulled my boring old-fashioned "non-stick" cookie sheet (and baking mat on top of it) out of the oven and slid the baking mat directly onto the wooden counter. Within seconds it was warm to the touch, but several degrees cooler than the metal cookie sheet that I needed to use an oven mitt on. And, the very best part is that the cookies slid off with no hassle or scraping - and no PAM or oil was used.All in all this is a no brainer. It makes cooking baked goods far more satisfying and easy to clean up. No stick, no fuss, no problems. I was offered mine free to test and review (which I have done) and I am glad to have this product in my kitchen. I will keep the old cookie sheet around as a support platform, but that is really about it. I wish I had know about these things years ago. Hope this helps.

Seriously disappointed. Before anyone says anything - I tried this on BOTH sides of the transparency film just to make sure that I was not doing something wrong, or that my printer wasn't reversing the film.I followed the directions and tried several times to make this work. I am using "genuine Brother Ink" on my MFC-J6720DW printer. The ink sits on top of the plastic. It actually beads. I spent a year making maps of an old cemetery for the local museum and when I printed out my transparencies they came out almost impossible to read because the ink was so faint. Others may experience better results but I wasted my money on this.

I am seriously in love with this thing. I have bought all kinds of computer headsets: Turtle Beach, some other $100 brand wireless headset, and a few of these cheapie Logitech ones. If you need to have your head covered with giant cans that block out all awareness (and you want to look like an air-traffic controller) then these are not for you; but if you want something that is cheap, buts out a LOT of sound, and people can hear you, this is what you need. It's noise-cancelling function is moderate; but then I am comparing it to a $250 model I bought to REALLY cancel mic noise. For most people is is all you need.Please note: there is no volume control or mute button on this model. For that you want the USB version. This one comes with a 3.5mm jack.I generally **hate** wired headsets, but every cordless headset I spent money on has its own set of problems, from flat out not working (and having to be returned) to the headset turning off automatically after 5 minutes - and then there is the weight issue. Make no mistake - these are exceptionally basic, but they are made by Logitech. I have bought more Logitech products over the past 20 years (speakers, keyboards, mice, speakers, headsets . .  . ) than anyone I know. I trust this company. They make TONS of stuff and they do it on a budget. I got this headset for free from Vine to test and review, but it works just as well as the two I purchased a few months back.P.S. This *will* work on your iPhone or Android phone, Mac or PC.

Oh my god I love this thing!Okay, so I have been trying my hand at making pizza, but the dough is a problem (not being a professional pizza chef). I don't want to spend $300 on a Kitchenaid mixer with a dough hook, and besides, people have been making bread and pizza by hand since the beginning of time, so why not me? I was offered a chance to get this thing for free if I tested it and posted my findings. Little did they know that I am a complete amateur at monkeying around with dough, so it did not look good for them. So here is what I did and how it worked out:I grabbed an old pizza dough family recipe from a friend and went to town. Unlike my previous experiments I dumped everything into the bag (after letting the yeast "proof"). That's really it. This comes with two reusable zippy ties (made from silicone) and you just knead everything in the bag. Knead, and knead, and knead. After about twenty minutes of gushing it around in your hands (which was kind of like playing with Play-Do as a kid--so that was fun) I let the bag sit and the dough rises in the bag. I punched the dough down (still inside the bag--this is where you start to appreciate the beauty of this thing) and tossed it in the refrigerator overnight. Today I pulled it out, punched it down and turned the bag inside out.This is the best part. The dough literally peels right off of the bag. I never would have believed it last night. There is literally "no clean up" with this thing. No bowls and spatulas to wash off, and zero waste. All of the dough landed on the butcher block and was made into pies. I was skeptical about this (and how hard it was to make bread or pizza). This is a permanent member of the kitchen and there is no way in hell "BakeitFun" is getting this thing back. I try to be selective on what I review (I turn down a lot of offers), but this time I scored. This is one of the best kitchen inventions of the 21st century to date. It is ridiculously simple and it actually works like it is advertised.

OhmygodIlovethisshow!Warning: NO SPOILERS appear in this review.So yeah, yeah, I watched Smallville way back when, and Arrow. Those were "good," but CW has REALLY stepped up their game with Gotham. This is as good as The Blacklist and iZombie. It is so good it makes me not want to watch Arrow or The Flash. It is an "A-list" quality comic book series. It is set BEFORE Batman is Batman. That sounds dumb, right? But that is the beauty. It is not quite a cop show. It is a "city of Gotham" show, with the cop-show mentality but showing all of the characters involved. You will see some pre-supervillians, and some *early* Bruce Wayne, but that is all I will tell you. I am buying these "per episode" so I seriously like the quality of this show. If you watch the first two episodes you will get the feel of the first two seasons. A *lot* happens, but the feel of the show never changes. It is good from beginning to . . . midway through season two. That is as far as they have gotten. This is a sleeper (most underrated amazing TV show this year).I feel bad for the shows I like/used to love. This has reset my standards.

Okay, this is my new favorite gadget, with one HUGE exception.First the bad parts: You will almost certainly need a driver, and this comes with none, and no manual. Go here (the official website link) to get the driver for either Mac or Windows (I didn't see anythingf or Chromebook): http://www.tp-link.com/en/download/UE300_V1.htmlOkay, so my story, and why it gets 4 stars instead of 5 (this will apply to most of you). I got this to review and I popped it in my MacBook. Voila! It worked! Just for 30 seconds because my MacBook was nagging me to upgrade to OSX Yosemite "for free!" so I did. Well, I inserted this thing again and the little light flashed and blinked, but I had no internet. So I tried it on my PC (Quad core i7 running Win 8.1 - a fairly current machine I think). NOTHING!Grr . . . now I was upset.Well, after about an hour of searching I figured out I had to go to the TP-link website and find the product and look for a driver (that is why the link is above). I downloaded it on my PC and my MacBook. I had to install and restart my computer but now it works perfectly. It is fast - literally as fast as my hardwired connection can go; which is much faster than my wireless (but tat is just simple physics). I love this thing and it is compact and handy. I am VERY upset that they couldn't print that you DO need a driver and WHERE to get the driver in the manual. That is just sloppy. The reason I love it so much though is that the new laptops (like my MacBook don't come with an ethernet port, so without this I can't get ANY internet unless it is wi-fi, which is not always available. This is small and unobtrusive (it is about the size of a large USB thumb drive and the USB plug snaps into the large plastic case (the cable bends in a "U"), so that is nice. It is an elegant solution to a problem MacBooks have (no ethernet plug). Just make sure you download the driver and go through the ten minute install process. If and when Apple releases yet another Mac OS upgrade I am certain that you will need to hunt down the link to get the new driver and reinstall it, which will be fun, because you will need to get on the internet somehow to get the driver to allow you to connect to the internet. So, like I said, I got this for free to test and review (thanks Vine!) but that didn't mean I would like it. It is amazing (once you get it working). Anyway, hope this helps. Thanks for reading this. :-)

I was asked to review these, so I accepted a free package and I went to work on my Mustang. I had some problems (below), but the short version is that they work and they are superior to the factory originals I replaced.So here's what happened and what it means to you:I set about replacing the various bulbs illustrated on the back of the blister package (the paper insert inside the preformed plastic case. It shows places these bulbs can be used (dome lights, trunk lights, parking lights, etc). I did not replace the dome light on my Mustang convertible as the plastic lens was difficult to get off and if it broke I would have to go find another one. I had better luck with the license plate lights and the trunk lights however. These fit into the standard sockets very well, but there is some maneuvering (elbow grease) to make them work. During that time the exposed wires can (and did) get bent. This is a small design flaw. You see, the connector wires (you can see one in the Amazon product shot - it is at the opposite end from the white squares (LEDs). are wrapped over the edge but not secured. They bend left and right (like thin wire does) and that makes the bulb not work, or flicker when you are installing it. There are no instructions so I had to figure this out for myself. Straightening them out (to look like they do in the product shot) is easy enough once you know what to do.The factory original bulbs were all glass (even the connector part), and so these look and feel a LOT more durable. The LED here provides a piercing bluish-white light that is much brighter than the incandescent filament the factory bulbs use BUT they are omni-directional. They shine ONE WAY, so you don't get the full pass through ambient light you get from an incandescent bulb. This matters in the trunk, as the LEDs that shine sideways and against the trunk roof do you little good, so you can't count those as "helping light up your trunk." In simple terms the bulb is operating at roughly 50% efficiency - so you have to take that into account as to why your trunk will not be much brighter. They work a LOT better as parking lights, where their rear and side facing LEDs can have their lights reflected.Now for the bad part: They do NOT fit as trunk lights. They fit the slot, but they are slightly larger than the factory bulbs, and thus when you try to insert them into the lens cap (after slotting them into the connector where they light up) you won't be able to replace the lens cap (the part you see on the outside of the car - just above your license plate). As a result I broke one of my lens caps for my license plate "lighting system." I am paying to review these it seems. Not a huge problem, but don't think that you can make these fit - and lens caps are universal in size on most every car in America, so that means these won't work at all for your car. I would remove another star for this except that they are pretty ingenious and LEDs last a lot longer than filament bulbs. They are a good idea and I would like to see this technology supported so that it can improve.So there you have my results: they work, but they have limitations, and they are too large for certain applications where the automobile manufacturer has only allowed for the exact space taken up by an original bulb. Caveat emptor - thanks for reading this. I hope it helps you.
If you know the song you like it. This is a clean (clear sound - no glitches) recording of it; uncensored and unchopped.

I was asked to review this, and when it first arrived I didn't like it. The product images make it look larger than it is. It is the size of a Bush's baked beans can (or a Foster's - if you like). It's not bad - just small. It is great for a kid, or for a mini tent lantern, or something on your way to the outhouse (assuming you are camping). It is extremely light (the light slides into the housing when the lid lowers - so that is all empty space when the lantern is on.Okay, so this thing grew on me after a while. It is bright, but it would be nice if it were brighter. It will light up a 6x6x6 area to a comfortable dim working area, or you can easily read by the light it puts out if the lantern is with 2-3 feet and above you. One thing that would make it a LOT better is if there were a shield, so you could make it directions. It sounds hokey (unless you are camping - and given that it is camouflage painted that is not a stretch), but if you wrap one side of the light in foil it makes a much brighter lantern. The thing is ridiculously easy to operate; you simply lift the lid, or flip up the handles and give them a quick tug. The lantern extends about 5 inches (that is how far the light slides up) and you can adjust how much light you want by raising and lowering the lid (and thus the lantern light bulb) as much, or as little, as you like.It requires 3 AA batteries (double A - not triple A - just in case you are skimming this review), which you insert in the bottom. The thing is moderately durable. It is made of a plastic that feels like tin, so it is not crush proof, but it is somewhat resilient if you drop it (on the floor, or dirt - concrete might be a different story - I didn't throw it against a wall, but I will if any serious buyer needs to know its impact resistance). Oh, and there is a compass on top. It "works" (for the most part - it sticks just a little). This is useful if you are lost in the woods but it won't replace a real compass, or one on your phone.All in all for the price it is a good little lantern - just don't be surprised how small it is (about twice the size of a soup can). I think I will keep this in the trunk for a while and see if it is handy there. It is surprisingly dark in a trunk at night when you are rummaging around for something, and this is very bright at short distances. Thanks for reading. Hope this helps.

These are cute in theory, and they do work (the little balls roll along the top of the shower curtain rod to make the curtain slide easier (less tears). But they make me feel like I am showering at a cheap motel. Alright, so I am old (finally!). I am no longer in my 20's, and if I was, the last thing I would care about is bathroom aesthetics. But having a few coins in my pocket to jingle together now I like the idea of actually enjoying the view in my bathroom. I like something that looks cool, and a bit elegant, instead of like a cheap gas station. These would be perfect for any  "# Motel," or "Motel #." They were easy to put up and they work, but this is not my cup of tea.By the way, I was given these to review, but only after I politely declined the offer. I warned the company that I like my shower curtain rings (I actually bought an expensive set, and as crazy as that sounds I have never regretted having something really nice in the bathroom, along with a cloth curtain and a cloth shower curtain liner - so maybe this product is outside of my demo). I will boil these clean and donate them. Someone else may appreciate their usefulness. Thanks for reading. Hope this helps :-)

I was invited to review these at no cost. While I am deeply appreciative for that honor I have a few complaints. The sound is fine and they work, and they are easy to use. Yeah, yeah; the engineers did their job.BUT . . . It is a matter that they just don't fit like they do in the pictures. I have to wonder if they glued these onto model's heads. You see, the issue is with the backstrap part that wraps around your head. It is semi-rigid, like a stiff electrical cord (well, I guess it is an electrical cord). I understand that it was designed that way to help keep it securely on your head, but it does not "grip your head," so that part doesn't quite work, but staying with the stiffness - it is too stiff to allow the ear buds to fit into your ear canals. You end up with a pair of ill-fitting earphones that sound great and look kind of cool, but fall off of your head and keep sitting on the edge of your ear (canal) because of the angle.They come in a nice carrying pouch (it's a soft black clamshell case with a zipper) and a USB charger, but that does not fix the fact that they just don't fit. I blame thee wraparound backstrap thing for being made of the wrong material. It is flexible but like a spring. A spring can stretch but it always snaps back into the same shape. It is not customizable. Neither are these. I know they are inexpensive, but at what cost? The technology is cool, but they need better testing before this leaves the factory. I like reviewing products, but this one should have been reviewed on the factory floor. :-(

Okay, so I read the other reviews and rah rah rah they are great. Well, yes, they are, but I would like to add some real meat to this discussion. So, I was approached by LG to review these and I really had to think of how I could possibly TEST these things before I said yes. Lucky for me I am smart (or just lucky). Here's what I did:I took my credit and ATM cards and diver's license and slipped them into the smaller cases and headed to Starbucks, 7-11, and Burger King. In fact I went to as many places with "swipe and pay" or "tap (your card) and pay" or "wave your card in this general direction and we will happily take money out of your bank account." The whole point of this is to protect your new "RFID chip imbued" cards from hacking. Think of it like a lead sleeve. In fact it looks like a browning envelope you might put a wafer thin . . . er . .  wafer (I suppose) into a microwave. If you have ever made a pot pie or a frozen pizza in a microwave you have seen the silvery lining inside the cardboard box your microwaveable food comes in. It is what "crisps" your food. This looks exactly like that on the inside: a cardboard foil sleeve essentially.I don't know the technology, but it certainly blocked any RFID signals, as I was unable to pay for anything with any of my cards when they were inside the sleeve. I had to physically remove the card from the sleeve and then suddenly my wallet felt instantly lighter. Come to think of it, this and some scotch tape could be a great way to start saving money. Just tape your cards in these things. So, all in all, the technology works. These are really lightweight, and relatively convenient. Now, there is the caveat that you have to actually slide your card out of the little cardboard foil envelope every time you want to use it, but this is the price we pay for having "tap and pay" or "wave and pay" technology and at the same time protect ourselves form having our cards hacked. I can't speak for the passport, but as it works the same way (it's just a larger sleeve) then I am confident it is just as effective. Not exactly sexy, but safety never is.

Mediabridge asked me if I wanted to review this. I said yes, as I have just joined a gym and carrying around my iPhone 6+ is kind of a PitA. So, pros and cons:I really like the 2" wide velcro strap. It is a lot more comfortable and stable than I had thought it would be. It is super-high quality velcro, and not scratchy at all. I read where another reviewer said that it collected fuzzies. Well,that is true of all velcro. The alternative is to get a leather strap with a belt buckle. Personally, I like this option. It is easy to adjust if you tighten it too much, or put it on too loosely. It did fit my bicep nicely, but if you have really skinny arms, or "26 inch pythons!" you will probably need to make some manual adjustments to this product to make it fit you. If you are in the majority middle however you should be just fine.This thing is a lot more stable than I had imagined. It really didn't look like it would stay pressed up against my arm from the product shots, but here is where that wide velcro armband really comes into play. Well, that and the rubber backing of the case for your phone sticks to your skin a bit as well, so this thing doesn't move around a lot. The controls are all covered (volume buttons, screen on/off button, and even the big round button on the front of your iPhone is now a raised rubber M. This means no camera usage and no selfies, but how could you do any of that when it is on your arm? This thing is designed to be slipped into and out of at the gym, or whenever you are getting ready to run/exercise/work in the garden for a length of time.. . . Which brings us to the cons: Well, this means that you have to take your iPhone out of your OTHER case, and then put THAT CASE somewhere while you are exercising (or whatever). If this is not a PitA then you are in good shape. For example, if you were to be running a half marathon, or skiing, and wanted to listen to music all day this would be great. It is just enough of a hassle that you don't want to have to do this every day. Also, as far as water protection, think of it as sweat-proof but not waterproof. If you are wearing this on your arm presumably sweat will roll down (thanks to gravity). the speaker, lighting plug, and headphone jack are not covered at all, so this case is not even "water resistant," but you should be able to work out in it doing anything BUT swimming and be fine. I was.Ultimately, this is like a condom for your phone. It is a soft piece of form-fitting rubber that slips on easily enough and holds your phone in place remarkably well. It is not rocket science, and it is not a miracle product. This is *all it does* and if that is enough then you will get great value out of it, but it is not something most people will ever keep their phone in on a regular basis, mostly because it is hard to work the controls on the screen when your phone is on your arm. This is a "one-purpose" product. It does that purpose well, but other than that it has limited value. Anywa, hope this helps. Thanks for reading.

I was asked to review this. Just so you know, I got it for free, but that never influences my review.So, how did it work?Well, just in case this is not completely obvious, let's step back a moment and think about what a "selfie-stick" really is.It's nothing more than a glorified monopod (mono - versus tripod). Monopods have been around forever. Usually you will see some sound guy holding a microphone on a giant stick (or "monopod") just overhead of an actor, out of frame of a camera. The idea of the "selfie stick" is to attache a small camera to a monopod. So really, the question is whether this is a halfway decent monopod (with a camera attachment on it).As a monopod it is okay. It does its job, and it is easy to use. It is VERY light duty (even for a selfie stick) so you do have to be careful with it or you will bend or snap it, so only 3 stars there. That said, the cell phone holder attachment at the end is industry standard, and it works well, holds your phone ion place firmly, and accommodates anything smaller than a phablet.
