At least it won't get scratched.This is the sort of thing where I'm supposed to be able to write a simple, pithy review to the effect of "simple to use, works well, does what it's supposed to do."  The fact that I can't just makes me all the more disappointed in this product.  Avoid.I hope this is informative.  Please feel free to comment or ask me questions.

Having played with this device for a month or so, I like it.  A lot.First, the pros:1) Google TV is actually a great built in operating system.  I haven't experienced any crashes, I liked the ease with which it updated its own firmware, and the tv's control panel is a really intuitive interface.2) An amazing picture.  Stunning.  Just remember to keep it orthogonal to sunshine and you'll be reliably glare free.3) The passive 3d thing is really nifty and easy on the eyes, and you can play with its settings to adjust how much depth is perceived - practically, this adjusts how out of sync the alternating lines in the picture are, but it works.4) Did I mention that it comes with just about every connective interface one could think of (except perhaps Thunderbolt - give that a few years and it may be in a successive generation).5) The remote was really easy to pair with the television once it connected to wifi.  Also, as an added bonus, you can download an app that turns your smart phone into another remote.A few cons:1) There are some ways in which the interface is not intuitive.  My particular gripe is that when you're watching regular TV, there's no on screen option to go straight to settings.  You have to go to the home page first.  This would not be so much of a problem except for the fact that the remote itself doesn't have a settings button.  Interestingly enough though, the downloadable Google TV  remote app actually does have its own settings button.  Weird.2) It's great that you move the mouse on screen by moving the remote itself in space, like a Wii controller, but it's not the most precise of tools, and it takes a *lot* of practice to learn how not to wield the remote in more than the most clumsy fashion.3) The TV's built in wifi receiver is really not that great, and I don't see why it couldn't have been made better.  We first had the TV in our living room, and it had a lot of trouble receiving a decent signal from our router, which is upstairs in our guest bedroom.  This is particularly problematic because the TV sometimes couldn't connect to wifi except after repeated attempts.  This problem went away when we moved the TV to our bedroom, but still, more flexibility here would have been good.4) The remote shows every indication of being proprietary - although I haven't tried it, I don't know how well a standard universal remote would work with the Google TV system, and in particular I don't know how many universal remotes come with built-in keyboards or motion sensing technology.  Of course, "proprietary remote" usually equals "expensive to replace."5) The main drawback of LG's passive 3d technology is that it really plays 3d at 1080i rather than 1080p - that is, it staggers the horizontal lines so that each side of the glasses is only picking up every other line.  The main consequences is that you're only getting 540 lines of resolution rather than the full 1080.  I don't know how one would work around this, though, except maybe by creating a tv that really has 2160 horizontal lines squeezed into a 1080p aspect.  This may not come for a while but one never knows.6) Last and admittedly not that important - don't expect to be able to pick up broadcast TV without an antenna, but those are not necessarily that expensive.In sum, this is an amazing product.  Hopefully we won't get sucked into using it that often.  (Also, it would be nice if someone gave us a blu-ray player with 3d capability, but you can't have everything.)Please let me know if you find this helpful or if you have other questions.

This is a good example of getting what you pay for.  In this case, not that much, and as I will explain, I don't really know why this thing exists or why RCA invested time, money, and effort creating it.First, the pros, for what they're worth:+The voice recorder is OK, if a little difficult to use.+The device has open storage and an intuitive folder structure, so it's very easy to shift files in and out of it when it's connected to a computer through USB.  This is probably it's best feature.+At least the one I received came with a $10 card for eMusic, which makes this thing even less expensive than it really is.  Don't know whether this was included just to sweeten the hearts and tongues of Vine reviewers, though.Alas, the cons, which in my opinion far outweigh the pros:-The videos are recorded in a proprietary format whose translation software is WINDOWS ONLY.  In other words, OS X users without recourse to a windows install will NEVER be able to watch any videos recorded with this thing.  In my opinion, THIS IS A DEALBREAKER.-The interface is really clunky.  There are limited options for navigation, and they don't always make sense intuitively in context.  There were a number of times where I wanted to be able to do something with this device, but it took me way too long actually to get there.Look, folks.  I use an iPhone, and I simply cannot see any purpose for this device which my phone couldn't do ten times easier and better.  That being said, there are people out there who don't use Macs and don't want to spend the premium for an iPhone, and this might be good for them.  Then again, Droid phones are also cheap and I can't imagine they couldn't handle what this thing does that much worse than an iPhone.In sum, I can't see how this device is anything but a low-end product with an extremely limited target market - windows users without the wherewithal for a cell phone with a data plan.  So I really don't know why this thing exists.

The good news is that it's an OK but not spectacular broom and dustpan combo.  The dustpan part is particularly nice because you don't need to bend down to pick it up.Two pieces of bad news.  First, it's not as effective as a regular broom - my daughter spilled a whole lot of tiny rainbow sprinkle balls on the kitchen floor, and this thing had trouble picking them up rather than just pushing them around.More obnoxious is that it takes too long to charge.  This won't be a problem for most people, but know who you are and how much you sweep - if you're sweeping multiple times a day, this won't get you very far and it's not for you.  For example, there was an enormous half-lab / half-newfy who belonged to some folks who lived with my in-laws for a spell.  This dog loved nothing more than getting wet and tracking mud, and my mother in law found herself sweeping much of the first floor of her house several times a day.  This sweeper would not have helped her very much at all.In sum, know what you need to sweep and how much, and that will tell you whether this is a good investment.

My daughter is 6 years old and the large size fits her great.  The sizing info on the vest says it's for ages 4-6 years, 24 inches chest, and 45-60 lbs.  Fits her snug but not too much so, and she's on the very slightly husky side.She can't swim quite yet, but we've been tying a noodle around her chest and allowing her to swim around the pool using that.  However, the noodle can unravel, so an adult needs to be near her at all times.  Thus, we wanted a more secure solution and the vest provides just that.

This lighter is beautiful; my husband tells me that one should expect this level of aesthetic elegance from Zippo.  More important, however: this is *the best and most effective non-disposable long-handled lighter I've ever used.*  *Period.*  How shall I count the ways?1)  The flame at its highest setting has so much output velocity, you might need to get an acetylene torch if you want anything stronger.  OK, maybe that's a little hyperbolic, but I've only used one disposable with comparable power.2)  The flexible goose neck is ingenious, and incredibly practical so many ways.  For example, after I light Shabbat candles, I have to put the lighter down before I make any blessings. With the straight-necked disposables, I was always afraid of putting the lighter down on the heirloom wooden buffet cabinet where I have placed my candle-holders; with this lighter, however, I can simply point the neck up and put the lighter down.  No more worries!3)  Another example of why I love the goose neck:  when my husband grills he lights his barbecue coals in a chimney starter which he places on top of the lower grille of our Weber kettle.  When it's windy, the matches which could fit in the side holes of the chimney's lower chamber do not produce a strong enough flame to survive the wind, and the straight necked disposables won't fit in the side hole.  With this lighter, my husband simply curves the neck under the lower grille and back then back up into the chimney chamber from below, and the flame is strong enough to take care of the rest.  Unbelievable.4)  I can't imagine how this is not a more environmentally sensible product than the disposables.I have only two minor gripes.  One potential flaw that doesn't bother me so much but I can see how it might bother others with less manual dexterity, is that the the clicker for the flame itself is a flat switch rather than the trigger on virtually all of the disposables I've used.  But again, from my perspective, the increase in usage difficulty is marginal, especially when compared to how clunky such a trigger would look on this lighter.  My other gripe is Zippo's claim that the lighter should only be refilled with Zippo's own premium butane fuel; besides, the way the lighter is designed, any replacement fuel would have to be inserted through the flame adjuster at the lighter's bottom via what appears to be a proprietary mechanism.  I'd appreciate any information as to whether there are more generic (i.e. cheaper) alternatives or whether such alternatives are wise.  (On the other hand, I don't smoke or light fires that often, and I can't imagine I'll be running out of fuel on a regular basis, so how much expense could there be?)My husband tells me that back when he knew a lot of smokers, Zippo lighters were definitely among the hippest and coolest accessories for that vile habit.  And they work phenomenally well, much better than the Bic disposables.  Given that (thank God) fewer and fewer Americans smoke, Zippo clearly had to expand into different markets, and this one strikes me as a perfect fit for their expertise in elegant but easy flame creation.  Bravo!

Pro:  The armband is a good design - not too elastic but not too tight.  Velcro doesn't last forever as we all know, but I can't think of a cost-effective or practical alternative which would be any more durable.  In particular, something akin to a belt or watchband with holes and a clip would if anything be less durable.Con #1:  Mine came with a cloudy screen cove.  One, it made the item as a whole look stale, which might not be entirely impossible given that it was designed for the 4th generation models which will likely be obsolete come September.  Two - perhaps as a consequence of degraded plastic - my motions and touch on the screen felt that much less sensitive.  It's ok if all you really want to do is strap the thing on while you're exercising and navigate the music player, but it wouldn't be quite so much fun if you actually wanted to text or write an email, tasks requiring considerably more precision.Con #2:  I normally keep my iphone in an Otterbox Commuter Case, which is designed to make it difficult to extract the phone, for any number of good reasons.  Surely Belkin knows by now that there are lots of people like me out there who keep their phones in protective cases.  The fact that this product, and every other product Belkin makes for iPhones, all insist upon being their own exclusive cases strikes me as ridiculous.  Surely there's a way for Belkin to invent an armband which functions essentially as an adjustible clip which would enable people to keep their existing cases on and yet still enjoy the benefits of a good exercise armband.

These Playtex bottles are great, easy to assemble, clean, and hold while feeding.  The whole bottle comes apart which makes it super easy to clean -- and gives you peace of mind that you're properly sterilizing it for your little one.  I used these same ones with my last child and found they didn't leak like other brands.Downside to this:  If you lose the little vent disc piece that goes in the bottom of the bottle, you can't use it any more (they do provide some extra vent discs, however).  The bottles come apart into five pieces, which is a lot of keep track of, compared to other bottles.The bottle pack comes with five bottles (3 slow flow bottles, and 2 fast for when newborn gets bigger) in the box, making life easier with a newborn when you can't wash dishes right away.  It also comes with two extra nipples which is really helpful.I'm not sure if the VentAire thing really works, but I don't see anything negative in it.

I have been on the market for a good vacuum cleaner for awhile.  I tried out many, many upright and canister vacuums -- and returned most of them.  It was actually nice to get a chance to review the Hoover Windtunnel canister -- it was one of the models that I had purchased and returned to Target, although a slightly different model.  At the time, I returned it because I felt that although it was amazing at getting at the crevices and the cobwebs on the ceiling in my home, it failed to contain the sort of suction I needed to deal with wall to wall carpeting.  (I have hardwood floors, wall to wall carpeting, carpeted stairs, and area rugs--so I got to test a variety of surfaces.  We also do not have pets, but we do have grandma's dog that visits regularly and sheds plenty.)  I liked being able to test this Hoover Windtunnel model out more thoroughly though, but the longer I use it, the more disappointed I become.First of all, the suction is not that great.  It does just fine for low pile carpets and hardwood floors.  Medium pile carpeting gives it a harder time -- I would pass on this if you have wall to wall carpeting.  And the worst part is that the suction seems to get worse over time.  Moreover, the brushes in the vacuum head does not seem very powerful.  Between the poor suction and lousy brushes, a lot of dust and dirt ended up being pushed around.The main advantage of this canister, however, are the other attachments.  It was easy to vacuum the stairs, the ceilings, and the baseboards with this attachment.  Getting under furniture and beds was also a cinch.  As a result, it is an excellent choice as a secondary vacuum to get your place extra clean or for super spring cleaning.  However, at this price point, I'm not sure who would do so.The Hoover is lightweight -- though I see that there are plenty of other reviewers who disagree.  For me, it's not been a problem to carry it around.  And it maneuvers well enough.But if your primary goal in purchasing a vacuum is suction -- I have other recommendations.  For those die-hard canister fans, I would recommend a Panasonic, which is also slightly less expensive.  If you can afford a Miele, I found that people who had them were consistently satisfied.  Among uprights, we tried out the Dyson.  Among the many people we know with Dyson vacuums, it seems evenly split among those who love them and those who hate them.  I ultimately settled on the Electrolux Nimble, which to me, had the best combination of suction, maneuverability, and price.  But vacuum choice is a highly personal experience.  I would recommend trying out several.  I hope my review may have helped guide your purchase, though.  And if you found it helpful, please let me know!

The moment I saw this pendant in person, I decided to give it to my 6 year old as play jewelry.  The heart pendant is oversized so as to be comical.  It looks incredibly cheap and not pretty at all.  The chain is a double chain and it gets tangled easily.  It is also far too delicate compared to the outsized pendant.The cubic zirconia stones are microscopic.  I would pass on this one.

I feel like the adhesive on these Nexcare waterproof bandages are much better than compared to Band-Aid Brand Water Block Plus.  I had a nasty cut on the finger where I was a little too aggressive chopping vegetables and had the opportunity to try both bandages out on alternating days.  They both pretty much did the trick--staying on for most of the day, despite exposure to water during hand washing, dishwashing, or bathing.  The Nexcare stuck a little bit better than the Band Aid brand; however it was a little trickier to put the bandage on curved surfaces--like around a finger.  The water blocker bandaids work like a typical bandage.  But the Nexcare is oval-shaped, plus it has these little tabs that you hold onto until the bandage has adhered to your skin and then you remove the tabs.The only notable exception:  My daughter had a scrape on her middle toe.  She's six.  That's a little toe.  She insisted on having a band aid on it for weeks.  Well, we got to test a variety of bandaids and made much use of these waterproof ones (since she wanted a new bandage every time one fell off in the water).  The Nexcare bandage stayed on through a visit to the swimming pool, but then fell off half way through the shower later that day.  The BandAid waterblocker fell off a little bit sooner.  However, a regular BandAid bandage (with princess character) that managed to wrap a few times around itself (since it was such a small toe) actually stayed on for a couple days.  Go figure.

My husband and I disagree about this product - he'd give it a three, and I'd give it a five.  We agree that this is a neat product, given its flexibility and the fact that the iPad bed easily turns 360 degrees.  However, we disagree about whether the main riser is just right or too stiff.This thing works because the iPad sits in a bed, a case really, connected to the rest of the frame via a stiff hinge that is capable of holding the iPad's weight in place more or less at any angle as needed.  Again, I don't mind the stiffness, but my husband does.  However, we do not know whether the stiffness will hold for months down the line - I guess we'll wait and see on that one.

I did not enjoy using this product.  In particular, don't expect the gel pack to warm up within 10 minutes, especially if you've refrigerated it to make it cool. The product instructions should have disclosed that the heating time was from room temperature.  And even when it was warm, it was really no warmer than running a washcloth under really hot water from the tap.  You don't really need to pay for a product that's going to lose its heat almost instantly.  My engorged breasts were in agony.  Cabbage leaves ultimately brought the engorgement down, but for immediate relief, I used an old fashion hot water bottle and that did the trick.Even used as a cold pad, it didn't seem as effective as Soothies Gel Pads, which were amazing for the initial nipple soreness pain from starting breastfeeding a newborn.  If you have severe nipple cracking and bleeding however (as I did trying to nurse a tongue tied baby), you ought to consider asking your OB or midwife to prescribe something called Triple Nipple Cream (also called Dr. Jack Newman's Nipple Ointment) which will heal nipples in 24 hours.  The prescription will have to be compounded (mixed together) by your pharmacy, so you'll have to check to make sure the pharmacy has it in stock.  (A mom's tip:  24 hour pharmacies tend to have more different drugs readily in stock b/c they never know what prescription will need to be filled urgently overnight).If you found this review helpful, please let me know.

In general, this is a good printer for its price point.  We tested it on a Macbook Pro, mid-2010 vintage running OSX Lion.1)  Assembling the printer and the cartridges was easy.  The instruction poster was quite detailed and quite helpful.  5/52)  Wireless setup:  we were unable to connect the printer to our wireless network directly, probably because we don't use a numerical password and our network is not open.  However, it was easy to introduce the printer to the network through our computer, via USB cable. We're curious whether people with routers using standard 10-digit WPA or no encryption found the connection process directly from the printer.  Nonetheless, even given the limitations of the printer's LCD console, it shouldn't have been too difficult to program it to accept wireless passwords with more than just  numbers, even given the price point.  3/53)  Software installation:  Mac users have two choices:  install with the included disc or without.  The main difference is that the drivers on the disc enable you to monitor the printer's ink supply directly from the printer system dialog.  The generic drivers from the operating system itself apparently do not.  Also - keep in mind that there are two driver choices for OSX wireless printing from the operating system itself - one of which connects through Bonjour and the other which does not.  As best as I can tell, connecting it through bonjour may make it harder to switch between printing and scanning.  My recommendation is to use the driver on the disc.  4/54)  Printing:  once the printer was connected, we had little trouble using it.  Some minor gripes make it a 3.5/5 overall.  A)  The printer seems to have an irreversible default to printing in color at least on OSX - the printer's system setup dialog does not contain a color option as far as we have been able to tell.  Individual applications may have their own particular print dialogs, some of which enable printing in grayscale or black and white.  However, for some processes (e.g. printing coupons directly off the web through Coupon Printer) switching to black and white seems impossible.  This is a gripe because color ink is expensive.  B)  The print tray itself does not hold that many sheets.  Between this, and the fact that the printer itself is fairly slow, I would not recommend using this printer for documents longer than 10 pages if you have an alternative.  For this reason alone, we're not ready to mothball our decade-old laser printer even though it's not wireless.  C)  Photos - this thing can print photos just fine if not spectacularly.  It would have been nice if it had an SD slot for printing directly from the card to the printer, rather than having to go through the USB port.  However, since USB adapters for flash memory media are commonplace, this is a minor gripe at best.5)  Scanning:  you have a choice between running the scanner from the printer or from the computer system dialog.  I would handily recommend the latter, again mostly because I prefer to avoid using the tiny, clunky LCD console.  It's a good scanner, whether through the feeder or with documents or pictures placed directly on the bed, albeit a little slow.  4/5 if you go through your computer, probably 2/5 otherwise.Disclaimer:  we have not as of yet tried using this as a fax machine.All told, this is a good product for the price, but you might want to pay a little more for a similar printer that is faster, with a better console, and which offers more color flexibility directly in the driver software.

It's seldom we're treated to a mixture of hot and sexy steamy romance, a real love story and a lot of hold your breath-scary suspenseful moments. I couldn't remember getting this excited over a book, I honestly didn't want it to end. It's fast paced, action packed, a real page turner. It kept me on the edge of my seat and my stomach churning ... everything a good thriller should be. The story is well written and the characters believable. Texas Kissing is a sizzling, and intense romantic suspense conspiracy thriller.The writing is amazing, Ms.Newburry knows how to keep your attention. Sometimes, she would leave off at a tense moment only to pick it up later. Gah, not fair! The characters were real, with real flaws that all of us have This is one of the best romantic suspense novels I've read of Helena's, and I know it's not going to be the last,. as a matter of fact, I think the author is just warming up! it's really fast paced--pages are flying as you get deep in to the story. Plan on not doing anything that must really get done, because it's not going to happen. You will not be able to put this down, it's consuming, it's one hell of a ride. Well done, Ms.Newbury!     I was provided an ARC  for a truthful review

Since I had GETRON cell/GPS holder dashboard/windshield mount, I didn't think I had a need for another one. I mainly use this to hold my Garmin GPS. Up until my company started combining our twice a month conference with webinar at the same time, I felt a bit inadequate having to drive to my destination while listening to the conference/webinar. This cell phone air vent version is like heaven sent! I switched my Garmin to this and mounted my Note 4 to the dashboard mount since it's higher and more like eye level since I can hear the GPS tells the coming turns ahead. It really works great and serves my intended purpose. Now I don't miss any scheduled appointment nor any of our company's webinar if they happen to coincide at the same time. It's a win/win situation and I'm happy. I really love this smart little gadgets inventions...they make some inconvenience a lot easier to handle!

I could have easily given this a 5 star except for the fact that almost 60 percent of the book is much ado about nothing. First, the heroine, Holly, appeared to be of a weak character and a whiny. Then there's a lot of senseles scenes and conversation and a lot of getting drunk and more boring conversations. Only up to the last 40 percent of the story that it got interesting. Where at the beginning I kept putting it down as it was almost excruciatingly boring,  I couldn't put this down like my life depended on it. I went through a multitude of mixed emotions...I got so angry and disgusted with the hero, Jake, and his whole family, especially his mother, they were heartless and phony. There was one scene where I felt like my heart was ripped wide open, it brought back some memories. I cried, I was afraid for her, I was apprehensive, angry and sad, and then I was so proud of Holly, I felt all the emotions and hardship she battled, her triumph in the end. But oh, it's not over, far from it. The beginning is just starting, I was so hooked that I felt I was reading two different books. I urge you not to give up, don't let the first half deter you, keep on reading, I promise you'll be so involved you'd probably dread getting to the end. You'll want more, definitely more! I really, really hope the next book would come very, very soon.Well done, Ms.Isabella White, you got me...hook,line and sinker! I am looking forward to the next phase of Holly's life's trials and her triumph.

Short as it is, it has a big promise of becoming one of the hottest series. Intrigue combined with deliciously and sinfully sexy, Stone, it is instantly addicting. The electric attraction between Allison and Stone, really sizzles. The kiss so hot they forget they're right smack in the middle of a crowd...and t's just the beginning ...I'm already hooked!

was a bit surprised too see so many negative reviews at Amazon, some said It was so bad they didn't even make it to the half of the story and gave up. I started to doubt if I read the same book. I love this tale and the characters, they all seem so real and relatable. It has drama and a little mystery that kept me glued in. The heroine, Tiny, is one strong, loving young woman. Dedicated in helping her very ill mother, despite her serious impiment, she takes on a dangerous and unsavory job that could get her in prison, worse yet, could cost her life. And Ian, the oh so handsome, sexy as sin,so taken by Tiny's beauty, inside and out, took on the job of taking care of her and her mother. His unrelentless pursuing of Tiny, making sure she's safe, was just admirable. There's a scene where Tiny was so devastated on the lost of her mother, rode like hell on a bike until she collapsed on the ground on the cemetery where mother was buried. She was so overcome with grief didn't realized Ian followed her. He picks her up and said..." would you let me share your grief and comfort you, she was just like my own mother too, it's my loss too"... So profound it brought tears in my eyes.The ending just got so intriguing and I can't wait to read the final book, TAKING CONTROL, I highly recommend this. a complimentary copy courtesy of NetGalley

First of all, I'd like to apologize to the esteemed Ms.Jordan for voicing out my disappointment and for giving this less than 5 star. I fear I sound like an ingrate for she generously gifted this to me. I always believe in honesty is the best policy, and I'm sure Ms.Jordan would agree with me. I believe that she gifts many reviewers many of her books solely for the purpose of posting an honest and fair review.Having said all that, If you like a lot of hot sex scenes and not much of a real story, this one will do that for you. I was impressed with the first book, it had potential and a great promise of becoming one of the best sellers that I rated it 5 star. It was full of intrigue, drama, a little angst and of course, hot sex...and it was exactly just that, pure sex and not much else. The majority of this short tale was all about their wild kinky sex. While at Gio's little yacht over the whole weekend, they had a marathon of sex, Gio trying to establish dominance over Taryn as his sub, pages and pages of them that I ended up skimming through it all. It just got old and, somehow the magic from the first book was lost.

And what a cliffhanger it is! I haven't recovered yet and I can't write this fast enough so I can get started on the third book.Dom is one hell of a dominant, sexy and handsome as sin, a perfect lover who just know how to drive any woman lose their mind. He and Juliet are a perfect match made in heaven. The many incredible sex scenes are explosive, wild for my own imagination. Expertly interwoven with drama, dirty backfighting, intrigue and jealousy made this short tale intense and more intriguing than any erotica book I've read so far, I am so excited and anxious to see what happens next, now that Dom discovered Juliet's secret that he sees as a betrayal...ah, my chest is constricting, gotta read the next book, NOW!

The 1st and 2nd were great, (gave them 5 star) I couldn't wait to read this 3rd one after book 2 ended in a real cliffhanger. I just have to have this, the final book, pronto! I simply couldn't waste any minute. And what a let down this turned out to be. The first quarter of the book is mostly about brokenheated Juliet, staying in bed, days on end, sobbing, waiting for Dom to come knocking at her door.  Binging on junk food, booze and completely forgot about personal hygiene. Then all of a sudden she gets up, pulls her hair up, in her flip flops and sweatpants she's worn for days, ( one of her roommates implied she reeks) took a cab and went to Rexford hotel to try to talk to Dom and explain herself. Excuse me, but if trying to see my boyfriend to beg for his forgiveness and take me back, I would absolutely make sure I look amazing, well groomed and smelling like roses. So of course, she didn't get him back, not even to listen for damn minute, he just called her a whore and drove off. So Juliet decided to decamp and work for Lillian, Dom's ex wife, the very same who exposed Juliet to Dom about her being a bait to lure him and get photographed in a compromising position, the very same one who took Dom to the cleaners and now owns a large amount of his stocks. And why would Lillian go to Juliet's house and offer her a job at the hotel as her personal liason? She's a newly graduate, no experience and just an intern, that just threw me off, it simply doesn't make sense. Then not long after, all four of them, including Dom's brother, Xander, were in it together plotting to catch Blaine Prescott, Dom's arch enemy and competion, to confess he's behind the attempted killing of Xander and Juliet, using Lillian as the bait. To make matters worse is Dom leaving the scene to take a phone call, doesn't return until everything turned violent, both Juliet and Lillian gets beat up. He's supposed to be there the entire time to make absolutely sure Lillian is safe in case Blaine Prescott turns berserk (which he did)This has become a farce! It didn't even clarify who tried to kill Xander and Juliet, It felt unfinished and rushed. I almost didn't finish this, but I just had to. After all, I've already invested 6.97 of my precious dollars for two books that each ended at 76% and one at 88%, short as it already is, I don't think that's fair.

I am so impressed by this darLing of a book. This is my first of Lola DarLing, and Im so taken that I got the other 2 books and can't wait to read them. At the end of this first book, things were just getting intense and the passion between Juliet and Dominick is about to heat up. Reading the synopsis, I know something dreadful is going to happen. I'm in tenterhooks,  I can't wait to devour the next 2 books.

This one is different and way better. It has a real good plot, it's substantial and the characters have more depth. This two, Gio and Taryn are one hot and explosive duo. Their continuous banter is a mind tease, definitely titillating! So far, only one sex scene, but oh my, it's one combustible, incendiary, searing blistering hot! It's worth re-reading over and over again...whew! you would need a fan...a BIG fan! So scorching fevered red hot you might just call for a fire truck! ;) could hardly wait for the next one.

What a nice short read, it's so different and fascinating. It's a mind tease, it lets you stretch your imagination. And the Dom, Mr.M, will keep you glued to your kindle waiting for his next move. Wow, Ms.Adair, you have such an imaginary mind filled with lusty thoughts. ;) love it!

Wow! What an erotic, hot, sexy and intriguing short tale rolled into one. I'm so caught up wanting to know more about the mysterious Mr.M, the more I read about him, the more I get hooked. Read this, you erotic book lovers and you won't be sorry...not even a bit!

This is just the kind of story I always wanted--simple, no profanities , a little bit of angst, just enough to get the story flowing. There's a bit of drama and lots of honest-to-goodness hot sex, I mean hot! The characters are so diverse, so convincing you could see them in everyday walks of day to day living.I'd consider myself blessed to have a best friend like Larene, who's there to hold your hand while you cry your heart out, who's there to eat and binge on chocolate cookies and ice cream with you, calories be damned! And iI'll absolutely consider myself ncredibly lucky to have a boyfriend like Tristan Blake, who not only a billionaire but hot as hell-fire sinfully handsome, but also knows how to truly show good times and romance a woman. Oh yeah, talk about wine and dine you in private entire floor, overlooking a breathtaking view of the entire city, from the top floor of an exclusive sought after restaurant...who takes you in a private jet and flies you to London and Scotland just to make up for his errant ways. Sure, Noelle suffered some heartaches but who hasn't? I have had my share of heartbreak but no one jetsetted me to UK,(not just yet!) let alone in a private jet. If that happens to me, call the paramedics please! Swoon!  ;)I like Noelle, she's smart, she's beautiful and level headed. I admire the way she handled all the conflicts and dealt the heartrending news and Tristan's fury directed at her. Somebody has gotten engage...and somebody leaked out the sensational Tristan's family secret and scandal to the media...what a tangle and mess they weave! A hold-your-breath moments aplenty. Tristan and Noelle's relationship is never smooth, it's one step forward and two steps back. Oh, but it's all worth it, had I not waited for the complete series to be available before I started to read it, I really don't know how I would have handled it. I probably would be sporting smooth hairless head by now from pulling my hair. Those can't wait for the next book to find out what happens next can drive you to madness. But then again...it's all so worth it! Read this, guaranteed to treat you to a most absorbing, emotional at times, sexy as hell read. My first of Ms.Emilia Winters and it wouldn't be the last, well written and I highly recommend it.

And once again, I'm simply been proven wrong! Ms. le Carre is a master of poignant moments in sexy as hell-romantic writing. SEXY BEAST is one of her best novels in which she recreates such breathtaking moments. A luminescent love story set against a trademark storyline of two people in love with one another, but having to wade through practical and emotional obstacles before they unite. Layla and BJ are a fictional couple who jump out of the page because Georgia makes them real and believable. The pace never slips and your interest is kept from beginning to end. My gut was like a roller coaster reading the dialogue between BJ and Layla. Emotionally and sensually, this book really packs a good punch. The characters and their interactions with each other are beautifully written with a strong emphasis on the emotional link between Layla and BJ, their special bond is strong and has real depth. It is passionate, it's deep and intense, imbued with a sensuality that leaps off the page. Though all of Georgia's books I've read are stunning, so far, I'd say this is not just one of the best. To me, this stands out, it's different from all the others. There are several twists and intense moments throughout the book, and the characters are diverse. i really liked the way Layla's character grew from the shy but spoiled little girl to a stong fearless woman, that still however, shows her vulnerable sides at the scarriest crucial moments. This is gripping at times, when faced with a devastating news that threatens their lives. So different from all of Georgia's books. This is also the first time she shared with her readers one hero's sex scene with other women other than the heroine. It was vivid, explicit, raw, but my oh my, it was electrifyingly hot!Ms,Le Carre is a genius at describing all that happened in the past, including that of Jake and Lily's story leading up to that night, when BJ caught Layla in his bedroom stealing something from him. What follows next was Layla's come hither's vilifying "punishment" from BJ...and that was just the beginning, a wetting of ones appetite...so rousing I wanna stand in line and get punished! ;)I clutched this book to my heart when I finished it and have re-read it. I feel an incredible gratitude to Ms.Le Carre when she brings us stories like this. She's made me laugh and cry, all her books gave me a myriad of fleeting emotions...I have been terrified, angered, excited,--and this is no different. She gives you that sultry, Gypsy itchy charm, a cover for a multitude of sins and passions simmering just under the surface. She uses a seamless multi point of view to let the reader really experience these vividly created people in a way enforced writing, (single pov) just cannot flesh out. It's simply Le Carre's and the genre at it's best!!!

What I like best is that it's a standalone, no cliffhanger, no waiting for the next 2 or 3 more books to get to the HEA. It's simple, no explicit, sleazy sex scenes either that gets so old at times. Instead, it left a lot of room for your imagination.I also especially like that the author brillliantly weaved a whole lot of different facets of what makes an easy read and entertaining story. It's had all what I'm looking for in a good book. A mixture of drama, right amount of angst, mystery, murder integrated with somewhat akin to supernatural sixth sense and a love story. So refreshing I highly recommend it.

This came real handy when we went to Disneyland and took the splash mountain ride, it's a rollicking log flume ride that goes through many dips guaranteed to get you wet, including any gadgets you have with you. Hah! It's definetely one of my faves rides so we took it more than twice and not a tiny speck of water got in my cell. We were so ready to get soaking wet but confident it would keep my cellphone safe and completely dry. Some of my friens had to stay behind and take the next ride while one of us stay in the dry ground to hold their cellphones while getting on the ride so as not to get them wet. While, I, takes the ride on every turn. ;)The opprtunity to do a true test how good and reliable this waterproof pouch came yesterday. We had an almost all day pour of rain, when I thought it finally stopped in the late afternoon, I set out to take my hour long power walk, put my cell in my pouch just in case it rained again. It did! and almost like the heavens opened up and just poured out the rain cats and dogs! Did I worry? Nope! My cell is tucked in nice and dry. I can't help a smug grin in my face ;) knowing it's definitely one of the BEST I've ever OWNED!!!

Loved, loved this product! You can eat or drink anything and it stays, amazing! You can even suck face and no one can tell. ;) LOL! I'm so glad I can still get this at Amazon or else, I'll be really screwed! (pardon the pun) ha haa! I have gotten so many, many compliments how good and becoming the color on me,  I've lost count. It's a true wonder for me why manufacturers discontinue products or colors that was so popular. I mean, you couldn't find these easily when it was still readily available. They always ran out of stock, anywhere I went. So, when it comes back in stock I would always purchase several of them, afraid they'll ran out again. Sadly, this color together with one of my faves,( Azalea) has been completely discontinued. So yeah, I'm grateful Amazon has them all the time. I shudder at the thought when one day Amazon would say...sorry, there's No More! Yikes, I think I'll be bawling and throwing a fit!

I thought this would be a bit complicated and would require one to possess a computer savvy mind. No sweat, just downloaded it then clicked , then clicked the book I wanted to read and voila...there it is. Best part is it's Free!

I was really very curious as to what this book really entails, so I got it since it was free. Now I know I'll never going to develop a liking to this kind of books. There was really no story, no depth, no character(s) growth--it's just simply pure SMUT. Its akin to watching a porno movie, only its not visually but literary. Not sure which one is bad or if it is really bad at all. I guess, "to each his own", one thing I know for sure...it's not for me!

We've read and seen the best part of this tale at the second book. It could have ended on book 3,instead it was dragged on to book 4. And therein lies the problem for me--was totally disappointed on the outcome of the last 2 books. It just didn't quite measure up to the first two books, especially the build up in book 2 where it ended in a (seriously) cliffy. I couldn't even wait for the next one to come, I practically stalked Amazon making sure I didn't miss it. To my chagrin, it was a big disappointment for me. It pretty much covered their day to day lives, like going out to dinner, the evryday going to work, going to functions once in a while and some flashbacks here and there. The only part that got exciting was really at the end. So this 4th book started where the 3rd left off, and the chase begun. Lola one step ahead of Beau so on to another city, he pretty much chase her from city to the next and ended up almost bac to LA. Beau gets down on his kness and begs for forgiveness. Lola played a little hard to get but took him back, of course, she gives Beau the big news...and off they rode into the sunset...ho hum!

I love the tension and the emotional rollercoaster ride this takes you on, there was something about this book that seemed to have even more depth, emotion & richness.The pace never slips and your interest is kept from beginning to end. From the first page you are instantly drawn to Angela, who is not just another typical, clingy and full of angst heroine as one would expect. She is both sincere, smart and gutsy yet so innocent, which is a rare thing to find these days. However, the great thing about Ms.Nissenson is that she always develops both the heroine's and hero's character equally well. Nick Manning is not just a typical playboy, which makes a nice change. It is nice to see that such a dominating person, could be so vulnerable. Nick and Angela are a fictional couple who jump out of the page because Janet makes them real and believable.The remaining cast is made up of a colourful, exciting array of individuals, each with their own past, quirks and motivations. Ms. Nisseson has put a lot of effort into making every single character an enigma, and the richness of the supporting cast adds to the story big time. I find this book so engaging I wouldn't and couldn't put it down if my life dependent on it. (Lol) amazing!!! is what comes to mind to best describe this...here's hoping there's a follow-up book.  an ARC was provided for a truthful and candid review

Where else can I begin, excpt to say that Ms.Le Carre only gets better and better with every book she writes, unforgettable characters, sizzling romance, hot intense sex scenes that sizzles and riveting suspense: These are the trademarks of beloved author, Georgia Le Carre. As usual, Ms.Le Carre has carefully spun a tale that is guaranteed to snare and entrap you from the very start, like falling in a quicksand and no way of getting out. The story flows well and I felt all sorts of emotions---anguish, disbelief, apprehension, sadness and pride. Yes, pride for Lily for being incredibly brave despite a life altering great chance of being killed to avenge her brother's untimely death. Resolute in entrapping the effervescent, delicious, sex on legs manwhore, Jake Eden, who's as mysterious and dark as the night, only to be caught off guard on how unsettling he made her feel when their eyes locked for the first time. What follows next was an up and down fleeting moments with Jake -- sex... hot, steamy! Everyday life with him filled with danger and uncertainties, yet, Lily is helpless to avoid and deny herself the pleasure of being with the enigmatic, Jake EdenEDEN is an intriguing as they come, it's a heartwrenching tale about a young girl's shattered dreams and her fight for survival while going undercover for an even more crooked crime investigators. The author has magically created a tale guaranteed to hook you from the start to finish. But more compelling than her will to survive was the burning need to see the ones responsible for her brother's demise punished for their crimes.If you want slow and sensuous, a strong, gorgeous, mysterious, dark and brooding lover at the end of your journey, buy this book, it's the next best thing. Georgia is at her best in this evocative book about Lily Hart, in search for answers, her sole existence is focused on revenge for her beloved brother's untimely death. Willing to go to seedy places, sacrifice her safety that almost cost her her own life.The plot is complex enough to keep the reader interested to the very end. The main and secondary characters are well developed, the suspense and passion in this book are arresting. Georgia never sinks to the banal, this is not another run-of-the-mill story we seem to be reading nowadays.This has a plot, and plenty of it. There is mystery, hair raising danger, really hot sex enough to light up the whole city block, the suspense and action added to erotic love scenes is incredible. Jake and Lily are irresistable as the lovers whom you know in your heart will make you truly believe that love makes anything possible! They're true-to-life, three dimensional and so real that their emotions jump from the pages and weave themselves around you making the story come to life vividly.Jake Eden is the absolute definition of a romantic hero.Ms Le Carre has a keen talent to make you experience her work and feel as if you've stepped into the story. Her secondary characters are just as fleshed out as her main characters and become quite real themselves.Her three dimensional characters, complex, original plots and intelligently written narratives make her work stand out for sheer excellence. Sometimes I think they don't write books like this anymore, but Ms.Le Carre certainly does! I love this book so much I didn't want it to end, and I know I will read it over and over again. A perfect ending to a perfect story!

Where else can I begin, excpt to say that Ms.Le Carre only gets better and better with every book she writes, unforgettable characters, sizzling romance, hot intense sex scenes that sizzles and riveting suspense: These are the trademarks of beloved author, Georgia Le Carre. I have read every single novel she has published, her three dimensional characters, complex, original plots and intelligently written narratives make her work stand out for sheer excellence. This will keep you riveted from the first Book to the final end, you'll experience so many emotions and such intense feelings. Jake and Lily are irresistable as the lovers whom you know in your heart will make you truly believe that love makes anything possible! They're true-to-life, three dimensional and so real that their emotions jump from the pages and weave themselves around you making the story come to life vividly.Jake Eden is the absolute definition of a romantic hero.Ms Le Carre has a keen talent to make you experience her work and feel as if you've stepped into the story. Her secondary characters are just as fleshed out as her main characters and become quite real themselves. I love this book so much I did not want it to end, and I know I will read it over and over again. A perfect ending to a perfect story!

Like most of Georgia Le Carre's novels, this one also centers around a beautiful and brave heroine. However, each and every one of these novels are different in content as well as in plot. You might think you know how it's going to end, you'll be surprised to find it's so different from what you thought it's going to be. Sometimes I think they don't write books like this anymore, but Ms.Le Carre certainly does!If you want slow and sensuous, a strong, gorgeous, mysterious, dark and brooding lover at the end of your journey, buy this book, it's the next best thing. Georgia is at her best in this evocative book about Lily Hart, in search for answers, her sole existence is focused on revenge for her beloved brother's untimely death. Willing to go to seedy places, sacrifice her safety that almost cost her her own life.The plot is complex enough to keep the reader interested to the very end. The main and secondary characters are well developed, the suspense and passion in this book are arresting. Georgia never sinks to the banal, this is not another run-of-the-mill story we seem to be seeing nowadays.This has a plot, and plenty of it. There is mystery, hair raising danger, really hot sex enough to light up the whole city block, the suspense and action added to erotic love scenes is incredible. Be warned...this ends with a hold your breath cliffhanger. But equally lucky for those who didnt have to wait, (like some of us)...the final book is out!

EDEN is an intriguing and heartwrenching tale about a young girl's shattered dreams and her fight for survival while going undercover for an even more crooked crime investigators. The author has carefully spun a tale that is guaranteed to hook you from the start. But more compelling than her will to survive was the burning need to see the ones responsible for her brother's demise punished for their crimes. As usual, Ms.Le Carre has carefully spun a tale that is guaranteed to snare and entrap you from the very start,  like falling in a quicksand and no way of getting out. The story flows well and I felt all sorts of emotions---anguish, disbelief, apprehension, sadness and pride. Yes, pride for Lily for being incredibly brave despite a life altering great chance of being killed to avenge her brother's untimely death. Resolute in entrapping the effervescent, delicious, sex on legs manwhore, Jake Eden, who's as mysterious and dark as the night, only to be caught off guard on how unsettling he made her feel when their eyes locked for the first time. What follows next was an up and down fleeting moments with Jake -- sex... hot, steamy! Everyday life with him filled with danger and uncertainties, yet, Lily is hopeless to avoid and deny herself from the pleasure of being with the enigmatic Jake Eden. Ahh, just can't wait to start the next book to see what Georgia has in store for this absorbing and amazing duo.

And gives you an unbelievable story and turns it to not only believable but makes you hungry for more! This is well-written with just the right infusion of tension to keep the reader turning its pages. While its quirks and whims seemed predictable, not all are. There are more than enough surprises for even the most jaded of readers will find absorbing and riveting. It is a wonderful story-within-a-story of greed, love, and redemption.The characters are worth knowing and the ones that are not make the story the terrific tension filled that it becomes. It is captivating and beautifully written.DISFIGURED LOVE just further proves to me that Ms.Georgia Le Carre is as good of a suspense writer as a romance writer. Even though to some  readers parts of the book get a bit hard to take, it will keep you turning the pages long into the night. As the intricate plot unfolds, Georgia Le Carre expertly weaves the story together with twists and turns, and shocks at every bend, an enthralling yarn that grabs hold from the start and doesn't let go. No author has, as successfully, jumped from romance writing to the thriller arena, as Ms.Le Carre has, and I don't think anyone will. As with her previous novels, Georgia has penned another blockbuster destined for the number one spot on all the charts!There's a memorable scene in the book where Lena takes one last look at the chairs lined up against the wall, occupied previously by her sisters before they were sold, so nostalgic that it truly sunked in my heart. I felt that gut punching, unequivocal loss as if they were mine. How many authors can accomplish such a feat, giving us a memorable love story combined with heartbreaking story of grief, death and perdtion...with an exciting, unexpected conclusion that makes the reader feel satisfied. A MUST read! One of the many VERY BEST of Ms.Georgia Le Carre!

It's the coolest free thing I have ever received! I find it so convenient seeing the life of my battery without having to exit from what I'm doing or reading. I used to have to stop whatever I'm working on just to see how much cell I have which gets annoying when you're really pressed for time. Just one glance on top of your tablet or computer and its there, telling you exactly how much time you have before your battery quits on you, and its free, imagine that! Love it!

I can't seem to process what just happened between Beau and Lola--one moment they were making wild, passionate love, next she's going to leave Johnny for him, then--WHAM! It got unbelievably crazy it felt like I got hit by a four wheeler truck. Gosh almighty, it totally blindsided me! What the phok is Beau thinking? I was so in love with him then he turns around and delivered a shocker that knocked me out of breath!Lola was devastated and bewildered, couldn't believe all is real and not just a dream, a nightmare. After going through the scariest life altering experience with Beau, where they could both have lost their life, Lola realized she's fallen hopelessly in love with Beau. The morning after their incredibly hot night together and the night to remember, the morning after, that can never be forgotten and will alter Lola's life forever. Blinded by her love and lust, Lola set out to do exactly what Beau asked, leave Johnny and come to him. As she was about to use Beau's cell phone to call Johnny, a text from Beau's "sister", Bridgette, popped on the screen, so cryptic and foreboding that Lola felt her blood run cold. The confrontation ensued, truth revealed, secrets so devastating it's breathtaking. It literally took my breath away. Beau, so beautiful, is in truth a monster. Lola thought he might as well have slapped her, she almost wished he had, because at least she'd be able to feel her pain in a physical way. Instead of as a gaping hole in her heart. But she wasn't finished with Beau, not by a long shot, he'd made mistakes thinking she wasn't paying attention. He'd committed the greatest crime there was--he'd played with love. And nobody should ever be able to get away with that. No, she wasn't finished with Beau, she would break him too. Somehow, some way, Beau would get what he deserved. She wasn't sure how, or when, she only knew one thing, Beau Olivier would be sorry he'd ever laid eyes on her...and the game has just began.The ending just pho king ripped me apart, it's all I could think about, it follows me from room to room. I've lost some sleep over it, so consuming , and yet, I wouldn't have it any other way.Read this, but not before the first book, NIGHT FEVER, you'll love it, and it's not just a guarranty...it's a promise!

WOW!!! I'm practically out of breath, I just read one of the best books ever! A great combination of suspense, angst, love and romance, it oozes with hot steamy sex.Despite the struggle and all that stand between them, the strong bond and true love held Sebastian and Aria together and made them stronger. This is one of the best Ms.Wollfe have written and would remain in my to be read again shelf, and one of my most favorites. READ this, you'll be thanking me! Did I say I LOVE THIS BOOK? Oh, yeah!!!    **** an arc was provided bc is NetGalley ****

This is as steamy and addicting as it can get, swear I can't seem to get enough. The more I learn of Sebastian and Aria's past and secrets, the more I want to know. This is just getting more. complicated and truly absorbing, the presence of one of my favorite couple, Ethan Frost and Chloe Girard, made this even so much more interesting.~~~ an arc was provided by NetGalley ~~

This just got better and hotter! It's a real struggle to put it down. I can't seem to express my excitement enough how incredibly consuming this has become. It's all I think about as I really can't wait to get to the next book and devour it. Read this and I guarantee you'll love it just as much as I did!!!

As I rushed to finish the first to get to 2nd book, I realized as I read along, that I would again be doing exactly that--read real fast to get to the 3rd book and the 4th and the next and OMG, I am totally awed, hook, line and sinker.In this 2nd book, Aria crossed paths with the absolute gorgeous hunk, Sebastian, CEO of Atlantis, a prestgious hotel casino where she works as a waitress. And what an encounter it was, it's as if this two were struck by a lightning bolt. You could literally see sparks flying it could light up a whole city block, the heat so palpable it singes. To hear both their povs makes it even more believable knowing both can't seem to get each other out of their minds. So consumed with the hottest mind and soul shattering sex they had. Heck, even I, couldn't get it out of my mind and I wasn't even there! (wish I was ;)-Sebastian is one hot, incredible, super uber sex god whose one focus is to give Aria the night she will forever remember, and boy, did she ever!!*** an arc was provided by NetGalley ***

This is by far one of the best book in a series that had me so hooked I was reading so fast to get to the next. It is written so well that every word used to describe Aria's desperation to escape her fathers destructive grasp and the brutal man he expects her to marry, had me scrambling to speed read. Just couldn't wait to get to know what happens next, so eager to hear more of her thoughts and get to know her more.I have yet to read the next and the rest of the series, yet I already know this is one I would keep in my to be read again shelf. an arc was provided by NetGalley

One word to describe this...ASTOUNDING! From the start to finish my heart was captured, I was made a big believer that LOVE CONQUERS all. It is a roller coaster ride of emotions that will keep you riveted from beginning to end.Self preservation, hardship, controversy and conflict of interest and profession drove Brady and Liz apart. Despite all trials and heartache, this incredible duo fought against all odds and found their way back into each others arms, what follows is a love story that is poignant and romantic.Ms.Linde's talent and incredible story telling ability brought all her characters come to life. You can literally feel all their agonizing moments jump out of the pages and surround you. You'll experience such intense feelings--love, grief, joy, sadness, frustration...that when you're finished you'll feel like you've just stepped off an emotional ride of a lifetime. Each character have their own story to tell and I couldn't help but fall madly in love with every one of them. This is simply mesmerizing it was a struggle to give it up and say goodbye when the inevitable ending came. Ahh, my heart, my aching  wishes there's more of this beautiful enigmatic duo.

Anything written by Ms.Jessica Hawkins is pure bliss to read. It has all the elements you're looking for a book. One thing you need to know before reading one, know that you have all the time and absolutely can not be interrupted because it'll be a struggle to put it down.This is the tale of three strong characters, two (Johnny and Lola) are struggling to keep the bar they bar tend and manage, keep it afloat and stay in business. And the other, Beau, is incredibly wealthy, knows and gets what he want when he wants, a hunk and sinfully devil may care handsome. Together this three renders the readers totally fascinated, intrigued and in awe of that awesome feeling of being torn, should they or should they not accept the proposal.Lola and Beau's undeniably breathtaking animal magnetism is so palpable, the desire so great they are doomed to succumbed to. All the other readers review are all so true, and if I may add, it is full of heat, seduction, so alluring it is pure pleasure to read.

There's no way you can go wrong with $9.99! It has a smooth, soft luxurious feel to it. They do run a little smaller than the actual size but lucky for me, I listened to other reviewers advice, I ordered one size larger than my usual size and it was a perfect fit. If you're concerned of showing your less than perfect arms but want to wear a sexy sleeveless dress, this is heaven sent answer to that dilemma. I couldn't believe it cost less than ten bucks for the feel and the looks and the joy I got from wearing it.The only downside, it only came in black, if they were available in many colors, I would have a closet full of them.

From the moment I started this book to the very end, my mind was so wrapped up with the story it was a struggle to put it down. The heat and passion, the gripping suspense, knee deep in grifter- mafia deception , it has a bit of everything that makes a book a delightful read. I love this book so much I suffered and paid for it the next day for staying up all night. This is one I would keep in my shelf to be read again and again.

If you're like me, who's read almost all the reviews before starting to read this book, you might end up undecided if you should or should just pass it up. I almost did, and a travesty it would be if I passed it up for this is one of the best books I've read.As uncertain as I was in the beginning , I persevered and made it to the finish line, and what a finish it was. Though I did some skimming, mostly on things that were written at length I thought was unnecessary. Such Adelia's parents courtship, equestrian-equine husbandry, steeplechasing, etc. It was so drawn out it got a little too tedious to read. To me, they're simply fillers and in my opinion, a waste of the writer's time and effort. I admit it is a well balanced combination of a lot of things I like in a book and has all the elements of what makes a story shine, distinct.Devastated by the loss of her beloved parents, Adelia tried to put her life back together by pursuing her dream to become a number one equestrian and compete in the Olympics. At a party given for the winners, Adelia met the conniving, scheming, devious, cunning woman that ever existed on planet earth, Karolin, who then introduced Adelia to her twin brother, Miles. It didn't take long before this two dated seriously, sex hot and heavy, oodles of steamy sultry sex scenes, married and got pregnant.I really like that there's a fusion of scheming, black mailing, bitterness, dark secrets that can ultimately destroy the love and fragile bond of Miles and Adelia, trust the deceitful and cunning Karolin to make sure of that. How I love calling her all kinds of names, trust me it's befitting. But thanks to women like Karolin, the devil incarnate, it makes up for an entertaining interesting read.I'm looking forward to reading the next book, sans the unnecessary fillers, I really think this has a great potential to become a bestseller, I even see it as a blockbuster movie film. It would have been a big loss on my part had I decided to skip this entirely. Ms. Belle Ami is a force to be rockened with, just can't wait to get my greedy hands on the 2nd book. Congratulations Ms.Ami, well done!!!  an arc was provided by NetGalley

A May-November affair and one to remember. It had a sneaky, bawdy, risque sexy romp that'll bring out that hidden natural naughtiness in you. It'll tickle you pink, red and hot you can't help let your imagination run wild. That "first time" in Dean's private office, it was  extremely scorching, blistering hot! The things the sexy millionaire, breathtakingly handsome, Dean, would tell and command the naive, young and beautiful, Alexandra James, to do, are wild, naughty and spicy, all of which Alex can't help but obey.I really didn't think their affair would go anyhere but oh boy, was I wrong! And the ending was so sweet and romantic, I wish Ms.Hawkins would make it into a real long full length story, I fell in love with Dean and Alex I refuse to let them go.

Can this get any hotter? When I read the complete series of UNRESTRAINED series, I was in awe, utterly! I was so sad that it was over I was left feeling bereft. So engaged with Kate McDermott's conflicting emotions I was so sure there'll never be any book out there more consuming than this.Enter...DRAKE RESTRAINED, hearing from Drake's POV somehow rendered more meaning, consuming, juicy and intriguing, in other words, beautifully written!The incredible passion that ignites within Drake every encounter with Kate, so exquisitely painful that shoots straight to his "jetty" and keeps him in perpetual "attention"  He's so consumed with his indescribable desire all he can think of is pho king Kate. His desire to make Kate his sub sends him in a frenzy of carnal thoughts, arousing and sinfully dirty things he would do to her, with her, to seduce her and make her his. Hearing all this from Drake sends me in a tizzy, phew, it's so hot here! Can't help daydreaming of a man like Drake, my all time hottie!(sigh!)

I'm of two minds about this product- I really like the matte (peach) but I'm less enthusiastic about the dewy (pink) side.The matte side I have been using on the areas next to my nose, where I have large pores and roseacea. It blurs the pores nicely, but barely has enough tint to deal with some of the roseacea. It goes on smooth and silky, and almost instantly feels dry. I like that, having very oily skin in that area. It doesn't last all day, but it has a nice compact and is easy enough to deal with in the middle of the day. I've used it on clean skin and also over oil free sunscreen; it doesn't seem to matter. It works fine either way. I have not tried it over makeup yet but I think it should work fine, because the foundation I use is also oil free (silicon base like the sunscreen).The dewy side I've used on my cheekbones and above my eyes and I have to be really careful not to use too much, because it stays a little sticky if I use even a hair too much, and that drives me batty. Used very sparingly, though, it creates a nice, fresh, look.Neither side has made me break out, and I break out if I put anything remotely oily on my skin.I think this is a really nice product if you have break through in oily areas of your skin, because it's easy to carry and super easy to apply.

This science fiction/horror tale is totally agenda driven. Its about the day that toxic waste, thrown into the creeks, rivers, and earth, become sentient and rise up against humans. Its about as subtle as a sledge hammer with its message that we are destroying the earth.Written in 1991, the novel is sited in the town of Paradise, Pennsylvania, a small to medium sized city. Its large enough to have some industry, and that industry creates waste. So there is a company that deals with relieving businesses of their waste. Problem is, they are not very particular about disposing of said waste. Their subcontractors- redneck yahoos who consider out of sight, out of mind a good working plan- arent any more particular. One day as they dump 55 gallon drums into the creek, the creek itself- joined with the waste already there- rises up. Then there is the nuclear power plant in the county that is starting to sing to itself as all hell breaks looseIts a very grim novel, with lots of vivid gore; the descriptions of what happens to the humans is revolting. I didnt realize until after I read the book that they authors are considered splatter punk kings. There are a lot of characters in the book; sometimes its hard to keep track of them. Sadly, none are fleshed out at all. They are just puppets doing their jobs for the story. The plot is also lacking. The book is powerful, but still a letdown because of that.

Violet, Audrey, and Bert are three young people with dreams in 1938 Hollywood, all working at Selznick International studio. Violet wants a husband. Audrey wants to be a film star. Bert wants to go back to college and become an ornithologist. Bert also dreams of Audrey; he has such a massive crush on her he cant see anything but her. And Audrey and Violet have secrets as well as dreams; secrets that could easily destroy those dreams.Their lives play out as Gone With the Wind gets filmed at the studio, starting with the massive burning of Atlanta scenes. After the movie finishes, Audrey and Bert leave Selznick Studio, but the three remain close friends. The story takes us through WW II and after. Audrey and Violet have times when their friendship threatens to implode, but somehow things work out. The story is framed with short chapters set in 2012, when Violets family is cleaning out the bungalow where she and Audrey lived, and a vintage hat accidently gets sent to the consignment store. The hat is one anyone would recognize: its the green velvet hat Scarlet OHara made out of her mothers drapes. How did this come to be in Violets possession?I was disappointed. I couldnt manage to like Violet; she came across as sweet and innocent at first but turned out to be very manipulative. Audrey was okay, but kind of flat. Bert is just a prop for the women to use. They just didnt seem real and the dialogue is stilted. Its almost like the book was a first draft, and the author needed to go back and flesh out the people. Not unreadable but only 3 out of 5 stars. I did really enjoy the parts about the filming of GWTW.

I have used Scharffen Berger's baking chocolate before (makes the best flourless chocolate cake EVER), but had not had their eating chocolate before. There are four types of chocolate in this jar- which is quite large and would make a great holiday gift.The milk chocolate is 41% cacao and is the best milk chocolate I've ever tasted. I normally don't even eat milk chocolate I dislike it so much. This, I could eat endlessly. It's smooth, silky, and has a lot of flavor instead of just tasting like wax.The semisweet is 62% cacao and it has some bitterness to it. It's still pretty smooth and is definitely stronger in cacao than supermarket semisweet. It has some interesting nuances to it; kind of spicy and coffee like.The bittersweet is 70% cacao and it's surprisingly grainy, rather like bars with partially ground nibs in them. I don't find this graininess unpleasant. The flavor has a LOT of nuances to it; vanilla, spice, and something I can't identify.The extra dark is 82% cacao, which is slightly less than Lindt's 85 and 90% bars, but for some reason it tastes darker. It's more complex. The texture is about the same as the Lindt, with perhaps just a little bit of graininess. For some reason the adjective 'winey' comes to mind when tasting it.This would make a great gift to the dark chocolate lover but probably not for the milk chocolate aficionado as even the milk chocolate is pretty intense. The little bars (5 gm each) are a great size for a pick me up or a couple for finishing off a meal- the darkness and flavorfulness of the chocolate means you don't need a lot of them to be satisfied. They stand up well to tea and coffee, but not red wine. I didn't try them with white wine.

LeFanu is highly thought of by a lot of horror aficionados, so I was exciting to have a chance to read this book. Dovers edition is not the full volume that was published in the 40s; this book has four stories in it. Green Tea is the tale of a man haunted because hes overstimulated his brain and body with, well, green tea; a demon of sorts follows him everywhere. Squire Tobys Will is the tale of a father and two sons, and what happens when a parent favors one child too much over the other, creating hatred that transcends the grave. The Fortunes of Robert Ardagh and Sir Dominics Bargain are both deals with the devil tales, the second being a superior story. Ardagh fails to deliver the creepiness for some reason.LeFanus prose is lovely, if slow, to read. It comes from the era where something being a fast read wasnt a concern. Its ornamental and lyrical in high Gothic manner. It creates an air of extreme tension in Green Tea, and dread in the others. If you like old school horror, try these tales.

Iris and Her Friends is the second book John Bayley wrote about his wife, novelist and Oxford don Iris Murdoch, and her decline from Alzheimers disease. The term her friends does not refer to people in her life, but to the compensations that her disease brings with it- the fact that she nearly instantly forgets bad things that happen, the warmth of simply holding someone you love, and that she no longer has to obey rules of decorum. Bayley, who had a lot of time to examine all facets of their life while caring for Iris (he took care of her at home up until a couple of weeks before her death), seems to have been determined to see all sides of the situation.Most of the book is about Bayleys life before meeting Iris. He reminisces about his childhood and young adulthood while lying in bed, unable to sleep because Iris is not settled into sleep herself. He was a bookish, introverted lad who stood apart from his older brothers (and his parents) in having no love for golf- they lived on a golf course. He spent most of his childhood playing by himself. While boarding school was hell for him, he took to the military quite well- he knew what was expected of him there. These memories are interspersed with the daily life of caring for Iris- walks, meals (spoon feedings), and the odd habits she developed as her disease progressed. Through it all, despite occasional episodes of rage on his part due to sheer frustration, is the love that held them together for so many decades.While not as incredible a book as Elegy for Iris, its a thoughtful and moving treatise on love and loss- when the person you lose is still right in front of you.

In The Silvered, the world is similar to ours during the Victorian era. Except there are werewolves, mages who can control different elements, and magical artifacts from the past. There are also guns and airships. Its vaguely steampunk in feel, even though there is no actual steam technology.Mirian Maylin, 19 years old, has some mage blood. She has tested as having powers in several elements, but has not progressed beyond first level in any of them. She has been invited to *not* come back to the university next semester because she performs so poorly. Her mothers biggest worry is that Marian might not attract the attention of someone of the Pack, and marry into it. Marian does not care if she ever gets married.We start the book with a war beginning; the Empire is attacking the country of Aydori and has declared Pack members to be abominations. A rather garbled warning from a Soothsayer has Emperor Leopald kidnap the top five members of the Mage pack. Mirian finds herself in the position to follow the Mage pack to the Empires capital city and try and rescue them. She also finds herself in the company of Tomas Hagen, younger brother to the Pack leader, and, with Captain Reiter of the Empire forces following her because they think shes the missing sixth member of the Mage pack.I really liked the characters; Mirian is strong, smart, and stubborn (and, according to Hunt Pack members, smells amazing- a sign of mage powers) and she and Tomas have to grow up a lot in just a few days. While they find themselves partners by chance, they work very well together. Likewise the kidnapped Mage pack leader, Danika, has to face great personal loss along with physical and psychological abuse but stands up to it. I should warn you there is a lot of brutality in this book; its set during a war and it doesnt bring out the best in a lot of the soldiers. It also shows the peril of dehumanizing others; it makes it far too easy for people to discount the worth of their lives.The book ties up all the loose ends- even though as I got near the end of the book I couldnt figure out how the author would manage that in such a short number of pages. But Id forgotten how good a writer and world builder Tanya Huff is; parts of the ending are very unexpected, its neatly done, and, while this is a standalone novel, there are a few things that could lead into another volume set in this world if she wanted. Im hoping shell do so!

I'm not even sure where to start talking about this program. It's so huge and does so many things that I'm completely overwhelmed.I should say that I've been using an ancient paint/draw program- Photo Impact 8. Before that, I had Corel Draw 3 & PhotoPaint. So, I'm way behind the times. But I have been a constant user of paint and draw software, using it for illustrations to accompany articles.Painter 2016 combines both photo manipulation and drawing from scratch. It allows you to mimic real world drawing/painting techniques (oils, inks, watercolors, pastels- you name it, it's got it) and some techniques that are unique to digital media. And obviously, you can combine the two. Some of the natural techniques have been improved: in the real world, you have different textures of substrate, and they most often have grain to them.
